description: If infected (wall >3 mm)

name: Smooth margins, thin wall
description: Wall <2 mm

name: Beak sign

name: Anechoic

name: Beak Sign/Notch Sign

name: Fluid attenuation

name: Hyperintense
description: T2-weighted imaging. Uniformly fluid signal.

name: Hypointense

name: Thin wall

name: Unrestricted Diffusion
description: Dark on DWI, unless superinfected. Helps differentiate from abscess.

name: Well-circumscribed mass
description: Non-enhancing, unilocular mass.

name: Central T2 hyperintensity
description: Fluid

name: Complex mass

name: Mobile internal echoes
description: Debris/pus

name: Peripheral hypervascularity

name: Posterior enhancement
description: Typical (fluid content)

name: Restricted diffusion
description: DWI

name: Amorphous calcifications
description: BI-RADS 4B, 15-25% malignancy risk

name: Fine linear calcifications
description: BI-RADS 5, >95% malignancy risk

name: Pleomorphic calcifications
description: BI-RADS 4C, 25-50% malignancy risk

name: Skin calcifications
description: ≥3 mm, BI-RADS benign, <2% malignant.

name: Vascular calcifications
description: Parallel, BI-RADS benign, <2% malignant.

name: Amorphous calcifications
description: Calcifications with indistinct shapes. 21% malignant.

name: Angular/Spiculated margins
description: Margins that are angular or spiculated

name: Architectural distortion
description: 20% malignant

name: Architectural distortion
description: Star-like appearance without a central mass. 48% malignancy rate.

name: Architectural Distortion
description: Traditional CAD has low sensitivity for architectural distortion without a central mass.

name: Architectural Distortion
description: Disruption of normal breast architecture

name: Asymmetry
description: Density difference between breasts

name: BI-RADS category
description: Category 4: 2-95% malignancy risk

name: Calcifications
description: CAD marks calcifications with rectangles or triangles. CAD has very high sensitivity (>98%) for detecting amorphous or fine pleomorphic calcifications.

name: Calcifications extending beyond invasive mass
description: Indicates DCIS component and true extent of disease.

name: Cancer detection
description: Mammography audits require ≥90% sensitivity in cancer detection

name: Cancer Detection Rate (CDR) below benchmark
description: CDR < 2.5/1,000 suggests potential issues in cancer detection.

name: Central/Chaotic vascularity
description: Vascularity within the mass, often chaotic, with RI >0.75

name: Chest Wall Invasion
description: Enhancement of intercostal muscles or serratus anterior.

name: Clustered ring enhancement
description: Multiple ring-enhancing lesions clustered together (specificity 94% for DCIS).

name: Cortical thickness > 3 mm in axillary node
description: Most specific predictor of axillary metastasis.

name: Dermal invasion
description: Involvement of the skin.

name: Early enhancement
description: Rapid gadolinium uptake in the first 2 minutes post-contrast due to increased capillary permeability.

name: Enhancing mass or non-mass enhancement
description: BPE can obscure enhancing lesions, reducing sensitivity of MRI for detecting breast cancer.

name: False negatives due to tissue superposition
description: Inadequate compression leads to tissue superposition, increasing false negatives by 28%.

name: FDG-avid lesion
description: HER2+ breast cancers can be FDG-avid on PET.

name: Fine-linear calcifications
description: Calcifications are small (0.1-0.3 mm) and linear in shape.

name: High-density mass
description: Mass density is predominantly glandular (>75%).

name: High Cancer Detection Rate (CDR)
description: CDR: 10-30/1,000 (high-risk populations)

name: Hypoechoic Masses
description: Require biopsy if suspicious (BI-RADS 4/5)

name: Irregular calcifications
description: Irregular calcifications in the breast parenchyma. PPV 15-20%

name: Irregular margins
description: OR 3.2

name: Irregular mass
description: Mass with irregular shape. 67% malignant.

name: Irregular mass
description: Mass with irregular shape

name: Irregular Mass Shape
description: Mass shape is neither oval nor round, raising suspicion for malignancy.

name: Irregular shape
description: Mass lesion with irregular shape (80% malignant)

name: Loss of fatty hilum in axillary node
description: Suspicious finding for axillary metastasis.

name: Lymphatic Channel Visualization
description: A linear trail of activity leading away from the injection site.

name: Mass
description: New or growing mass

name: Mass with Circumscribed Margins
description: Mass with circumscribed margins, low risk of malignancy (2%).

name: Mass with Obscured Margins
description: Mass with obscured margins, moderate risk of malignancy (8%).

name: Masses
description: CAD marks masses with asterisks, circles, or ovals. CAD has moderate sensitivity (75-89%) for detecting masses, which decreases in dense breasts.

name: Microcalcifications
description: Especially fine linear calcifications, associated with DCIS. Amorphous, pleomorphic, and fine linear calcifications have increasing malignancy risk.

name: Microcalcifications
description: Small calcifications (<0.3 mm) in clusters

name: Missed medial lesions
description: Rotated CC view increases the likelihood of missing medial lesions by 33%.

name: Missed microcalcifications
description: High noise levels in mammographic images reduce the detection rate of microcalcifications.

name: New parenchymal mass
description: New parenchymal mass. PPV 12-18%

name: Non-hilar cortical blood flow in axillary node
description: Suspicious finding for axillary metastasis.

name: Non-mass enhancement
description: Enhancement without a discrete mass, ≥1 cm linear distribution suggests malignancy.

name: Non-mass enhancement with clumped internal pattern
description: Non-mass enhancement with clumped internal pattern (LR 2.9)

name: Non-mass enhancement with clustered ring internal pattern
description: Non-mass enhancement with clustered ring internal pattern (LR 5.5)

name: Non-mass enhancement with linear distribution
description: Non-mass enhancement with linear distribution (LR 1.8)

name: Non-mass enhancement with segmental distribution
description: Non-mass enhancement with segmental distribution (LR 2.7)

name: Non-parallel orientation
description: Mass oriented non-parallel to the skin

name: Obscured masses due to glandular tissue overlap
description: Poor compression during mammography leads to increased glandular tissue overlap, potentially masking masses. Mean lesion masking of 4.2mm.

name: Occult cancer due to missed posterior tissue
description: 42% of cancers are occult on MLO-only views due to missed posterior tissue.

name: Pleomorphic calcifications
description: Calcifications with variable shapes and sizes. 53% malignant.

name: Positive Predictive Value (PPV3) below benchmark
description: PPV3 (BI-RADS 4/5) < 20% suggests potential issues in positive predictive value.

name: Positive Predictive Value (PPV3) below benchmark
description: PPV3 < 10% suggests potential issues in positive predictive value.

name: Posterior acoustic shadowing
description: Shadowing posterior to the mass, indicating desmoplastic reaction

name: Posterior Acoustic Shadowing
description: Shadowing posterior to the mass, although spatial compounding may reduce this sign.

name: Posterior shadowing
description: Acoustic shadowing behind the mass.

name: Rapid enhancement and washout
description: Early phase >50% enhancement, delayed phase washout (10% decrease)

name: Restricted diffusion
description: ADC values ≤1.0 x10⁻³ mm²/s on DWI.

name: Restricted diffusion
description: ADC <1.1×10⁻³ mm²/s on DWI

name: Retroareolar lesion
description: Lesion located behind the nipple, especially concerning for Invasive Ductal Carcinoma.

name: Rim enhancement
description: Mass lesion with rim enhancement (70% malignant)

name: Rim enhancement
description: Enhancement only at the periphery of a mass (PPV 85% for malignancy).

name: Round morphology of axillary node
description: Suspicious finding for axillary metastasis.

name: Satellite Lesions
description: Additional ipsilateral cancer foci.

name: Segmental distribution of calcifications
description: Calcifications distributed in a ductal pattern. 50% malignant.

name: Sentinel Node Identification
description: The first 'hot' node visualized in a lymphatic basin.

name: Skin thickening
description: Thickening of the skin overlying the mass

name: Skin Thickening
description: > 2 mm suggests edema, lymphatic obstruction, or inflammatory carcinoma.

name: Spiculated margins
description: Mass lesion with spiculated margins (LR 4.6)

name: Spiculated margins
description: Margins of the mass are irregular and have radiating lines. Associated with 75-95% cancer risk.

name: Spiculated mass
description: BI-RADS 4, PPV 30%

name: Spiculated mass
description: Mass with irregular, radiating margins. 80% malignant.

name: Spiculated Mass
description: Mass with spiculated margins, high PPV for malignancy (92%).

name: Spiculated mass with plateau/washout
description: Spiculated mass with plateau or washout kinetics (BI-RADS 5).

name: T1 hypointense, T2 hyperintense mass with rapid early enhancement
description: Sensitivity 95%

name: Taller-than-wide orientation
description: The mass is taller than it is wide on ultrasound imaging (LR+ 3.4).

name: Taller-than-wide shape
description: OR 3.1

name: Type III (Washout) Kinetic Curve

name: Washout
description: >10% signal decrease after initial enhancement.

name: Washout pattern
description: Kinetic curve, 70% PPV for malignancy

name: Microcalcifications
description: Approx. 0.1 mm in size. Mammography requires high spatial resolution to detect them.

name: Subtle soft tissue distortions
description: Mammography requires high contrast resolution to detect them.

name: Rapid Initial Enhancement
description: Signal intensity increases rapidly in the first 2 minutes post-contrast (>100% increase).

name: Washout (Type III Curve)
description: Signal intensity decreases after the initial enhancement phase (after 2 minutes).

name: Decreased T2* Signal in Lymph Node

name: Increased FDG Uptake in Lymph Node
description: SUVmax >2.5 in lymph node.

name: Restricted Diffusion in Lymph Node
description: ADC <1.0×10⁻³ mm²/s in lymph node suggests malignancy.

name: Rim Enhancement of Lymph Node

name: Sentinel Lymph Node Identification

name: Clustered Microcysts

name: Simple Cysts
description: Anechoic, well-circumscribed lesion

name: Absence of Normal Breast Tissue Development

name: Heterogeneous internal echogenicity

name: Irregular capsule margin

name: Posterior acoustic shadowing

name: Radial folds

name: Stepladder sign

name: Central vascularity

name: Hypoechoic
description: Hypoechoic appearance on ultrasound.

name: Posterior shadowing

name: Spiculated margins

name: Cyst vs solid >0.5cm

description: Doppler RI <0.7

name: Microcalcifications

name: Oval mass with circumscribed margins

name: Lytic lesion with sclerotic rim
description: 1-4 cm lytic lesion with sclerotic rim

name: Bronchial artery diameter >2 mm
description: Enlarged bronchial artery diameter, normal is 1.5mm

description: >2mm

name: Caudate Hypertrophy
description: >10 cm length (vs. normal 6-8 cm)

description: >180 sec

name: Hepatic Vein Peak Velocity <10 cm/s

description: 'Mosaic' pattern in portal phase

Liver Attenuation

description: Normal 0.5-0.7

description: Signal intensity ratio liver/spleen >1.2

Venous Occlusion

description: Filling defects with >50% luminal stenosis

description: T2/FLAIR imaging

name: Normal/Isoattenuating

name: Capsular calcifications

name: Fibrous tissue thickening

name: Ventricular dilation/atrophy

name: Optimized crystal usage

name: Phase Analysis SD >25°

name: Intramural masses

description: Contrast-enhanced portal vein radical surrounded by the hypodense dilated bile duct.

name: Avid, homogeneous enhancement

name: Hyperintense

description: Post-contrast

name: Isointense to muscle

name: Well-defined soft tissue mass at carotid bifurcation
description: Appearance on CT

name: Widening of the carotid bifurcation
description: Appearance on angiography

name: Fracture gap

name: Carpal boss sign

name: Os Styloideum

name: Capitate migration >50% overlap with lunate
description: Advanced SLAC

name: Cortical ring sign
description: Scaphoid flexion

name: Disruption of Gilula's arcs
description: Indicates carpal misalignment

name: Dynamic scapholunate gap >5mm
description: Indicates instability

name: Fluid gap >3mm

name: Occult fractures
description: Scaphoid waist HU >300

name: Scaphoid ring sign

name: Scapholunate angle >70°

name: Scapholunate interval >3mm

name: Calcification

name: Cystic Changes

name: Decreased NAA

name: Elevated Choline

name: Heterogeneous enhancement

name: Heterogeneous isointense to hyperintense

name: Isodense to hyperdense compared to gray matter

name: Isointense to gray matter

name: Lobulated, well-circumscribed intraventricular mass

name: Restricted diffusion

name: Figure 3 Sign
description: Indentation of aorta at coarctation site + pre/post-stenotic dilation

name: Narrowing of aorta
description: 3D reconstruction, narrowing >50% diameter vs. adjacent aorta

name: Rib notching
description: Decreased sensitivity <5 years, onset >10 years

name: Rib Notching
description: Inferior rib erosion (ribs 3-8) due to collateral flow via intercostals. 1st and 2nd ribs are spared

name: 10-15mm thickened cortex with "pebbled" surface
description: Thickened cortex with an irregular, bumpy surface.

name: Hypointense signal
description: Hypointense signal on T2 SPACE sequence

name: Stump Sign
description: Indicates coil migration complication.

name: Ballooning of the frontal horns of the lateral ventricles
description: Sign of impending crisis.

name: Faint rim enhancement
description: May occur due to stretched septal veins or capsule.

name: Hyperdense lesion at Foramen of Monro
description: Approximately 66% of colloid cysts appear hyperdense on non-contrast CT. Located at the Foramen of Monro.

name: Hyperintense on FLAIR
description: Does not suppress (remains hyperintense if T1 bright).

name: Hyperintense on T1-weighted MRI
description: Most common appearance on T1-weighted imaging, due to high cholesterol/protein content.

name: Hypodense lesion at Foramen of Monro
description: Rare appearance on non-contrast CT.

name: Hypointense on T2-weighted MRI (Black Hole Effect)
description: Often hypointense centrally due to high viscosity and paramagnetic ions.

name: Isodense lesion at Foramen of Monro
description: Approximately 33% of colloid cysts appear isodense on non-contrast CT. Look for widening of the frontal horns.

name: Isointense on T1-weighted MRI
description: Common appearance on T1-weighted imaging.

name: No central enhancement
description: No central enhancement after gadolinium administration.

name: No diffusion restriction
description: Usually no restriction, unlike epidermoid cysts.

name: No enhancement
description: Usually no enhancement is seen after contrast administration.

name: Periventricular lucency
description: Sign of impending crisis, indicates interstitial edema.

name: Slit-like third ventricle
description: Sign of impending crisis.

name: Thin peripheral rim enhancement
description: Acceptable due to capsule/veins.

name: Unilateral or bilateral lateral ventricle dilatation
description: Due to obstruction at the Foramen of Monro.

name: Variable signal intensity on T2-weighted MRI
description: The most difficult sequence to predict. Signal intensity depends on viscosity.

name: Tube traversing the colon before entering the stomach
description: Feeding tube passes through the colon (typically transverse) before entering the stomach.

name: "Apple-core" constricting lesion
description: Classic appearance, but not specific to CRC.

name: Diffusion restriction
description: ADC <1.0×10⁻³ mm²/s suggests malignancy

name: Distance to Mesorectal Fascia (MRF) <= 1mm
description: Indicates positive Circumferential Resection Margin (CRM) and high risk of recurrence in rectal cancer.

name: Extramural vascular invasion (EMVI)
description: Serpentine tumor signal in vessels on T2-weighted images

name: Extramural Vascular Invasion (EMVI)
description: Serpentine tumor signal in vessels on T2-weighted images

name: Flat Serrated Polyps
description: Subtle plaque-like thickening, often right-sided.

name: Focal wall thickening
description: Non-specific finding; can be seen in other inflammatory or infectious conditions.

name: Increased FDG uptake
description: Useful for problem-solving equivocal CT findings and evaluating local recurrence.

name: Liver metastases
description: Hypodense lesions (30-45 HU vs normal liver 50-70 HU)

name: Liver metastases FDG uptake
description: Sensitivity 92% vs CT 76% for lesions >1 cm, Rim enhancement + central necrosis (SUVmax 6-12)

name: Lymph node FDG uptake
description: Short-axis ≥10 mm + SUVmax >3.5 → suspicious

name: Metastases
description: SUVmax: >10 (liver mets often photopenic)

name: Mucinous Tumor
description: HU values: 10-20 HU

name: Mucinous tumors
description: HU values: 10-20 HU

name: Mucinous tumors
description: HU values: 10-20 HU

name: Pedunculated polyps
description: Mushroom-shaped polyps.

name: Polyp
description: Detected with high sensitivity (96% for ≥10mm, 85% for 6-9mm)

name: Polyp detection
description: Sensitivity: 96% for ≥10mm polyps, 85% for 6-9mm polyps

name: Polyp detection
description: Sensitivity: ≥96% for polyps ≥10mm, 85% for 6-9mm

name: Polypoid mass
description: Non-specific finding; requires further characterization.

name: Primary Tumor
description: SUVmax: 5-15

name: Primary tumor FDG uptake
description: SUVmax typically 8-15 (vs normal colon: 2.5 ± 0.8), Focal uptake > liver background (liver SUVmean ~2.5)

name: Primary tumor wall thickening
description: Wall thickening >3 mm

name: Restricted Diffusion
description: ADC <1.0×10⁻³ mm²/s on DWI suggests malignancy

name: Sessile/Flat polyps
description: "Carpet" lesions; harder to detect.

name: Solid Tumor
description: HU values: 30-50 HU

name: Solid tumors
description: HU values: 30-50 HU

name: Solid tumors
description: HU values: 30-50 HU

name: Tumor
description: Intermediate signal on T2-weighted images (vs. hypointense muscularis propria)

name: Hyperechoic cloud of gas bubbles
description: The 'Cloud': As tissue heats to >100°C, water vaporizes. This creates a hyperechoic cloud of gas bubbles.

name: Low-attenuation area
description: Appears as a low-attenuation area on immediate post-ablation CT (24 hours).

name: No flow within the lesion
description: Post-ablation, color Doppler should show 0 flow within the lesion.

name: Posterior Acoustic Shadowing
description: The gas blocks sound waves, creating a 'dirty shadow' behind the ablation zone.

name: Reverberation from cholesterol crystals in adenomyomatosis
Reverberation from cholesterol crystals in adenomyomatosis
description: Indicative of adenomyomatosis

name: Decreased ADC values
description: ADC values <1.0 ×10⁻³ mm²/s (vs >1.4 normal).

name: Fascial herniation
description: 3-5mm defects in the fascia.

name: Fascial thickening
description: Fascial thickness >3mm.

name: Increased compartment width
description: Δ compartment width >2cm vs contralateral side.

name: Loss of muscle striations
description: Loss of normal muscle architecture on ultrasound.

name: Muscle swelling
description: Increased Hounsfield units (HU) from 50-70 to 80-100. Cross-sectional area increase >20% vs contralateral side.

name: Rim sign
description: Peripheral enhancement on STIR sequences.

name: T2 hyperintensity (muscle edema)
description: Increased signal intensity on T2-weighted images indicating edema within the muscle compartments.

name: Distal Retraction
description: >4.5cm from origin
pathology_name: Complete Tear (Long Head of Biceps Tendon - LHBT)

name: Empty Groove Sign
description: Absence of the LHBT in the bicipital groove
pathology_name: Complete Tear (Long Head of Biceps Tendon - LHBT)

name: Drooping lily sign
description: Inferiorly displaced lower pole moiety from obstructed ectopic upper pole ureter

name: Septal/Nodular Blood Flow
description: Detection of septal/nodular blood flow

name: Cortical Tunneling
description: Intracortical striations

name: Decreased Uptake
description: May be seen in children (cold CRPS)

name: Diffuse subcutaneous edema
description: Soft tissue finding

name: Increased Blood Pool (diffuse)
description: Increased blood pool on the soft tissue phase of a three-phase bone scan in acute CRPS

name: Increased Delayed Uptake (periarticular)
description: Increased uptake on the delayed skeletal phase of a three-phase bone scan in acute CRPS

name: Increased Flow (asymmetric)
description: Increased flow on the angiographic phase of a three-phase bone scan in acute CRPS

name: Muscle edema
description: Soft tissue finding

name: Nerve neuroma or entrapment
description: Identified by MRI neurography in Type II CRPS

name: Patchy, regional bone marrow edema
description: High T2/STIR, low T1 signal

name: Preservation of Joint Space
description: Key differentiator from arthritis

name: Skin thickening and enhancement
description: Skin finding

name: Small joint effusions
description: Joint finding

name: Soft tissue swelling
description: May be seen in the acute phase (0-3 months)

name: Spotty/Patchy Osteoporosis
description: Hallmark finding in subacute/chronic phase

name: Subperiosteal Resorption
description: Often mimics hyperparathyroidism but is regional

name: Anterior wedge deformity
description: Height loss >20%

name: Convex posterior border
description: Suggests malignancy

name: Cortical buckling
description: "Beak" sign

name: Epidural/paraspinal mass
description: Suggests malignancy

name: HU <100
description: Osteoporotic bone density (normal 150-300 HU)

name: Hyperintense edema
description: T2/STIR sequence, high sensitivity

name: Hypointense marrow
description: T1-weighted sequence, acute phase

name: Increased uptake
description: Acute fractures (<72 hours to 2 years)

name: Posterior element involvement
description: Suggests malignancy

name: Restricted diffusion
description: DWI sequence, suggests malignancy

name: Retropulsion >20% canal compromise
description: Indicates burst fracture

name: Trabecular condensation
description: Increased density of trabeculae

name: Calcification >130 HU
description: Increased Hounsfield units indicating calcification within conduit

name: Bilateral, giant adrenal myelolipomas
description: Associated with chronic ACTH stimulation in untreated CAH.

name: Abdominal organs in thoracic cavity
description: Stomach bubble at T4-T6 level

name: Absent/obscured hemidiaphragm contour
description: Loss of normal diaphragmatic silhouette

name: Bowel loops in hemithorax
description: Most commonly left-sided (95%)

name: Mediastinal shift
description: >15° from midline

name: NG tube tip above diaphragm
description: T3-T4 level

name: Polyhydramnios
description: AFI >25 cm

name: Air-fluid level
description: Present in varying percentages depending on the Stocker type (70% in Type 1, 30% in Type 2, absent in Type 3).

name: Anechoic cysts
description: Macrocytic CPAM (Type 1) appears as anechoic cysts on prenatal ultrasound.

name: Cystic lung lesion
description: Cysts of varying sizes depending on the Stocker type.

name: Enhancement
description: Septal (25% in Type 1), Peripheral (60% in Type 2), Diffuse (90% in Type 3).

name: HU values
description: Specific Hounsfield Unit (HU) ranges vary depending on the Stocker type (Type 1: -800 to +20, Type 2: -500 to +30, Type 3: +30 to +60).

name: Hyperechoic mass
description: Microcytic CPAM (Type 3) appears as a hyperechoic mass on prenatal ultrasound.

name: Hyperintense cysts
description: T2-weighted images show hyperintense cysts (signal >CSF in 40%).

name: Restricted diffusion
description: DWI shows restricted diffusion in solid components (ADC <1.1×10⁻³ mm²/s).

name: Wimberger Sign
description: Bilateral symmetric destruction of the medial proximal tibial metaphyses

name: Persistent Nephrogram
description: Persistent nephrogram (>24hrs)

name: Renal Enlargement
description: Enlarged kidneys

name: ADC map: <1.0 ×10⁻³ mm²/s
description: Restricted diffusion indicating ischemia.

name: Contrast Tracking
description: Linear hyperattenuation along fascial planes.

name: Extravasate HU: 30-90
description: Contrast material outside the vessel with Hounsfield Units between 30 and 90.

name: Extravasation
description: Skin swelling >3 cm³

name: Hypoechoic fluid collection with 'starry night' artifact

name: Pseudoenhancement

name: T1 hyperintensity (Gd: 550-650 ms)
description: Increased signal intensity on T1-weighted images after gadolinium administration.

name: Iodinated contrast leakage
description: Iodinated contrast leakage with density 20-30 HU

name: Pulmonary Edema
description: Ground-glass opacities + Kerley B lines

name: Cortical bruising
description: Bruising at impact sites, often frontal/temporal lobes

name: Matched defects
description: Ventilation and perfusion defects in the same region. Low probability for PE (10-15%)

name: Reverse Mismatch
description: Normal perfusion with ventilation defects.

name: T2 hyperintensity
description: >3 vertebral segments

name: Peripheral cord involvement
description: vs. Central cord involvement in 70% of TM cases

name: Restricted diffusion
description: 100% of cases (vs. <10% in TM).

name: Balanced ischemia
description: Global decreased uptake, often missed without quantitative analysis, indicating 3-vessel CAD.

name: Defect Extent (Mild Ischemia: 5-10% LV, Moderate Ischemia: 10-15% LV, Severe Ischemia: >15% LV)
description: Quantification of the size of the perfusion defect.

name: Fixed defect
description: Matched stress and rest defect, indicating infarction.

name: Global Coronary Flow Reserve (CFR) <2.0
description: Reduced ability of the coronary arteries to increase blood flow during stress.

name: Infarct (Fixed Defect)
description: Hypoperfusion during stress and rest on Myocardial Perfusion Imaging (MPI).

name: Ischemia (Reversible Defect)
description: Hypoperfusion during stress, normal perfusion at rest on Myocardial Perfusion Imaging (MPI).

name: Luminal stenosis >70%
description: Atherosclerotic plaques causing narrowing of the coronary arteries.

name: Reverse redistribution
description: Delayed defect appearance, suggesting microvascular dysfunction.

name: Reversible defect
description: Stress defect that normalizes at rest, indicating ischemia.

name: Stress EF < rest EF by >5%
description: Stress LVEF is lower than rest LVEF by more than 5%, indicating high risk.

name: Stress MBF <2.0 mL/min/g (Rubidium-82) or <1.8 mL/min/g (N-13 Ammonia)
description: Reduced myocardial blood flow during stress, indicating ischemia.

name: Transient Ischemic Dilation (TID)
description: Stress-induced subendocardial ischemia leading to apparent cavity enlargement (TID ratio >1.2).

name: Transmural Perfusion Gradient >15%
description: Difference in perfusion between the endocardium and epicardium.

name: Fracture line at coronoid process
description: Visualized fracture line at the coronoid process of the ulna.

name: Cortical Necrosis
description: Superior to standard US

name: Heterogeneous signal
description: Does not suppress completely like pure CSF on FLAIR. Often shows hyperintense internal strands.

name: Hyperintense
description: Isointense to CSF on T2

name: Hypodense
description: Density similar to CSF (0-10 HU)

name: Isointense to slightly hyperintense relative to CSF
description: "Dirty CSF" on T1

name: Lobulated morphology
description: Lobulated, insinuating shape filling cisterns

name: Markedly Hyperintense
description: Bright on DWI (restricted diffusion)

name: No Enhancement
description: No enhancement

name: No internal enhancement
description: No internal enhancement on T1 C+ (Gadolinium). Minimal rim enhancement may occur.

name: Rare Calcification
description: Calcification is rare (10-25%), usually marginal if present

name: Smooth Remodeling
description: May cause smooth remodeling of the petrous apex

name: Variable to low signal

name: Calcifications
description: Attenuation of 100-300 HU.

name: CC crystal sign

name: Chondrocalcinosis

name: Crown-like patellar calcification
description: Calcification around the patella.

name: Low T2 signal calcifications
description: Calcifications appear dark on T2-weighted images.

name: Synovitis with gradient-echo blooming
description: Synovial inflammation with susceptibility artifact from calcifications.

name: Calcifications
description: 90% in children, 50% in adults. Punctate or rim-like, >100 HU.

name: Craniopharyngioma capsule
description: Hypointense rim on T2 (fibrous tissue).

name: Cyst wall enhancement
description: T1-weighted with contrast (60%)

name: Cystic components
description: 10-20 HU (proteinaceous fluid)

name: Eggshell calcification
description: Pathognomonic in children.

name: Hyperintense cysts
description: T1-weighted images. Due to protein/cholesterol content.

name: Hypointense calcifications
description: T2-weighted images.

name: Incomplete cyst fluid suppression
description: FLAIR sequence.

name: Isointense solid component
description: T1-weighted images.

name: Solid components
description: 30-40 HU (mild hyperdensity)

name: Solid/nodular enhancement
description: T1-weighted with contrast (90%)

name: Variable cyst signal

name: Calcification

name: Mixed cystic/solid

name: T1 hyperintense cyst fluid

name: Basal ganglia involvement

name: Cortical hyperintensity

name: Deep gray matter involvement

name: Fat Stranding

name: Fistulas

name: Mucosal hyperenhancement

name: Mural Enhancement

name: T2 hyperintense edema

name: Anechoic or Hypoechoic

name: Contracted/Atrophic Vein

name: Moth-eaten lytic destruction of posterior petrous bone

name: Chaotic vascularity, RI < 0.4

name: Abdominal Wall Endometriosis

name: Deep Infiltrating Endometriosis (DIE)
description: Hypoechoic, ill-defined, solid nodules or plaques.

name: Endometrioma (Ovarian)
description: Unilocular cyst with diffuse, homogeneous, low-level internal echoes ("Ground glass" appearance). No internal flow on Doppler. Through transmission often present. Thick, fibrotic walls; may have punctate echogenic wall foci (cholesterol deposits).

name: Endometrioma (Ovarian)
description: T1 Hyperintense (Bright) due to methemoglobin. T1 Fat-Sat Remains Hyperintense. T2 Hypointense (Dark) relative to the T1 signal ("T2 Shading").

name: Negative Sliding Sign

name: T2 Dark Spot Sign
description: T2 Dark Spot Sign

name: Increased signal intensity

name: "Plastic" tumor
description: Tumor extends through the foramina of Luschka and Magendie.

description: Squeezes out foramina of Luschka/Magendie

name: "Toothpaste" tumor

name: ADC >1.1 ×10⁻³ mm²/s

description: Calcifications (20%)

description: Enhances in a non-uniform pattern after contrast.

description: Margins on ultrasound.

description: RI <0.5 on spectral Doppler.

name: Epididymal enlargement

name: Epididymal head enlargement
description: Epididymal head >10mm

name: Hypervascularity
description: Doppler finding (RI <0.5)

name: Increased epididymal size
description: Epididymal diameter >10 mm.

name: Avascular Mass

description: Hyperintense on T1/T2.

description: Adjacent colonic wall is usually normal in thickness.

name: Oval or paracolonic fatty mass
description: Typically 1.5 – 3.5 cm in diameter, abutting the anterior colonic wall (usually sigmoid).

name: Oval, non-compressible, hyperechoic mass
description: Adjacent to the colon.

name: Perilesional Fat Stranding
description: Surrounding inflammation is present but usually disproportionately mild compared to the mass itself.

name: Peripheral rim enhancement; central non-enhancement
description: Post-contrast (Gadolinium).

name: Necrosis
description: Non-enhancing areas (0-30 HU)

name: Necrosis
description: Non-enhancing areas (0-30 HU)

name: Necrosis
description: Non-enhancing areas (0-30 HU)

name: Non-visualization of the stomach

name: Gasless abdomen

name: Gassy abdomen
description: Implies EA with distal fistula (Type C, D, or E).

name: NG tube coiled in proximal esophageal pouch

name: Mediastinal air

name: Delayed esophageal transit

name: Collapse of filling defects

name: Enhancing venous structures

name: Flow voids

name: Paraesophageal Varices

name: Serpiginous filling defects

name: Thin, shelf-like filling defect

name: Normal striatal uptake

name: ADC value

name: Enhancement

name: T2 signal

name: Permeative pattern

name: T2 hyperintense

name: Articular process hypertrophy

name: Hamburger Sign

name: Joint space narrowing

name: T1 hypointense subchondral sclerosis

name: T2 hyperintense synovitis

name: Naked Facet Sign

name: Canal wall defect

name: Facial nerve enhancement

name: False-Negative Rate above benchmark
description: False-negative rate > 5% indicates missed cancers.

name: "Carpet of Polyps"

name: Desmoid Tumors
description: Homogeneous, iso-to-hyperdense mesenteric masses. High recurrence rate. Can cause bowel or ureteral obstruction.

name: Diffuse colonic wall thickening or nodularity
description: Often subtle until polyps are large.

name: Duodenal Adenomas
description: High risk of malignant transformation (peri-ampullary carcinoma).

name: Gastric fundic gland polyps

description: Absence of macroscopic fat

description: Absence of macroscopic fat

description: Enhancement persists in delayed phase

name: Persistent enhancement pattern
description: Enhancement persists in delayed phase

description: No washout in delayed phase

name: Diffuse cerebral edema

name: Hyperintense foci

name: Patchy low attenuation

name: Eggshell Calcification

name: Fluid-fluid levels

name: Focal Asymmetry
description: Ill-defined density.

name: Hyperintense
description: T1-weighted, matches subcutaneous fat signal. Suppresses on fat-saturation sequences.

name: No enhancement
description: Post-contrast (Dynamic), most common in mature oil cysts.

name: Oil Cyst
description: Radiolucent (fat density) mass with a smooth, thin capsule.

name: Oil Cyst

name: Rim enhancement
description: Post-contrast (Dynamic), thin, smooth.

name: Solid Mass

name: Focal Asymmetry

name: Fatty infiltration of muscle

name: Chemical Shift Type 2

name: Focal uptake indicating source of infection

name: Alpha angle >55°
description: Increased angle indicating aspherical femoral head in cam-type FAI.

name: Capsular distension >3mm
description: Abnormal capsular distension.

name: Cartilage delamination
description: Hypointense signal on T1 indicating cartilage damage.

name: CE angle >40°
description: Increased angle indicating acetabular overcoverage in pincer-type FAI.

name: Contrast extends into labral tear

name: Crossover sign
description: Sign of acetabular overcoverage seen in pincer-type FAI.

name: Femoral head-neck offset <8mm
description: Decreased offset indicating cam-type FAI.

name: Joint space <2mm
description: Indicates osteoarthritis.

name: Labral hyperintensity
description: T2 FS hyperintensity indicating labral tear or degeneration.

name: Pistol-grip deformity
description: Deformity of the proximal femur seen in cam-type FAI.

name: Subchondral edema
description: STIR hyperintensity indicating bone marrow edema.

name: Alpha Angle > 55°
description: Indicates Cam morphology. Measured on oblique axial MRI or Dunn view radiograph.

name: Anterosuperior Labral Detachment
description: Labral tear associated with Cam impingement.

name: Chondral Delamination (Carpet Lesion)
description: Cartilage damage at the anterosuperior acetabulum, associated with Cam impingement.

name: Contrecoup Lesion
description: Cartilage damage at the posteroinferior acetabulum, associated with Pincer impingement.

name: Coxa Profunda
description: Acetabulum is deeper than normal, seen in Pincer impingement.

name: Crossover Sign
description: Acetabular over-coverage, seen in Pincer impingement.

name: Fibrocystic Changes (Synovial Herniation Pits)
description: Often seen at the anterior femoral neck (Pitt's Pit). While often incidental, they are associated with FAI.

name: Labral Degeneration/Ossification
description: Labral changes associated with Pincer impingement.

name: Lateral Center Edge Angle (LCEA) > 40°
description: Indicates Pincer morphology. Measured on AP Pelvis radiograph.

name: Os Acetabuli

name: Osseous bumps
description: 3D reconstruction detects osseous bumps

name: Pistol Grip Deformity
description: Osseous bump at the femoral head-neck junction, seen in Cam impingement.

name: Protrusio Acetabuli
description: Acetabulum protrudes medially into the pelvis, seen in Pincer impingement.

name: High Hounsfield Units
description: HU >3000 indicates steel.

name: Lateral Ventricle Size
description: Mild: 10-12mm, Moderate: 13-15mm, Severe: >15mm

name: Focal uptake
description: Focal area of increased uptake indicating a potential source of infection.

description: Focal area of increased uptake indicating a potential source of infection.

description: Margins that are well-defined

name: Equal/iso-dense
description: Density on mammography

name: Hypoechoic

description: Echogenicity on ultrasound (80%)

description: Mass with oval shape

name: Peripheral flow

name: Peripheral vascularity

name: Persistent (Type I Curve)
description: Signal intensity continues to increase over time (> 10% increase after 2 minutes).

name: Popcorn calcifications
description: Calcifications in degenerated fibroadenomas (15%)

name: Posterior enhancement
description: Posterior acoustic features on ultrasound (70%)

name: Rapid Initial Enhancement
description: Signal intensity increases rapidly in the first 2 minutes post-contrast (>100% increase).

name: Persistent (Type I Curve)
description: Signal intensity continues to increase over time (> 10% increase after 2 minutes).

name: Non-mass Enhancement (NME)
description: Multiple regions distribution pattern.

name: String of beads sign
description: Alternating stenoses and dilations of medium-sized arteries

name: String of Beads
description: Alternating areas of stenosis and dilation.

name: String of Beads
description: Alternating areas of stenosis and dilation. Diameter of the "beads" often exceeds the normal vessel diameter. Typically affects the mid-to-distal cervical ICA (C1–C2 levels), usually sparing the origin/bulb.

name: Tardus Parvus
description: Slow acceleration and rounded peak in the renal artery waveform.

name: Increased Extracellular Volume (ECV)
description: T1 mapping ECV >31%

name: Bone expansion

name: FDG avidity
description: Typically < SUVmax 2.5 (vs malignancy >3.0)

name: Foraminal stenosis

name: Ground-glass matrix
description: 70-130 HU on CT

name: Heterogeneous enhancement
description: Post-contrast, 85-90% of cases

name: Increased uptake
description: ↑↑ uptake on Tc-99m MDP bone scan (sensitivity 95% for polyostotic)

name: Intermediate signal
description: T1WI, similar to muscle

name: Rind sign

name: Shepherd's crook deformity

name: Filling Defect
description: Intraluminal defect within the collecting system.
pathology_name: Filling Defects in Renal Collecting System

name: Visualization of pregnancy
description: First-trimester pregnancy can be evaluated using an endocavitary transducer.

name: Amorphous/punctate calcifications
description: Cluster of ≥5 calcifications in 1 cm², density 100-300 μm particles. Present in 80% of cases.

name: Non-mass enhancement
description: T1 isointense, T2 hypointense, persistent delayed phase kinetics (65% cases). Present in 70% of cases.

name: Synovial thickening >2 mm
description: Thickening of the synovium surrounding the flexor tendons.

name: Posterior acoustic enhancement
description: 2-3x brighter posterior regions due to low attenuation.

name: Abnormal sulcal depth or orientation
description: e.g., deep sulcus. Best seen on 3D T1-weighted sequences.

name: Blurring of the gray-white matter interface
description: Loss of distinct digitation at the gray-white junction. Best seen on 3D T1-weighted sequences.

name: Focal cortical thickening
description: May resemble a single enlarged gyrus or focal pachygyria. Best seen on 3D T1-weighted sequences.

name: Focal hypometabolism
description: Observed in the interictal phase. Often larger than the MRI lesion.

name: T2/FLAIR hyperintensity in the subcortical white matter
description: Tapering toward the ventricle. Best seen on FLAIR sequences.

name: Transmantle Sign
description: A funnel-shaped T2/FLAIR hyperintensity extending from the cortex to the ventricular surface. Specific for Type IIb FCD. Best seen on FLAIR sequences.

name: Asymmetry
description: Persistent mammographic asymmetry with no ultrasound correlate.

name: Spoke wheel pattern
description: Central scar with radiating fibrous septa resembling wheel spokes

name: Angiopoietin-1/2 overexpression and β-catenin activation
description: 70% and 35% of cases, respectively

name: Central Scar
description: Not mentioned in text, but classic finding

name: Central spoke-wheel arterial flow on Doppler Ultrasound
description: Characteristic pattern of blood flow radiating from the central scar.

name: Central stellate scar with malformed vessels
description: 1-3 cm diameter, no enhancement in portal phase

name: Central stellate scar with malformed vessels
description: 1-3 cm diameter, no enhancement in portal phase

name: Central stellate scar with malformed vessels
description: 1-3 cm diameter, no enhancement in portal phase

name: Centrifugal Filling
description: Centrifugal filling (inside out) via central artery (spoke-wheel) in arterial phase

name: Hyperechoic scar on Ultrasound
description: The central scar appears brighter than the surrounding liver tissue on ultrasound.

name: Hyperenhancing central scar on delayed phase CT
description: The central scar shows enhancement on delayed phase imaging (3-5 minutes post-contrast).

name: Hyperintense central scar on T2-weighted MRI
description: The central scar appears brighter than the surrounding liver tissue on T2-weighted images.

name: Hyperintense lesion on Hepatobiliary phase (HBP) MRI
description: The lesion retains contrast and appears brighter than normal liver tissue on hepatobiliary phase imaging (using gadoxetate).

name: Hypoattenuating central scar on non-contrast CT
description: The central scar appears darker than the surrounding liver tissue before contrast administration.

name: Hypointense central scar on T1-weighted MRI
description: The central scar appears darker than the surrounding liver tissue on T1-weighted images.

name: Intense homogeneous enhancement on arterial phase CT
description: The lesion shows significant and uniform enhancement during the arterial phase of contrast administration.

name: Iso/hyperintense lesion on T2-weighted MRI
description: The lesion appears similar or brighter than normal liver tissue on T2-weighted images.

name: Iso/hypointense lesion on T1-weighted MRI
description: The lesion appears similar or slightly darker than normal liver tissue on T1-weighted images.

name: Isoattenuating lesion on non-contrast CT
description: Lesion appears similar in density to normal liver tissue before contrast administration.

name: Isoechoic lesion on Ultrasound
description: The lesion appears similar in echogenicity to normal liver tissue on ultrasound.

name: No diffusion restriction on DWI
description: The lesion does not show restricted diffusion on diffusion-weighted imaging (DWI).

name: Normal hepatocytes, bile ductules, and Kupffer cells
Normal hepatocytes, bile ductules, and Kupffer cells
Normal hepatocytes, bile ductules, and Kupffer cells
description: No true capsule (pushing border interface)

name: Retention
description: HBP (Gd-EOB) (vs HA)

name: Sustained Enhancement
description: Sustained enhancement (no washout) in portal/late phase

name: Well-circumscribed mass on ultrasound
description: Variable echogenicity, peripheral vessels

name: Simple Cyst
description: Anechoic, smooth walls, posterior acoustic enhancement

name: Beak Sign
description: Tapering of bowel as it passes through the foramen.

name: Gas or fluid-filled bowel loops in Lesser Sac
description: Gas or fluid-filled bowel loops located in the Lesser Sac.

name: Stomach displacement
description: Displacement of the stomach anteriorly and the colon inferiorly.

name: Air Trapping
description: Air trapping distal to the foreign body, best seen on expiratory or decubitus views. Affected lung remains inflated while the normal lung deflates.

name: Foreign Body
description: Direct visualization of radiopaque foreign body on chest radiograph (only 10-20% are radiopaque).

name: Air trapping
description: Increased lucency on the affected side on expiratory films. Sensitivity increases to 85% on expiratory films.

name: Dependent lung doesn't deflate
description: On lateral decubitus film, the dependent lung fails to deflate normally. Specificity 90%

name: Direct visualization of foreign body
description: Foreign body seen on radiograph. Sensitivity 50-60%, Specificity 95%

name: Foreign body visualization
description: Direct visualization of the foreign body within the airway. Peanuts: -50 to -100 HU, Chicken bone: 500-700 HU, Plastic: 100-200 HU

name: Hyperinflation
description: Increased lung volume due to air trapping. Sensitivity 80%, Specificity 70%

name: Mediastinal shift
description: Shift of mediastinal structures away from the affected side. Sensitivity 65%, Specificity 85%

name: Dirty Shadowing
description: Echogenic foci with reverberation artifact within the scrotal wall (represents gas).

name: Fascial Thickening
description: Asymmetric thickening and fat stranding of the perineal planes.

name: Fluid
description: Reactive hydrocele or fluid tracking between fascial layers.

name: Fluid Collections
description: Abscess formation tracking along fascial planes.

name: Hyperlucent streaks
description: Subcutaneous emphysema.

name: Scrotal Wall Thickening
description: Scrotal wall thickening > 5-10 mm.

name: Source Identification
description: Identification of underlying cause (e.g., perianal abscess, fistula).

name: Subcutaneous Gas
description: Pockets of air within the scrotal wall, perineum, or tracking up the abdominal wall.

name: Testicular Sparing
description: The testes and epididymides usually appear normal with normal blood flow.

name: Articular step-off
description: Displacement of articular surface.

name: Bridging callus
description: Callus bridging the fracture site during hard callus phase (3-12 weeks).

name: Callus formation (secondary healing)
description: Visible callus formation (soft -> hard) during secondary healing.

name: Disruption of hyperechoic bone line
description: Break in the bright hyperechoic line representing the bone cortex.

name: Edema line
description: Bone marrow edema at the fracture site, especially in stress fractures.

name: Fracture detection
description: AI systems demonstrate high accuracy (>90%) in detecting fractures on X-ray.

name: Fracture line
description: Discontinuity of bone cortex.

name: Fracture Line
description: Discontinuity of bone cortex near hardware.

name: Periosteal reaction/sclerosis
description: Late finding in stress fractures.

name: Soft tissue swelling/obliteration of fat planes
description: Early finding in fracture healing (inflammatory phase).

name: Discontinuity of bone
description: A break in the normal bony cortex.

name: Fracture after minimal trauma
description: Fracture resulting from a fall from standing height or less.

name: Low Bone Mineral Density (BMD)
description: Often associated with low BMD on DEXA scan.

name: Lesion size < 8mm
description: Small size is a risk factor requiring peer review.

name: Asymmetric White Matter Hyperintensities
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintensities in asymmetric frontal regions.

name: Frontal/Anterior Temporal Lobe Atrophy
description: Volume loss >20% in frontal and anterior temporal lobes. Visual rating scale score ≥2.

name: Hypometabolism
description: Frontal lobe SUVr <0.8 on FDG-PET.

name: Hypoperfusion
description: CBF <30 mL/100g/min in frontal lobes.

name: Razor blade sulci/Knife-edge gyri
description: Cortical thinning to <2.5mm on T1WI.

name: Reduced Fractional Anisotropy (FA)
description: FA <0.3 in uncinate fasciculus.

name: Normal ADC
description: On DWI/ADC sequences

name: Multiple Subcentimeter Hypodense Lesions
description: Lesions with low attenuation, no gas unless superinfected

name: Central enhancement
description: T1 C+

name: HU values
description: 100-300 HU (calcifications)

name: Dentate nucleus hyperintensity
description: Hyperintense signal on unenhanced T1-weighted imaging (T1WI) in the dentate nucleus of the cerebellum.

name: Globus pallidus hyperintensity
description: Hyperintense signal on unenhanced T1WI in the globus pallidus.

name: Increased magnetic susceptibility
description: Increased magnetic susceptibility on Quantitative Susceptibility Mapping (QSM).

name: Isointense T2 signal in dentate nucleus and globus pallidus
description: T2 signal intensity is normal in the dentate nucleus and globus pallidus.

name: Non-enhancing dentate nucleus and globus pallidus
description: No enhancement is seen in the dentate nucleus and globus pallidus after contrast administration.

name: Subthalamic nuclei hyperintensity
description: Hyperintense signal on unenhanced T1WI in the subthalamic nuclei.

name: T1 shortening
description: Shortening of T1 relaxation time on T1 mapping.

name: Fat-fluid level
description: Fat-fluid level that changes with postural change

name: Fat signal
description: High signal on T1, decreases on fat-saturation

name: Hyperintense
description: High signal on T2

name: Hypoechoic
description: Hypoechoic mass

name: DRUJ dislocation
description: Radial shaft fracture + DRUJ dislocation

name: Radial shaft fracture
description: Radial shaft fracture + DRUJ dislocation

name: Biliary obstruction
description: Blockage of the bile ducts.

name: Calcifications
description: Presence of calcium deposits within the gallbladder or mass.

name: Fixed mass without acoustic shadowing
description: A mass that does not move with patient positioning and does not block the ultrasound beam.

name: Heterogeneous enhancement
description: Irregular enhancement pattern after contrast administration.

name: Hyperintense with dark spots (necrosis)
description: The mass appears brighter than the surrounding tissue on T2-weighted images, with areas of signal void representing necrosis.

name: Hypodense compared to liver
description: The mass appears darker than the surrounding liver tissue in the portal venous phase.

name: Hypointense mass
description: The mass appears darker than the surrounding tissue on T1-weighted images.

name: Irregular wall thickening >10 mm
description: sensitivity 85%

name: Irregular wall thickening >10 mm
description: Thickening of the gallbladder wall, often irregular in appearance.

name: Irregular wall thickening >10 mm
description: sensitivity 85%

name: Irregular wall thickening >10 mm
description: sensitivity 85%

name: Liver invasion (hypoechoic hepatic mass)
description: A mass in the liver that is darker than the surrounding liver tissue on ultrasound.

name: Persistent enhancement
description: The mass continues to enhance on delayed imaging.

name: Polypoid mass >10 mm
description: malignancy risk: 50-80%

name: Polypoid mass >10 mm
description: A mass protruding into the gallbladder lumen.

name: Polypoid mass >10 mm
description: malignancy risk: 50-80%

name: Polypoid mass >10 mm
description: malignancy risk: 50-80%

name: Restricted diffusion
description: High signal on DWI with corresponding low signal on ADC, indicating restricted water movement within the mass.

name: SUVmax >5.2
description: sensitivity 75%, specificity 90%

name: SUVmax >5.2
description: sensitivity 75%, specificity 90%

name: SUVmax >5.2
description: Increased metabolic activity within the mass.

name: SUVmax >5.2
description: sensitivity 75%, specificity 90%

name: Vascular encasement (portal vein PSV >200 cm/s)
description: Increased portal vein peak systolic velocity due to tumor involvement.

name: Visualization of gallbladder
description: Gallbladder can be evaluated using a curvilinear transducer.

name: Free air
description: Extraluminal air near the gallbladder

name: Hypoechoic Pancreas
description: >80% sensitivity

name: Hypoechoic Pancreas
description: >80% sensitivity

name: Hypoechoic Pancreas
description: >80% sensitivity

name: Posterior acoustic shadowing
description: Signal loss > -30 dB behind calcifications. Clean shadow (no internal echoes) vs. dirty shadow (gas).

name: Shadowing
description: Hypo-/anechoic band distal to a structure >3 mm in diameter. Attenuation > 10 dB at 5 MHz. Occurs in 70% of biliary/renal stone exams.

name: Calcification
description: Common (30-50%), coarse calcification helps distinguish from DNET

name: Cyst with mural nodule
description: Cystic lesion with a solid nodule attached to the wall, seen in 85% of cases.

name: Cystic mass with a mural nodule
description: Classic presentation, can also be completely solid

name: Enhancement of the solid mural nodule
description: T1 + C (Gadolinium), cyst wall typically does not enhance

name: Hyperintense solid component
description: T2/FLAIR imaging

name: Hypermetabolic
description: Ictal, useful for localizing the seizure focus

name: Hypointense cystic component
description: T1-weighted imaging

name: Hypometabolic
description: Interictal

name: Isointense to hypointense solid component
description: T1-weighted imaging

name: No restricted diffusion
description: DWI, facilitated diffusion due to low cellularity

name: Rare or minimal surrounding edema
description: T2/FLAIR imaging, due to slow growth

name: Scalloping of the inner table of the skull
description: Due to long-standing, slow growth

name: Variable enhancement
description: Variable contrast enhancement

name: Well-circumscribed, hypodense mass
description: Appearance on CT

name: Desmoid Tumors
description: Homogeneous, iso-to-hyperdense mesenteric masses. High recurrence rate. Can cause bowel or ureteral obstruction.

name: Osteomas
description: Sclerotic bone lesions, classically in the mandible or skull (frontal sinuses).

name: Thick cortical bone
description: Thick cortical bone >5 mm

name: FDG-Non-Avid
description: Mucinous and Signet-ring cell carcinomas may show low FDG uptake

name: Focal Wall Thickening
description: Wall thickening >5 mm in a distended stomach

name: Heterogeneous Enhancement
description: Variable enhancement pattern on CT

name: Irregular filling defects
description: Irregular filling defects within the stomach

name: Krukenberg Tumors
description: Bilateral solid ovarian masses

name: Liver Metastases
description: Metastatic lesions in the liver

name: Peritoneal Metastases
description: Ascites, omental caking, nodularity in the peritoneum

name: Ulcerating Mass
description: Large, flat ulcer with heaped-up edges (Carmen Meniscus Sign)

name: Contrast extravasation
description: Extravasation of contrast material outside the stomach.

name: Extensive free air or fluid
description: Large amount of free air or fluid in the abdominal cavity.

name: Abrupt termination of contrast ("Beak" sign)
description: Termination of contrast at the site of the twist on upper GI series.

name: Contrast fails to pass into the duodenum
description: On upper GI series.

name: Distended stomach with a transition point
description: On CT.

name: Double air-fluid level
description: One air-fluid level in the fundus and one in the antrum (if intrathoracic) on chest/abdominal X-ray.

name: Lack of mucosal enhancement
description: On CT, indicating ischemia.

name: Malposition of the stomach
description: e.g., greater curvature above lesser curvature on upper GI series.

name: Nasogastric tube arrested at distal esophagus/GE junction
description: Correlates with Borchardt's triad on chest/abdominal X-ray.

name: Paucity of distal bowel gas
description: Indicates complete obstruction on chest/abdominal X-ray.

name: Perigastric stranding/free fluid
description: On CT, indicating ischemia.

name: Pneumatosis intestinalis
description: Gas in gastric wall on CT, indicating ischemia.

name: Portal venous gas
description: On CT, indicating ischemia.

name: Retrocardiac air-fluid level
description: Usually large air-fluid level seen behind the heart on chest/abdominal X-ray.

name: Whirl Sign
description: Swirling of the mesentery/vessels at the volvulus site on CT.

name: Bald fundus, tubular stomach
description: Associated with Atrophic Gastritis and Pernicious Anemia

name: Target lesions/Varioliform appearance
description: Central barium fleck with radiolucent halo (Erosive Gastritis)

name: Thickened folds
description: >5 mm

name: Activity in esophagus or lungs
description: Tc-99m Sulfur Colloid seen in esophagus or lungs after swallowing.

name: Feline Esophagus
description: Multiple distinct, transverse, linear folds (transient).

name: Mucosal Granularity
description: Finely nodular appearance due to edema/inflammation.

name: Peptic Stricture
description: Smooth, tapered narrowing in the distal esophagus (above the GEJ).

name: Spontaneous Reflux
description: Barium moves from stomach to esophagus.

name: Ulceration
description: Usually distal; shallow or deep.

name: Active Extravasation
description: Contrast extravasation (>1 mm focal pooling)

name: Active Extravasation
description: Hyperdense focus (>90 HU) increasing >10 HU on delayed phase on triphasic CTA (non-contrast, arterial, portal)

name: Bleeding
description: Bleeding rate >0.1 mL/min detectable

name: Pseudoaneurysm
description: Pseudoaneurysm (>3 mm)

name: Pseudovein Sign
description: Tubular contrast pooling along bowel wall

name: Sentinel Clot
description: Focal hematoma adjacent to bleeding site

name: Avid enhancement
description: Post-contrast MRI. Peripheral enhancement in necrotic tumors.

name: Bullseye or target appearance
description: Central ulceration filling with barium on fluoroscopy (Upper GI / SBFT).

name: Calcification
description: Uncommon, but can occur (especially post-treatment) on CT.

name: Cavitation
description: Air-fluid levels may be seen if the tumor fistulizes to the bowel lumen on CT.

name: Exophytic growth
description: Large tumors (> 5 cm) on CT extending outward from the bowel wall.

name: FDG-Avid
description: Intensely hypermetabolic on PET/CT.

name: Heterogeneous enhancement
description: Large tumors (> 5 cm) on CT due to hemorrhage, necrosis, or cystic degeneration.

name: Heterogeneous Enhancement
description: Heterogeneous enhancement on CT Enterography, often with necrosis

name: High signal areas
description: Hemorrhage on T1-weighted MRI.

name: Hyperintense
description: Cellular tumor on T2-weighted MRI.

name: Hypervascular metastases
description: Liver metastases on CT.

name: Location
description: Most commonly found in the jejunum (50%)

name: Low to intermediate signal
description: T1-weighted MRI.

name: Sarcomatosis
description: Peritoneal metastases on CT.

name: Submucosal mass effect
description: Round, smooth filling defects with obtuse angles to the bowel wall on fluoroscopy (Upper GI / SBFT).

name: T1 Iso/Hypointense
description: T1 signal on MRI

name: T2 Hyperintense
description: 93% accuracy for malignancy if >5 cm on MRI

name: Ulceration
description: Ulceration seen in 40% of cases on CT Enterography

name: Very high signal
description: Cystic necrosis on T2-weighted MRI.

name: Well-circumscribed, homogeneous, strongly enhancing soft tissue mass
description: Small tumors (< 5 cm) on CT.

name: >10% retention at 4 hours
description: Most specific

name: Decreased antral contraction frequency
description: Antral contraction frequency less than 3/min.

name: Delayed gastric emptying
description: Retention of >10% of radiotracer at 1 hour, <40% emptied at 2 hours, or <90% emptied at 4 hours on gastric emptying study. Severity is classified based on 1-hr and 4-hr retention percentages.

name: Abdominal wall defect
description: Identified at the cord insertion site.

name: Gaps in radiation exposure
description: Occurs with high pitch (>1), leading to lower radiation dose but potential for missing data.

name: Overlapping radiation exposure
description: Occurs with low pitch (<1), leading to higher radiation dose and better image quality.

name: Molar tooth sign
description: Fractured geniculate ganglion + labyrinthine segment of CN7

name: "Cast" sign
description: Blood filling lateral ventricles

name: Cysts
description: T2 hyperintense, chronic phase

name: Echogenicity in germinal matrix
description: Increased echogenicity in the subependymal region adjacent to the lateral ventricles, indicating acute hemorrhage.

name: Hemosiderin
description: SWI hypointense, chronic phase

name: High attenuation
description: 40-60 HU, acute phase

name: Hyperechoic focus at caudothalamic groove
description: >3mm

name: Intraventricular extension with ventricular dilation
description: Grade III GMH, Ventricular dilation >97th percentile for age

name: T1 hyperintense
description: Subacute phase (methemoglobin)

name: T1 iso/hypointense, T2 hypointense
description: Acute phase

name: Evolving fluid-filled space communicating with the ventricle
description: Anechoic fluid collection seen in neonates.

name: "Engulfed" calcification
description: Tumor grows around normal physiological pineal calcification

name: Avid, homogeneous enhancement
description: T1+C

name: Hyperdense mass
description: Due to high cellularity

name: Isointense to gray matter
description: T1 and T2 signal

name: Restricted diffusion
description: Bright on DWI, dark on ADC due to high cellularity

name: Synchronous suprasellar mass
description: Bifocal disease is almost certainly germinoma

name: Absent flow distal to clip
description: Doppler: PSV <20 cm/s = success

name: Clip-related stenosis
description: TR-MRA: 92% sensitivity

name: Endoleak
description: Contrast extravasation within 5mm of clip

name: Migration
description: >2mm displacement from original position

name: Successful deployment
description: Clip arms <1mm from vessel wall

name: Bloom artifacts
description: T2* GRE sequence showing bloom artifacts from hemosiderin.

name: Cortical breakthrough
description: Detection of cortical breakthrough with 94% sensitivity.

name: Eccentric metaphyseal lesion extending to subchondral bone
description: Lesion is located eccentrically in the metaphysis and extends to the subchondral bone.

name: Heterogeneous hyperintensity
description: T2-weighted imaging.

name: Hypervascularity
description: RI < 0.7 in soft tissue GCT.

name: Hypoechoic mass
description: Soft tissue GCT.

name: Isointense to muscle
description: T1-weighted imaging.

name: Narrow zone of transition
description: 1-2 mm sclerotic rim in 30% of cases.

name: Peripheral enhancement
description: Post-contrast enhancement in 80% of cases.

name: Peripheral rim pattern
description: Power Doppler in 60% of soft tissue GCT cases.

name: Soap bubble appearance
description: Multilocular appearance of the lesion.

name: Large, hypervascular, exophytic mass
description: Large lesions often show central low-density necrosis

name: Smooth, round, submucosal filling defect
description: Often with central ulceration/umbilication

name: T1 hyperintense hemorrhage
pathology_name: GIST tumor rupture with active bleeding

name: T2* blooming artifacts
description: due to blood products
pathology_name: GIST tumor rupture with active bleeding

name: Contrast enhancement
description: 90% of GBMs show contrast enhancement

name: Elevated Choline/NAA ratio
description: Choline/NAA >2:1 on MR spectroscopy

name: Hemorrhage
description: Hemorrhage with density between 50-80 HU

name: Hyperintense edema
description: Hyperintense edema on T2/FLAIR, extending 2-3 cm beyond the tumor

name: Hypointense core
description: Hypointense on T1-weighted imaging, may contain hemorrhage

name: Increased rCBV
description: rCBV >1.75 compared to normal brain on perfusion imaging

name: Irregular hypodense mass
description: Hypodense mass with density between 25-35 HU

name: Lipid-lactate peak
description: Lipid-lactate peak on MR spectroscopy

name: Restricted diffusion
description: ADC <600×10⁻⁶ mm²/s in cellular regions on DWI/ADC

name: Ring enhancement
description: Ring enhancement with central necrosis

name: Tumor characterization
description: Contrast enhancement aids in grading.

name: Decreased NAA
description: Reduced N-acetylaspartate, indicating neuronal loss

name: Increased Choline/Creatine ratio
description: Cho/Cr > 2.0, often >2.5 in high-grade gliomas (Glioblastoma)

name: Lipid-Lactate Peak
description: Presence of lipid and lactate peaks, especially prominent in Glioblastoma (Grade IV)

name: Decreased cortical retention (DTPA)
description: DTPA shows decreased retention in the renal cortex.

name: Bone marrow edema
description: Edema during acute flares.

name: Double-contour sign
description: Urate crystals deposited on cartilage surface.

name: Preserved joint space (until late stage)
description: Joint space is maintained until advanced disease.

name: Punched-out erosions with overhanging edges (Martel's sign)
description: Erosions with a characteristic overhanging edge appearance.

name: Tophi
description: High attenuation (160-200 HU) masses.

name: Tophi
description: T1 iso/hypointense, T2 variable signal.

name: Tophi
description: Heterogeneous 'snowstorm' appearance.

name: Urate crystals
description: DECT attenuation >150 HU at 80 kVp

name: Hypointense nodule in the peripheral zone
description: Low signal intensity on T2-weighted images, mimicking cancer.

name: Restricted diffusion
description: High signal on DWI and low signal on ADC, mimicking cancer.

name: Diffuse increased uptake
description: Homogeneous increased uptake (>35% at 24h with 123I) throughout the thyroid gland.

name: Diffuse uptake
description: Increased and uniform uptake of I-123 throughout the thyroid gland.

name: Enlarged gland
description: Enlarged thyroid gland on scintigraphy.

name: Enlarged gland
description: Thyroid gland is larger than normal, with attenuation of 40-60 HU.

name: Hypoechoic thyroid
description: Thyroid gland appears darker than normal on ultrasound.

name: Intense homogeneous uptake
description: Homogeneous radiotracer uptake throughout the thyroid gland on scintigraphy.

name: Pyramidal lobe enhancement
description: Increased uptake in the pyramidal lobe.

name: T1 hyperintense
description: Increased signal intensity on T1-weighted MRI due to increased colloid.

name: Thyroid inferno
description: Increased vascularity on Doppler ultrasound.

name: Visible pyramidal lobe
description: Visualization of the pyramidal lobe on scintigraphy.

name: Increased uptake
description: I-123 uptake > 35% at 4-24 hours

name: Bursal fluid
description: Fluid accumulation within the subgluteal bursa, depth >3mm.

name: Calcific deposits
description: Calcium deposits near the greater trochanter.

name: Dynamic snapping of IT band
description: Real-time visualization of the iliotibial band snapping over the greater trochanter during hip movement.

name: Enthesophytes
description: Bony spurs at the tendon insertion site.

name: Fatty atrophy
description: Fatty infiltration of the gluteus medius/minimus muscle (Goutallier grade ≥2).

name: Hypoechoic tendon areas
description: Areas of decreased echogenicity within the gluteus medius/minimus tendon, indicating tendinopathy.

name: Power Doppler signal
description: Increased vascularity within the tendon or bursa, indicating inflammation.

name: Soft tissue attenuation around trochanter
description: Increased soft tissue density around the greater trochanter.

name: T2 hyperintensity at tendon insertion
description: Increased signal intensity on T2-weighted images at the insertion of the gluteus medius/minimus tendon.

name: Macrocephaly
description: Enlarged head.

name: Expanding fracture line
description: Fracture expands at 1-2mm/month

name: Advanced Bone Age
description: Epiphyses fuse earlier than expected for chronological age, indicating accelerated skeletal maturation and potentially leading to short final adult height.

name: Delayed Bone Age
description: Skeletal maturation is slower than expected for chronological age, indicating more remaining growth potential.

name: Asymmetric involvement
description: Gynecomastia affecting one breast more than the other (25% of cases)

name: Flame-shaped retroareolar density
description: Increased density behind the areola, resembling a flame shape (sensitivity 85%)

name: Posterosuperior calcaneal spur
description: Bony prominence on the posterior-superior aspect of the calcaneus on X-ray.

name: Popcorn calcification
description: Lobulated, >100 HU, range 120-400 HU.

name: Fracture of C2 pedicles
description: Traumatic spondylolisthesis of C2 on C3.

name: Bilateral Facet Dislocation
description: Bilateral dislocation of the facet joints (Type III)

name: Displacement
description: <3mm displacement (Type I), >3mm displacement + angulation (Type II)

name: Lymphatic Channel Visualization
description: A linear trail of activity leading away from the injection site.

name: Sentinel Node Identification
description: The first 'hot' node visualized in a lymphatic basin.

name: Bone erosion
description: Contiguous extension can lead to bone erosion in 20-30% of advanced cases.
pathology_name: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)

name: Central necrosis
description: Central necrosis (SUV 1-2) may be present, especially in HPV- tumors (FDG-avid necrosis/central photopenia).
pathology_name: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)

name: Distant metastases
description: Common sites include lung (50-60%), bone (20-25%), and liver (10-15%).
pathology_name: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)

name: FDG-avid lymph nodes
description: FDG+ nodes > 1cm (85% sensitivity). Level II nodes are commonly involved. Skip metastases can occur (5-10%).
pathology_name: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)

name: Increased FDG uptake
description: SUVmax > 5.0 (85% PPV for malignancy). HPV+ tumors often have SUVmax > 8.0. Tumor/Background Ratio > 3.2 (92% specificity).
pathology_name: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)

name: Infiltrative margins
description: Malignant lesions tend to have infiltrative margins on PET/CT.
pathology_name: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC)

name: Decreased T2* Signal in Lymph Node

name: Increased FDG Uptake in Lymph Node
description: SUVmax >2.5 in lymph node.

name: Restricted Diffusion in Lymph Node
description: ADC <1.0×10⁻³ mm²/s in lymph node suggests malignancy.

name: Rim Enhancement of Lymph Node
description: Lymph node >10mm with rim enhancement after iodinated contrast administration.

name: Lymph nodes
description: SUVmax >3.0 + focal uptake

name: Post-treatment SUVmax
description: SUVmax <3.5 → 95% NPV for recurrence; SUVmax >6.0 → 80% recurrence risk

name: Primary tumor SUVmax
description: SUVmax typically 8-15

name: Calcifications
description: Present in 15-20% of routine chest X-rays.

name: Eggshell calcification

name: Associated syrinx

name: Cyst with mural nodule

name: Cyst with nodule

name: Cyst/Syrinx
description: Peritumoral (85%)

name: Enhancement

name: Enhancing nodule on dorsal surface of cord
description: Spinal hemangioblastoma appearance.

name: Enlarged feeding artery and draining vein

name: Flow voids
description: Areas of signal void due to rapid blood flow

name: Flow voids
description: Prominent serpentine signal voids within the nodule or periphery indicate enlarged feeding arteries/draining veins.

name: Hypointense cyst fluid

name: Non-enhancing cyst wall
description: Cyst wall does not enhance.

name: Serpentine vessels

name: T2 Signal

name: Intense tumor blush

name: Well-circumscribed cystic mass with isodense mural nodule

description: May have punctate calcification

description: T1-weighted image

description: Also known as the 'light bulb' sign

description: Iron quantification

name: Arthropathy
description: Predilection for the 2nd and 3rd MCP joints.

name: Hyperattenuating (dense) liver
description: Liver density > 75 HU (non-contrast) or > 10 HU higher than the spleen. Can be masked by steatosis.

name: Liver signal lower on In-Phase than Out-of-Phase
description: Due to T2* decay being time-dependent, signal loss is greater at longer echo times (In-Phase).

name: Signal loss (hypointensity) on T2 and T2*-weighted images
description: Iron causes rapid dephasing of spins, leading to signal loss.

name: T2* < 10 ms
description: Significant iron overload. Normal liver T2* is > 20-25 ms (at 1.5T).

name: Arthropathy
description: Predilection for the 2nd and 3rd MCP joints.

name: Hyperattenuating (dense) liver
description: Liver density > 75 HU (non-contrast) or > 10 HU higher than the spleen. Can be masked by steatosis.

name: Liver signal lower on In-Phase than Out-of-Phase
description: Due to T2* decay being time-dependent, signal loss is greater at longer echo times (In-Phase).

name: Signal loss (hypointensity) on T2 and T2*-weighted images
description: Iron causes rapid dephasing of spins, leading to signal loss.

name: T2* < 10 ms
description: Significant iron overload. Normal liver T2* is > 20-25 ms (at 1.5T).

pathology_name: Hemodialysis Access Stenosis (AV Fistulas and Grafts)

name: Residual Lumen < 2.0 mm
description: Critical finding in a graft or fistula indicating stenosis.

name: Velocity Ratio (Vr) > 2:1
description: Indicates > 50% stenosis in hemodialysis access (stenosis PSV / pre-stenosis PSV).
pathology_name: Hemodialysis Access Stenosis (AV Fistulas and Grafts)

name: Wall thickening or intraluminal echoes
description: Direct visualization of stenosis.
pathology_name: Hemodialysis Access Stenosis (AV Fistulas and Grafts)

description: T1-weighted (glycogen/fat)

name: Normal

description: DWI/ADC. Cytotoxic edema. Diffuse restriction is a poor prognostic sign.

description: Bilateral, symmetric. Due to manganese deposition. No mass effect, no enhancement, usually isointense on T2. Signal intensity correlates with serum manganese levels.

description: Tagged RBC scan shows blood pool activity persists on delayed imaging.

description: Delayed phase (>5min) shows complete fill-in (40-60 HU).

description: B-mode ultrasound shows hyperechoic lesion (93% <3 cm).

description: T1-weighted images show hypointense lesion.

description: DWI shows no diffusion restriction (ADC >1.5×10⁻³ mm²/s).

description: Arterial phase (25-35s) shows peripheral nodular enhancement (80-100 HU).

name: Posterior acoustic enhancement

name: Delayed phase <25 HU

name: Liver-Spleen difference >10 HU
description: Non-contrast CT showing a difference in attenuation between the liver and spleen greater than 10 Hounsfield Units (specificity 95%).

name: Liver > kidney echogenicity

name: Liver attenuation <40 HU

name: Mild hyperintensity

name: Opposed-phase signal drop >20%
description: Chemical shift MRI showing a signal drop of greater than 20% on opposed-phase imaging.

name: PDFF ≥5%
description: Fat fraction map on MRI showing a proton density fat fraction (PDFF) of 5% or greater (AUC 0.98).

name: Poor visualization of diaphragm/portal veins
description: B-mode ultrasound showing poor visualization of the diaphragm and portal veins due to attenuation.

name: Reduced enhancement
description: Contrast-enhanced CT showing reduced enhancement of the liver.

name: Signal loss compared to spleen

name: Arterial hyperenhancement
description: Followed by rapid washout on post-gadolinium sequences

name: Calcifications

name: Shadowing calcifications

name: Washout

name: Spiculated margins

name: SUVmax >5.0
description: 92% sensitivity for metastatic disease.

name: T2 hyperintensity
description: Present in 85% of cases.

name: Basal cistern effacement
description: Compression or obliteration of the basal cisterns

name: Midline shift
description: Displacement of the midline structures of the brain

name: Ventricular compression
description: Compression of the ventricles

name: Diffuse edema
description: Often sparing the posterior fossa

name: Hemorrhage
description: High propensity for hemorrhagic infarction

name: Multicystic Encephalomalacia

name: Gray matter nodules
description: Nodules of gray matter in abnormal locations, isointense on all sequences.

name: B-ring > 2 cm above the diaphragmatic impression

name: Gastric folds traversing the diaphragm

name: Retrocardiac mass with air-fluid level
description: Suggestive of hiatal hernia, especially paraesophageal.

name: Retrocardiac soft tissue mass with air-fluid level
description: Can be seen on chest radiograph.

name: Widening of the esophageal hiatus (> 15 mm)
description: Suggests laxity/hernia.

name: Viability
description: Dysfunctional myocardium that is alive and has the potential to recover function if revascularized, assessed via Myocardial Perfusion Imaging (MPI).

name: rCBV >2.5

name: Blood-Brain Barrier Breakdown
description: k-trans >0.5 min⁻¹ on DCE-MRI (T1 weighted)

name: Increased rCBV
description: rCBV >2.5 ratio on DSC-MRI (T2* weighted). rCBV >3.0 in 90% of HGG.

name: Malignant Progression
description: AUC90 >30 mM·s on DCE-MRI (T1 weighted)

name: Increased uptake
description: PSMA SUV > 15

name: Low ADC value
description: ADC value <1.0 × 10⁻³ mm²/s on DWI-MRI

name: Microlobulations
description: ≥4 lobes

name: Spiculated mass with pleomorphic calcifications
description: Spiculated mass with calcifications of varying shapes and sizes

name: Washout kinetics
description: Type III curve

name: Femoral neck shortening
description: Femoral neck shortening >5 mm

name: Shenton line disruption
description: Shenton line disruption (>5 mm offset)

name: Trabecular angulation
description: Trabecular angulation >180 degrees

name: Alpha angle >55°
description: Suggests Cam-type FAI.

name: Displacement >2 mm from acetabular rim
description: Direct sign of labral tear on MRI.

name: Labral width >4 mm
description: Direct sign of labral tear on MRI.

name: Lateral center-edge angle <25°
description: Suggests hip dysplasia.

name: Lateral center-edge angle >39°
description: Suggests Pincer-type FAI.

name: Linear contrast extension into labral substance
description: T1-weighted MRI arthrography shows contrast extending into the labral substance.

name: Paralabral cysts
