name: Ribbon bowel
description: Narrow aganglionic rectum with dilated proximal colon

name: "Bird-beak" transition zone
description: Abrupt change in caliber between the dilated proximal colon and the narrow distal aganglionic segment.

name: Absent rectal gas
description: Lack of air in the rectum.

name: Absent rectal relaxation
description: Lack of relaxation of the rectum.

name: Delayed colonic transit
description: Delayed passage of radiotracer through the colon.

name: Delayed evacuation
description: Contrast material retained in the colon for more than 24 hours.

name: Distended proximal colon
description: Proximal colon appears dilated due to functional obstruction.

name: Sawtooth contractions
description: Irregular contractions in the aganglionic segment.

name: T2-hyperintense thickened muscularis propria
description: Increased signal intensity and thickening of the muscular layer of the rectum.

name: Transition zone
description: Abrupt change in caliber between the dilated proximal colon and the narrow distal aganglionic segment, most commonly in the rectosigmoid region (90%).

name: Diffuse white matter hyperintensity
description: T2/FLAIR

name: Bone marrow involvement
description: Diffuse SUV >2.5 suggests involvement, but can be false negative

name: Bulky nodal masses

name: Contiguous nodal spread

name: FDG avidity

name: Liver involvement

name: Lymph node size

name: Necrosis

name: Splenic involvement

name: Hypotelorism

name: Cleaved occipital cortex

name: Fused thalami (distance <10mm)

name: Middle interhemispheric fusion
description: Syntelencephaly variant finding.

name: Monoventricle, fused thalami

name: Non-cleaved frontal cortex
description: Semilobar HPE finding.

name: Pancake cortex
description: Alobar HPE finding.

name: Partial interhemispheric fissure

name: Partial posterior interhemispheric fissure
description: Semilobar HPE finding.

name: Partial separation of ventricles

name: Present anterior interhemispheric fissure
description: Lobar HPE finding.

name: Separated ventricles except frontal

name: Single dorsal cyst

name: Single monoventricle ("holosphere")

name: Single ventricle + fused thalami

name: Fusion of lower poles across the midline

name: Inferior pole fusion

name: Isthmus

name: Multiple renal arteries

name: Hemorrhage
description: HU 50–80 (late)

name: Leptomeningeal enhancement
description: Contrast, 30%

name: Restricted diffusion

name: Para-ureteral diverticulum

name: Waterlily sign

name: Snowstorm appearance
description: Multiple hyperechoic foci from hydatid sand within cyst

name: Absence of fetus/embryo

name: Avid enhancement

name: Bunch of Grapes appearance

name: Flow Voids
description: Prominent signal voids indicate hypervascularity.

name: Heterogeneous hyperintense mass

name: Snowstorm appearance
description: Echogenic mass filling the uterine cavity with innumerable small cystic spaces (hydropic villi).

name: Enlarged, thickened placenta with cystic spaces
description: Swiss cheese appearance of the placenta.

name: Presence of fetus

name: "Water Vase" Sign

name: Absence of cerebral cortical mantle
description: No cortical mantle on CT

name: Absence of flow in supraclinoid ICAs and MCAs; preserved flow in basilar and posterior cerebral arteries
description: Doppler Ultrasound finding

name: Cerebellum and brainstem morphologically normal

name: Falx cerebri present
description: Falx present on CT

name: Falx cerebri visible, floating in fluid
description: Echogenic line on Ultrasound

name: Gliotic Plate

name: Homogeneous CSF signal replacing cerebral hemispheres
description: T1/T2 signal on MRI

name: Large, fluid-filled supratentorial cranial vault
description: Prenatal/Neonatal Ultrasound finding

name: Preserved thalami, brainstem, cerebellum, and portions of occipital lobes

name: Supratentorial cranium filled with fluid of CSF density (0-10 HU)
description: Fluid density on CT

name: Thalami/Basal Ganglia often preserved

name: Anechoic fluid collection
description: No vascularity

name: Aqueductal flow void

name: Atrial width >10mm

name: Corpus callosum angle <90°

name: Dangling choroid

name: Evan's Index >0.3

name: Thalamo-occipital distance >25mm

name: Ventricular enlargement

name: Ventriculomegaly

name: Enlargement of temporal horns

name: Increased ventricular size

name: Increased ventricular size

name: Periventricular lucency

Absent/unilateral ureteral jets

name: Differential renal function <40%
description: Predicts poor recovery.

name: Tubal diameter >5 mm

name: Brown tumors

name: Brown Tumors

name: Brown Tumors
description: T1 hypointense, T2 hyperintense ± fluid-fluid levels.

name: Brown Tumors
description: Lytic, expansile lesions with sclerotic margins.

description: Non-enhancing areas (0-30 HU)

description: Non-enhancing areas (0-30 HU)

Petechial hemorrhages

name: Restricted diffusion

name: Restricted diffusion

name: Free Fluid

name: Posterior Globe Flattening

name: Slit-like Ventricles

name: Slit-like Ventricles
description: Ventricles may appear smaller than average.

name: Transverse Sinus Stenosis

name: Filling defect

description: Indeterminate feature.

name: Amyloid PET positivity

name: Decreased occipital glucose uptake

name: Generalized cortical atrophy

name: Hyperintensity in medial temporal lobes (amygdala and hippocampus)
description: Key finding on T2/FLAIR. Usually bilateral and asymmetric, but can be unilateral. Can extend to insula, cingulate gyrus, and hypothalamus.

name: Hypermetabolism in medial temporal lobes

name: Hypometabolism

name: Mesial temporal sclerosis

name: Patchy or absent enhancement
description: Variable finding on T1 + Contrast. If present, usually faint and leptomeningeal or patchy parenchymal. Lack of mass effect helps distinguish from glioma.

name: Restricted diffusion
description: Variable finding on DWI/ADC. May be present during active seizures or acute necrotizing phases.

name: Subtle hypodensity in medial temporal lobes

name: Sentinel Clot Sign

name: Extravasation

name: Asymmetric, coarse, patchy densities

name: Consolidations

name: Significantly increased lung volumes

name: Tree-in-bud opacities

name: Soap bubble appearance

name: Microcolon

description: Grade II MCL injury

name: Deep sulcus sign

name: Empty medial gutter sign

name: Hyperintense periligamentous edema
description: Edema surrounding the MCL, >5mm width suggests grade III injury

name: Hyperintense T1 signal
description: Acute hemorrhage within the MCL

name: Hypointense T1 signal
description: Chronic MCL injury

name: Medial joint space opening >5mm at 20° flexion
description: Indicates MCL laxity

name: Periligamentous edema
description: Grade I MCL injury

name: Fusiform swelling of flexor tendons
description: Swelling of flexor tendons

name: Medial epicondyle avulsion
description: Salter I fracture in adolescents

name: Partial-thickness tears
description: Fluid signal

name: Partial tears
description: Focal hypoechoic defects

name: T2 hyperintensity at medial epicondyle
description: T2 hyperintensity

name: Supracondylar Process
description: Bony spur arising from the anteromedial distal humerus, 5-7 cm above the medial epicondyle.

name: "Beaded" or striated appearance of collecting ducts
description: Similar to IVP.

name: "Bouquet of flowers"
description: Clusters of dilated, contrast-filled tubules.

name: "Echogenic medullary pyramids"
description: Without shadowing, seen in early stages.

name: "Paintbrush" appearance
description: Linear streaks of contrast extending into the papillae.

name: Acoustic shadowing
description: If stones are large enough (>3-4 mm).

name: Contrast accumulation in dilated tubules
description: Contrast persists after calyces have emptied.

name: Hyperechoic pyramids
description: Due to nephrocalcinosis (Anderson-Carr kidney).

name: Hyperintense cystic lesions
description: Confined to the medulla.

name: Medullary Nephrocalcinosis
description: Clusters of punctate calculi within the renal pyramids.

name: Papillary enlargement
description: Enlargement of the papillae.

name: Striated, cystic contrast retention
description: Contrast retention within the medullary pyramids. Cysts should NOT be visible in the cortex.

name: FDG avid
description: SUVmax >5: 85% PPV for malignancy

name: RAI-refractory
description: Lack of I-131 uptake due to lack of NIS

name: 4th ventricle compression
description: Mass effect causing compression of the fourth ventricle.

name: ADC 400-600
description: Low ADC value due to high cellularity.

name: Avid, heterogeneous enhancement
description: Multilobulated morphology after contrast administration

name: Banana-shaped tumor
description: Tumor in the vermis

name: Calcification
description: Calcification seen in up to 20%

name: Calcifications
description: 10-20% of cases

name: Drop metastases
description: CSF seeding

name: Heterogeneous mass
description: Iso- to hyperintense on T2/FLAIR

name: Homogeneous enhancement
description: Enhances uniformly after contrast administration.

name: Homogeneous enhancement
description: 90% of cases

name: Hydrocephalus
description: Compression of the 4th ventricle causing obstructive hydrocephalus (~95% of patients)

name: Hyperdense
description: Density of 30-40 HU

name: Hyperdense mass
description: Hyperdense relative to gray matter due to high cellularity (90% of cases)

name: Hyperdense on CT
description: Appears denser than normal brain tissue on CT.

name: Hypointense
description: T1-weighted images

name: Hypointense mass
description: Hypointense to gray matter on T1

name: Iso/hypointense
description: T2-weighted images

name: Nodular enhancing masses
description: Nodular enhancing masses in the cauda equina

name: Restricted diffusion
description: Shows restricted diffusion (low ADC values) due to high cellularity.

name: Restricted Diffusion
description: Bright on DWI, Dark on ADC due to packed cellularity

name: Zuckerguss
description: "Sugar icing" linear enhancement along the cord/nerve roots

name: IVC Diameter > 28-30 mm
description: Measurement of the IVC diameter on CT Abdomen/Pelvis with IV contrast (venous phase)

name: Diffuse enlargement
description: Brain weight or volume exceeding the mean by > 2 standard deviations (SD) or > 98th percentile. Generally bilateral and symmetric.

name: Normal myelination
description: Myelination appears normal in benign familial megalencephaly.

name: Normal sulcation
description: Sulcation appears normal in benign familial megalencephaly.

name: Normal ventricles
description: Ventricles appear normal in benign familial megalencephaly.

name: Diffuse, confluent white matter T2 hyperintensity
description: Extensive T2 hyperintensity in the white matter.
pathology_name: Megalencephaly with Leukoencephalopathy with subcortical Cysts (MLC) / Van der Knaap disease

name: Subcortical cysts
description: Specifically in the anterior temporal lobes and frontoparietal regions.
pathology_name: Megalencephaly with Leukoencephalopathy with subcortical Cysts (MLC) / Van der Knaap disease

name: Brain metastases
description: T1 hyperintense (due to melanin), T2 hypointense, DWI restriction (ADC <1.1x10⁻³ mm²/s).

name: Increased FDG uptake
description: Due to Warburg effect (aerobic glycolysis) in melanoma cells. SUVmax > 2.5 is generally considered malignant.

name: Liver lesions
description: 30-50 HU (non-contrast), suggestive of liver metastasis.

name: Lung nodules >5mm
description: Suggestive of lung metastasis.

name: Lymph nodes >1cm (short axis)
description: Suggestive of nodal metastasis.

name: Multiple hypermetabolic liver lesions
description: "Starry sky" liver pattern, suggestive of liver metastases.

name: Non-contiguous nodal metastases
description: "Skip lesions" pattern, suggestive of lymphatic spread.

name: Decreased T2* Signal in Lymph Node
description: Metastatic nodes retain USPIO contrast, leading to decreased T2* signal.

name: Increased FDG Uptake in Lymph Node
description: SUVmax >2.5 in lymph node.

name: Restricted Diffusion in Lymph Node
description: ADC <1.0×10⁻³ mm²/s in lymph node suggests malignancy.

name: Rim Enhancement of Lymph Node
description: Lymph node >10mm with rim enhancement after iodinated contrast administration.

name: Sentinel Lymph Node Identification
description: Visualization of sentinel lymph node(s) on lymphoscintigraphy after peritumoral injection of Tc-99m sulfur colloid.

name: Giant, lobulated folds
description: Primarily involving the fundus and body

name: Sparing of the antrum
description: Key differentiating feature

name: Broad dural base
description: Attachment to the dura.

name: Calcifications
description: 40% of cases, enhanced 50-80 HU

name: Decreased NAA
description: Reduced N-acetylaspartate peak

name: Dural attachment
description: Attachment to the dura

name: Dural tail
description: Enhancement along the dura.

name: Dural tail
description: Thickening of the dura mater adjacent to the lesion

name: Dural tail
description: Thickening of the dura adjacent to the tumor (70%)

name: Dural Tail Sign
description: Extension of dural thickening towards the tumor (60-72% specificity)

name: Enhancement
description: Post-contrast enhancement on T1-weighted imaging.

name: Homogeneous enhancement
description: Uniform enhancement after contrast administration

name: Hyperdense
description: 75% of meningiomas are hyperdense (45-60 HU) compared to normal brain (35-45 HU)

name: Hyperintense
description: T2-weighted imaging

name: Hyperostosis
description: Bone thickening in 20-25% of cases

name: Hyperostosis
description: Thickening of the bone.

name: Increased Alanine
description: Elevated alanine peak (1.3-1.5 ppm)

name: Intense Homogeneous Enhancement
description: Post-contrast enhancement in 85% of cases

name: Iso- to Hypointense
description: T1-weighted signal intensity in 90% of cases

name: Isointense
description: T1-weighted imaging

name: Lytic Bone Changes
description: Bone destruction in 5% of cases

name: Peritumoral Edema
description: FLAIR hyperintensity around the tumor (60%)

name: Psammomatous Calcification
description: Speckled calcification pattern in 25% of cases

name: rCBV < 5
description: Relative cerebral blood volume less than 5

name: Sunburst Vascular Pattern
description: Prominent vascularity on post-contrast imaging (30-40%)

name: T1 isointense
description: Isointense signal on T1-weighted MRI

name: Variable Signal Intensity
description: T2-weighted signal intensity: Hypo- (40%), iso- (40%), hyperintense (20%)

name: Ventral location
description: Common location

name: CSF sac herniation
description: Herniation of a CSF-filled sac through a bony defect.

name: No neural tissue
description: Absence of neural tissue within the herniated sac.

name: "Ghost meniscus"
description: Near-complete absence of the meniscus on MRI, indicating a radial tear.

name: Contrast extravasation
description: Extravasation of contrast into the meniscal tear during CT arthrography.

name: Double PCL sign
description: Appearance of two posterior cruciate ligaments due to a displaced bucket-handle tear fragment.

name: Fluid signal at meniscocapsular junction
description: Fluid signal extending to the meniscocapsular junction, indicating a peripheral tear.

name: Fluid signal splitting meniscus
description: Fluid signal within the meniscus on T2-weighted images, indicating a horizontal tear.

name: Fragment displacement
description: Displacement of a meniscal fragment, often seen in bucket-handle tears.

name: Intrameniscal signal (Grade III)
description: Linear signal extending to articular surface on T1/PD-weighted images.

name: Meniscal protrusion
description: Meniscus extends >3mm beyond tibial margin.

name: Tear
description: Visualization of a tear within the meniscus on proton density-weighted imaging.

name: Truncated triangle
description: Abnormal meniscal morphology on MRI, suggestive of a radial tear.

name: Linear signal intensity
description: Mimicked by truncation artifact.

name: Devascularization
description: >2 cm devascularization

name: Decreased Celiac trunk flow
description: <500 ml/min (normal >800 ml/min)

name: Delayed bowel enhancement
description: N/A

name: Lack of wall enhancement

name: Linear pneumatosis
description: Band-like gas parallel to the bowel wall

name: PMVG

name: SMA/SMV thrombus
description: Thrombus in the superior mesenteric artery or vein

name: Fat Ring Sign (Halo Sign)
description: Preservation of normal hypodense fat immediately surrounding the mesenteric vessels and nodules.

name: Hyperechoic mesenteric mass
description: Defined hyperechoic mesenteric mass.

name: Hyperintense
description: T2-weighted imaging indicates active inflammation/edema.

name: Mesenteric vessels pass through mass
description: Mesenteric vessels pass through the mass without occlusion, though they may be engulfed. Collateral vessels are rare.

name: Misty Mesentery
description: Increased attenuation of mesenteric fat (ground-glass appearance) ranging from -40 to -60 HU.

name: Tumoral Pseudocapsule
description: A hyperattenuating band of soft tissue (< 3 mm thick) separating the inflammatory mass from normal mesentery.

name: Collateral White Matter Changes
description: Blurring of the gray-white matter junction in the anterior temporal pole (temporal pole blurring).

name: Fornix Asymmetry
description: Atrophy of the ipsilateral fornix.

name: Hippocampal Atrophy
description: Volume loss compared to the contralateral side.

name: Hyperintensity
description: Increased signal on T2 and FLAIR sequences reflecting gliosis and increased free water.

name: Ictal Hyperperfusion
description: Hyperperfusion during seizure.

name: Interictal Hypometabolism
description: Hypometabolism in the affected temporal lobe.

name: Interictal Hypoperfusion
description: Hypoperfusion between seizures.

name: Loss of Internal Architecture
description: Loss of the normal interdigitations of the hippocampal head. Loss of the dark band of the stratum radiatum.

name: Mammillary Body Atrophy
description: Ipsilateral volume loss.

name: Temporal Horn Dilatation
description: Passive enlargement of the ipsilateral temporal horn of the lateral ventricle due to hippocampal atrophy.

name: Butterfly Pattern
description: Symmetrical periventricular white matter involvement.

name: No enhancement
description: No contrast enhancement.

name: Tigroid or Leopard Skin Pattern
description: Radial stripes of T2 hypointensity within the hyperintense demyelinated white matter (represents spared perivenular myelin).

name: U-fiber sparing
description: U-fibers are typically spared.

name: Streaks
description: Streaks radiating from objects >500 HU, obscuring dental implants.

name: Blooming around cochlear implants
description: Enlargement of the apparent size of the implant.

name: Pseudo-enhancement
description: Apparent increased density around the metal.

name: Reduced metal artifacts
description: At high keV (90-140+ keV) on virtual monoenergetic images (VMI), beam hardening and photon starvation are reduced, leading to decreased metal artifacts from orthopedic hardware or coils.

name: Star-shaped streaks
description: Streaks radiating outwards from metallic implants.

name: High density
description: HU >2000 (vs. normal vitreous 10-20 HU)

name: Metallic density
description: Metallic density (2-3 mm detection limit)

name: Blastic bone destruction
description: HU > 40

name: Hypointense
description: T1-weighted imaging

name: Improved lesion detection
description: Increased sensitivity (15-30%) with contrast enhancement.

name: Lytic bone destruction
description: HU < 30

name: Paravertebral mass
description: May or may not be present

name: Rim-enhancing
description: Post-contrast

description: SUVmax >10

description: Typically seen in liver metastases

name: Pulmonary nodules
description: Typically seen in lung metastases

name: Peritoneal nodules
description: Typically seen in peritoneal metastases

description: Indicates treatment response and scarring.

description: PSV >30 cm/s

name: Calcifications

description: Abnormal development or underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.

name: Intracranial calcifications
description: Echogenic foci within the brain.

name: Microlissencephaly
description: Extreme microcephaly with a thick cortex (>3-4 mm) and few gyri.

description: Calcifications located around the ventricles, associated with CMV.

name: Polymicrogyria
description: Irregular, bumpy cortical surface.

name: Punctate calcifications at grey-white matter junction
description: Subcortical calcifications, particularly associated with Zika virus.

name: Reduced Occipitofrontal Circumference (OFC)

name: Simplified gyral pattern

name: Sloping forehead ("beetle brow")

name: Ventriculomegaly

name: Normal cortical thickness
description: Normal cortical thickness

name: Simplified/Shallow gyral pattern

name: Chin Recession

name: Smooth/Agyric gyral pattern

name: Thick cortex
description: Cortical thickness >3-4 mm

name: Coronary Flow Reserve (CFR) <2.0

name: Reduced Coronary Flow Reserve (CFR)

name: Reverse redistribution
description: Delayed defect appearance, suggesting microvascular dysfunction.

name: Corkscrew duodenum
description: Abnormal course of duodenum to right of spine with spiral configuration

name: Bowel wall thickening
description: Bowel wall >3 mm with decreased enhancement

name: Corkscrew pattern
description: Spiral duodenum

name: Pneumatosis intestinalis
description: Specificity 98% for necrosis

name: Swirl sign at SMA root
description: Congested mesentery (HU 30-50)

name: Visualization of volvulus
description: Midgut volvulus can be evaluated using a phased array transducer.

name: Whirlpool sign
description: Swirling mesentery

name: Cortical hyperintensity
description: Reversible, on T2/FLAIR

name: Normal ADC
description: On DWI/ADC sequences

name: Amyloid positivity

name: Comet-tail artifacts
description: 3-5 mm spacing

name: "Inverted V" sign

name: Absence of a fat plane between the GB and CHD
description: Suggests inflammation or fistula formation.

name: Atrophic or contracted gallbladder
description: Chronic cholecystitis can lead to a small or shrunken gallbladder.

name: Calcified stone in the cystic duct area
description: Stone may be calcified, but can be iso-attenuating in 15-25% of cases.

name: Dilated IHD/CHD with abrupt transition to normal caliber duct
description: Abrupt change in duct size at the level of obstruction.

name: Dilated intrahepatic ducts (IHD) and CHD

name: Extrinsic compression of the CHD
description: Smooth, curved indentation of the common hepatic duct.

name: Impacted stone at the GB neck/cystic duct
description: Gallstone impacted at the gallbladder neck or cystic duct.

name: Normal caliber Common Bile Duct (CBD)
description: CBD distal to the obstruction is normal in size.

name: Pericholecystic inflammatory stranding
description: Inflammation around the gallbladder.

name: Smooth, lateral extrinsic compression of the CHD
description: Compression of the CHD from the outside.

name: T2-hypointense filling defect (stone) in the cystic duct/neck
description: Stone appears dark on T2-weighted images.

name: Visualization of the fistula
description: Contrast flows from the bile duct into the gallbladder.

name: Parallel "tram-track" lines
description: Vascular calcifications appear as parallel lines.

name: Appearance
description: Non-compressible, tubular, anechoic/hypoechoic superficial structure. Beaded appearance.

name: Blurring
description: Blurring >2mm

name: Ghosting
description: Duplicated anatomy in the phase-encode direction, often anterior-posterior. Severity increases with longer TE.

name: Ghosting
description: Ghosting artifact due to tissue movement >3 mm/s, blurring coronary arteries.

name: "Ghost" images of moving ribs
description: Faint, displaced images of ribs due to respiratory motion.

name: Blurring
description: Generalized blurring of structures.

name: Duplicate structures
description: Apparent doubling of anatomical structures.

name: Streaks
description: Linear artifacts across the image.

name: Ivy sign
description: Leptomeningeal enhancement resembling ivy on vessel wall from pial collaterals

name: "Ivy sign"
description: Leptomeningeal collaterals seen on CT angiography.

name: "Ivy sign"
description: Leptomeningeal enhancement seen on post-contrast T1-weighted MRI.

name: "Puff of smoke"
description: Collateral network formation at the base of the brain, seen on angiography.

name: Acute infarcts
description: Acute infarcts seen on diffusion-weighted MRI.

name: Flow voids in basal ganglia
description: Flow voids seen in the basal ganglia on T2-weighted MRI.

name: ICA terminus stenosis
description: Stenosis of the internal carotid artery terminus.

name: Intraventricular hemorrhage
description: Bleeding within the ventricles of the brain.

name: Reduced "flow gap" between ICA terminus and M1
description: Reduced flow gap between the ICA terminus and the M1 segment of the middle cerebral artery.

name: Stenosis/occlusion of terminal ICAs & proximal ACAs/MCAs
description: Stenosis or occlusion of the terminal internal carotid arteries and proximal anterior and middle cerebral arteries.

name: Watershed infarcts
description: Infarcts in the watershed regions of the brain.

name: "Puff of smoke"
description: Collateral network formation at the base of the brain, seen on angiography.

name: Unilateral Stenosis/occlusion of terminal ICAs & proximal ACAs/MCAs
description: Unilateral Stenosis or occlusion of the terminal internal carotid arteries and proximal anterior and middle cerebral arteries.

description: Associated with multi-organ failure

description: Vertebral bodies demonstrating a heterogeneous signal intensity pattern resembling a small brain.

name: Osteolytic lesions
description: Lytic bone lesions with attenuation values between 20-40 HU.

name: Pathologic fractures
description: Fractures occurring through areas of weakened bone due to underlying disease.

name: Punched-out lytic lesions
description: Multiple small, well-defined lytic lesions without surrounding sclerosis.

name: Raindrop skull
description: Numerous small, round lytic lesions scattered throughout the skull.

name: T1 hypointense, T2 hyperintense lesions
description: Focal lesions demonstrating low signal intensity on T1-weighted images and high signal intensity on T2-weighted images.

name: Central vein sign
description: Presence of a central vein within the T2 hyperintense lesion. 45% sensitivity, 85% specificity.

name: Decreased Fractional Anisotropy
description: DTI showing decreased fractional anisotropy in normal appearing white matter (NAWM).

name: Decreased NAA
description: MRS showing decreased NAA (neuronal loss).

name: Decreased NAA
description: Reduced N-acetylaspartate in MS plaques

name: Enhancing lesions
description: Gd-T1 enhancing lesions indicating active inflammation. Ring/arc enhancement in 40% of cases.

name: Hyperintense ovoid lesions
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintense ovoid lesions (>3mm) in periventricular (Dawson's fingers) and juxtacortical (U-fibers) locations.

name: Hypointense "black holes"
description: T1 hypointense lesions representing chronic axonal loss. Correlates with EDSS disability score.

name: Increased Choline
description: MRS showing increased choline (membrane turnover).

name: Increased Choline
description: Elevated choline in active demyelination

name: Lesion detection
description: AI systems demonstrate high sensitivity (>90%) in detecting MS lesions on MRI.

name: Lesion length
description: <1 vertebral segment

name: Plaque detection
description: Double dose (0.2 mmol/kg) of contrast can improve plaque detection.

name: Plaques
description: Hyperintense lesions on T2-weighted imaging.

name: Spinal cord lesions
description: Spinal cord lesions, cervical > thoracic. >3 vertebral segments uncommon (vs. NMO >3).

name: Enhancing lesions
description: Hyperintense signal on T1-weighted images after GBCA administration.

name: Hot cross bun sign
description: Cruciform T2 hyperintensity in pons from selective degeneration of pontine neurons

name: Bilateral striatal uptake loss
description: Bilateral loss of Ioflupane I-123 binding on DaTscan.

name: Detrusor muscle invasion
description: T2a: inner half; T2b: outer half

name: Detrusor muscle invasion
description: T2

name: Detrusor muscle invasion
description: T2a: inner half; T2b: outer half

name: Perivesical fat invasion
description: T3

name: Perivesical fat invasion
description: T3

name: Acute hematoma
description: Hematoma with Hounsfield units (HU) between 50-70.

name: Doppler signal
description: Increased Doppler signal indicating vascularity and inflammation.

name: Fluid-fluid levels
description: Fluid-fluid levels within the hematoma, indicating organization.

name: Heterogeneous echotexture
description: Heterogeneous appearance of the muscle due to hematoma.

name: Ill-defined interstitial hemorrhage and edema
description: Often crosses fascial planes, located in muscle belly

name: T1 hyperintense hematoma
description: T1 hyperintensity due to methemoglobin within the hematoma.

name: Edema
description: Edema with Hounsfield units (HU) between 30-50.

name: Feathery edema
description: T2/STIR hyperintensity tracking along the myotendinous junction

name: Hematoma
description: Focal fluid collection displacing muscle fibers

name: Hyperintense T1 signal
description: If subacute hemorrhage is present

name: Hypoechoic tear
description: Hypoechoic area representing the muscle tear.

name: Normal T1 signal
description: Usually normal in low grade strains

name: Perifascial fluid
description: Fluid collection around the muscle fascia.

name: STIR hyperintensity
description: STIR sequence is highly sensitive for detecting edema associated with muscle strains.

name: T2 hyperintensity
description: T2 hyperintensity at the myotendinous junction, indicating edema and inflammation.

name: No cystic expansion
description: Absence of a fluid-filled sac.

name: Placode flush with skin
description: Placode is exposed but at the same level as the skin surface.

name: < -30 HU
description: Macroscopic fat

name: Expanded subarachnoid space
description: Enlargement of the subarachnoid space around the placode.

name: Placode protrusion
description: Placode protrudes above the skin surface through a posterior bony defect.

name: ECV >31%
description: T1 mapping MRI finding indicating myocardial fibrosis

name: Fixed defect
description: Matched stress and rest defect, indicating infarction.

name: Decreased uptake
description: Decreased uptake of Tl-201 chloride in areas of non-viable myocardium

name: Decreased Myocardial Perfusion Reserve
description: MPR <1.5

name: Decreased Stress CBF
description: Stress CBF <2.0 mL/g/min

name: Late Gadolinium Enhancement
description: >75% transmurality (Dobutamine stress)

name: New Regional Wall Motion Abnormality (RWMA)
description: In ≥2 segments (17-segment model)

name: Reversible Defect
description: >10% myocardium (99mTc-sestamibi)

name: Decreased radiotracer uptake
description: Reduced uptake of Tc-99m sestamibi or Tl-201 in a region of the myocardium during stress or rest imaging, indicating ischemia or infarction.

name: Decreased radiotracer uptake
description: Areas of decreased radiotracer uptake (cold spots) indicate decreased blood flow to the myocardium, which can be due to ischemia or infarction. Using 201Tl or 99mTc-sestamibi.

name: Presence of viable myocardium in areas of reduced perfusion
description: Identifies hibernating myocardium that may benefit from revascularization.

name: Late gadolinium enhancement
description: LGE >15% myocardium

name: T2 ratio
description: T2 ratio myocardium/skeletal muscle >2.0

name: Peripheral calcification
description: Calcification within the muscle

name: Amorphous, fluffy calcifications
description: Appears at 2-4 weeks

name: Blooming artifact
description: Gradient echo sequences at the calcified periphery

name: Denser calcification at the periphery
description: Appears at 4-8 weeks

name: Heterogeneous high signal (edema)
description: T2-weighted images in the acute phase

name: High signal centrally
description: T1-weighted images in the subacute/chronic phase, representing fatty marrow metaplasia

name: Intense enhancement
description: Contrast-enhanced images in the acute phase

name: Intense uptake
description: Bone Scan (Tc-99m MDP) in the active phase

name: Isointense to muscle
description: T1-weighted images in the acute phase

name: Low signal rim
description: T2-weighted images in the subacute/chronic phase, representing calcification

name: Saucerization
description: Localized excavation of the cortex with periostitis

name: Soft tissue swelling
description: Nonspecific finding in the early phase (0-2 weeks)

name: String sign
description: Radiolucent cleft separating the lesion from adjacent cortex

name: Well-defined bony mass
description: Mature lesion at 4-6 months

name: Zonal Phenomenon
description: Peripheral dense ossification with a central lucent, immature center

name: Attenuation
description: 30-50 HU with fat foci (-30 to -100 HU)

name: Doppler
description: High vascularity (PSV >50 cm/s)

name: Enhancement
description: Heterogeneous enhancement (95%)

name: Enhancement
description: Septal/nodular enhancement (>25 HU Δ)

name: Margins
description: Infiltrative (60%)

name: T1 signal
description: Hypointense (similar to muscle)

name: T2 signal
description: Hyperintense (200-300 ms)

name: Bone erosion
description: Cortical disruption >3mm depth (specificity 95%)

name: Enhancement
description: Heterogeneous enhancement post-contrast

name: Extracapsular spread
description: Ill-defined nodal margins

name: Increased metabolic activity
description: SUVmax >8.0 (sensitivity 92%, specificity 88%)

name: Metastasis
description: Detection of metastasis

name: Nodal necrosis
description: Central <20 HU

name: Primary tumor
description: Iso- to hypodense (30-50 HU) compared to muscle

name: Primary tumor
description: Hyperintense to muscle on T2WI

name: Primary tumor
description: Isointense to muscle on T1WI

name: Restricted diffusion
description: ADC <1.0×10⁻³ mm²/s on DWI

name: Low attenuation center
description: 10-30 HU center

name: Bowel wall thickening
description: >3mm (normal: 1-2mm)

name: Bowel Wall Thickening
description: Visible as separation of gas-filled loops on radiograph.

name: Bowel Wall Thickening
description: > 2.7 mm (often rounded to 3 mm) is considered abnormal.

name: Decreased perfusion
description: RI >0.8 on Doppler

name: Echogenic Mucosa
description: Hyperechoic mucosal layer suggesting inflammation/hemorrhage.

name: Fixed loop sign
description: Persistent dilated loop >24hrs

name: Fixed Loop Sign
description: A dilated loop that remains unchanged in position/appearance over serial exams, suggesting focal ischemia/necrosis.

name: Free fluid
description: Complex ascites with debris

name: Gasless Abdomen
description: Can indicate fluid-filled bowel or high-grade obstruction; ominous if sudden.

name: Generalized Bowel Dilatation
description: Often the earliest sign of NEC.

name: Persistent loop
description: ≥3 consecutive films showing same dilated loop

name: Pneumatosis
description: Fat density (-50 to -150 HU)

name: Pneumatosis
description: Appears as high-amplitude echogenic foci (dots) within the bowel wall.

name: Pneumatosis intestinalis
description: Hallmark diagnostic finding

name: Pneumatosis intestinalis
description: "Bubbly" (85%) or linear (15%) patterns of gas in the bowel wall

name: Pneumatosis Intestinalis
description: Linear (subserosal) or bubbly/cystic (submucosal) lucencies within the bowel wall. Look for the 'train track' lucency.

name: Pneumoperitoneum
description: Free air in the peritoneal cavity, indicating perforation. Can manifest as Football Sign, Rigler Sign, or Triangle Sign.

name: Pneumoperitoneum
description: Football sign (supine) or Rigler's sign

name: Portal gas
description: Air attenuation (-1000 HU) in portal veins

name: Portal venous gas
description: Echogenic foci moving with blood flow

name: Portal venous gas
description: Branching hepatic lucencies

name: Portal Venous Gas
description: Mobile, high-amplitude echogenic spikes flowing within the portal veins.

name: Portal Venous Gas
description: Branching linear lucencies extending to the periphery of the liver (follows blood flow).

name: String of pearls sign
description: Gas in bowel wall

name: Avascular center on Doppler US in 92% of cases
Avascular center on Doppler US in 92% of cases
Avascular center on Doppler US in 92% specificity
Avascular center on Doppler US in 92% specificity
Fluid-debris level on US in 45% of neonatal cases
Heterogeneous mass >3cm on US in 88% of cases
Heterogeneous mass >3cm on US in 88% of cases
Heterogeneous mass >3cm on US in 88% of cases
Heterogeneous mass >3cm on US in 88% sensitivity
Heterogeneous mass >3cm on US in 88% sensitivity
Air bronchograms
description: Air-filled bronchi made visible by surrounding alveolar consolidation.

name: Bilateral perihilar opacities
description: Opacities seen around the hilum of both lungs.

name: Comet-tail artifacts
description: Vertical, hyperechoic artifacts arising from the pleural line.

name: Consolidations
description: Homogeneous increase in pulmonary parenchymal attenuation that obscures the margins of vessels and airway walls.

name: Double Contour Sign
description: Hyperechoic pleural line with subpleural consolidation.

name: Ground-glass opacities
description: Hazy increased attenuation of the lung, with preservation of bronchial and vascular margins.

name: Subpleural consolidations
description: Consolidation located just beneath the pleura.

name: Tree-in-Bud Pattern
description: Centrilobular nodules connected to branching linear structures, resembling a budding tree. Rare in neonates, more specific for viral etiology.

name: Elevated Resistive Index
description: Doppler: RI >0.7 in affected tissues

name: Hyperintense edema
description: STIR sequence, early phase

name: Hypointense fibrosis
description: T2-weighted images, "sheet-like" pattern

name: Increased FDG uptake
description: FDG-PET: SUVmax 2.5-4.0 in active lesions

name: Isointense dermal lesions
description: T1-weighted images

name: Muscle edema
description: HU 30-50 (normal 10-30)

name: Skin thickening
description: >3mm (normal 1-2mm)

name: Skin thickening with hyperechoic bands
description: Increased echogenicity within the thickened skin.

name: Subcutaneous septal enhancement
description: Enhancement of the septa within the subcutaneous fat.

name: Elevated PSV at UVJ
description: Peak systolic velocity >20 cm/s at the ureterovesical junction, suggesting obstruction.

name: Filling defect
description: Low signal intensity on T2-weighted images within the urinary tract.

name: Hydronephrosis
description: Dilation of the renal collecting system due to obstruction.

name: Perinephric stranding
description: Inflammation around the kidney.

name: Radiopaque stone
description: Visualization of a radiopaque density within the urinary tract. Only detects calcium and struvite stones.

name: Restricted diffusion in obstructed kidney
description: ADC <1.1×10⁻³ mm²/s in the affected kidney.

name: Stone visualization
description: Direct visualization of stone within the urinary tract. HU values can suggest stone composition: Calcium oxalate (800-1200 HU), Uric acid (200-450 HU), Cystine (600-800 HU).

name: Twinkling artifact
description: Artifactual color Doppler signal behind a stone.

name: Stone Density
description: Uric acid stones: 300-500 HU; Indinavir stones: -20 HU

name: Stone Detection
description: High sensitivity for stone detection on non-contrast CT

name: Catheter tip in renal pelvis
description: Visualization of the catheter tip within the renal pelvis.

name: Catheter visible
description: Visualization of the catheter on T2-weighted images.

name: No air or contrast extravasation
description: Absence of air or contrast leakage around the catheter.

name: No hydronephrosis if drainage is effective
description: Absence of dilated renal pelvis if the nephrostomy tube is effectively draining the kidney.

name: No perinephric edema
description: Absence of edema around the kidney.

name: No perirenal fluid
description: Absence of fluid around the kidney.

name: Pigtail configuration
description: Coiled catheter in the renal pelvis.

name: Radiopaque marker visible
description: Visualization of the radiopaque marker on the catheter.

name: Tract from skin to renal pelvis
description: Visualization of the catheter tract from the skin to the renal pelvis.

name: Fascicular Loss
description: Loss of the normal 'honeycomb' appearance on axial MRI views.

name: Muscle Edema
description: High T2/STIR signal in muscle belly during the acute/subacute phase (<1 month).

name: Muscle Fatty Atrophy
description: High T1 signal (fatty replacement) and volume loss (atrophy) in muscle during the chronic phase (> months/years).

name: Nerve Enlargement/Swelling
description: Proximal to the entrapment site on MRI or US.

name: Nerve Flattening
description: At the site of compression on MRI or US.

name: Nerve Hyperintensity
description: Nerves should be isointense to muscle; hyperintensity on fluid sensitive sequences (T2/STIR/PD SPAIR) indicates pathology.

name: High signal
description: Seen on T2-weighted images.

name: Attenuation
description: 20-50 HU (soft tissue density)

name: Calcifications
description: Stippled/coarse calcifications (85% of cases)

name: Enhancement
description: Heterogeneous (necrosis in 68%)

name: Focal uptake
description: Focal uptake >3x background on MIBG scintigraphy (90% of cases)

name: Hypoechoic mass with calcifications
description: Hypoechoic mass with calcifications (50-60%)

name: Multifocal skeletal uptake
description: Curie score ≥3, diffuse skeletal/bone marrow uptake (SIOPEN score 3)

name: Resistive Index
description: Doppler: RI >0.7 (suggests malignancy)

name: Restricted diffusion
description: ADC <1.1×10⁻³ mm²/s

name: T1 signal intensity
description: Isointense to muscle

name: T2 signal intensity
description: Hyperintense with "salt-and-pepper" appearance

name: "Hole-with-dot" sign
description: Vesicular stage (Stage 1). Cyst fluid follows CSF signal intensity with a visible scolex.

name: "Starry Sky" appearance
description: Multiple calcifications scattered throughout the parenchyma in the Calcified Nodular stage (Stage 4).

name: Blooms on SWI/GRE
description: Calcified Nodular stage (Stage 4).

name: Clusters of cysts in basal cisterns ("bunch of grapes")
description: Racemose NCC. No scolex is usually visible.

name: Cyst fluid hyperintense on FLAIR/T1
description: Colloidal Vesicular stage (Stage 2). Indicates larva is dying and membrane is leaking.

name: Hyperdense calcification
description: Calcified Nodular stage (Stage 4). Dead parasite, fibrosis/calcification.

name: Hypodense cyst with hyperdense eccentric nodule (Scolex)
description: Vesicular stage (Stage 1). Represents a viable larva.

name: Hypointense on all sequences
description: Calcified Nodular stage (Stage 4).

name: Isodense/Hyperdense nodule
description: Granular Nodular stage (Stage 3). Cyst shrinks, granulation tissue forms.

name: Nodular/Ring enhancement
description: Granular Nodular stage (Stage 3).

name: Ring Enhancement
description: Colloidal Vesicular stage (Stage 2). Acute inflammation.

name: Thickened, retracted wall
description: Granular Nodular stage (Stage 3).

name: Hypervascular Enhancement
description: 80-120 HU arterial phase enhancement on CT Enterography

name: Location
description: Most commonly found in the terminal ileum (65%)

name: Mesenteric Stranding
description: Due to desmoplastic reaction

name: Restricted Diffusion
description: ADC <1.1×10⁻³ mm²/s on MRI

name: T2 Hyperintense
description: 80% of NETs are T2 hyperintense on MRI

name: Increased uptake
description: Increased uptake of Ga-68 DOTATATE due to binding to somatostatin receptors

name: "Hot spot" uptake
description: In primary tumors (e.g., pancreatic NETs).

name: Contrast enhancement
description: Contrast enhancement in hypervascular tumors (e.g., carcinoid tumors).

name: Decreased uptake of Ga-68 DOTATATE
description: Poorly differentiated tumors may show decreased uptake of Ga-68 DOTATATE due to loss of SSTR expression (dedifferentiation) and high glucose metabolism (dark on DOTATATE, bright on FDG PET).

name: Enhanced uptake in lymph nodes
description: SUVmax > 3.5 in lymph nodes.

name: Focal area of increased uptake
description: Focal area of increased uptake exceeding background liver activity, indicating primary tumor or metastasis.

name: Focal area of increased uptake
description: Focal area of increased uptake exceeding background liver activity, indicating primary tumor or metastasis.

name: Focal or diffuse uptake
description: Focal or diffuse uptake in primary tumors and metastases.

name: Heterogeneous uptake in liver metastases
description: SUVmax 3-15 in liver metastases.

name: Increased uptake of Ga-68 DOTATATE
description: Tumor cells show increased uptake of Ga-68 DOTATATE due to overexpression of Somatostatin Receptors (SSTRs), particularly SSTR subtype 2. Well-differentiated tumors show high SSTR expression and low glucose metabolism (bright on DOTATATE, dark on FDG PET).

name: Lack of enhancement
description: Lack of enhancement in NETs due to low vascularity.

name: Low attenuation
description: NETs show low attenuation (-50 to -100 HU) on unenhanced CT.

name: Ring-like enhancement
description: Larger lesions (>2 cm) may show ring-like enhancement.

name: SUVmax > 3.5
description: Sensitive (95%) for detecting NETs.

name: SUVmax > 5.0
description: Correlates with higher tumor grade (G2/G3).

name: T1 hypointensity, T2 hyperintensity
description: T1 hypointensity, T2 hyperintensity in NETs.

name: ADC value
description: ADC=1.1-1.3×10⁻³ mm²/s (DWI)

name: Central > peripheral enhancement
description: Post-contrast

name: Isointense
description: T1-weighted imaging

name: Target sign
description: Central 15-25 HU, peripheral 30-45 HU

name: Target sign
description: Hyperintense rim on T2-weighted imaging

name: Carcinoid tumors
description: Ampullary.

name: Dural Ectasia
description: Posterior vertebral scalloping (concavity of the posterior vertebral body).

name: Focal Areas of Signal Intensity (FASI) / Unidentified Bright Objects (UBOs)
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintense lesions without mass effect or enhancement in basal ganglia (globus pallidus), cerebellum, brainstem, thalamus. Appear in childhood and often regress by adulthood.

name: Focal Gigantism
description: Overgrowth of a digit or limb (macrodactyly).

name: Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumors (GIST)
description: More common in NF1.

name: Kyphoscoliosis
description: Sharp, angular thoracic kyphosis.

name: Lateral Meningoceles
description: Herniation of dura/arachnoid through enlarged neural foramina.

name: Localized Neurofibromas
description: Fusiform mass, T2 hyperintense with "Target Sign" (central hypointensity due to collagen, peripheral hyperintensity due to myxoid stroma).

name: Malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor (MPNST)
description: SUVmax >3.5 (sens 94%, spec 87%), ↑ metabolic tumor volume (>25 cm³)

name: Multiple small bowel GISTs
description: Multiple GISTs in the small bowel.

name: Optic pathway glioma
description: T1 iso/hypointense, T2 hyperintense, ↑ ADC values (1.2-1.5 ×10⁻³ mm²/s)

name: Optic Pathway Glioma (OPG)
description: Fusiform enlargement and tortuosity of the optic nerve/chiasm. Variable enhancement. Can involve the hypothalamus. Usually Pilocytic Astrocytoma (WHO Grade 1).

name: Pheochromocytoma
description: Adrenal mass. Screening required if hypertensive.

name: Pilocytic Astrocytoma
description: Strong association, especially in the optic pathway (optic nerve/chiasm/tract).

name: Plexiform neurofibroma
description: T1 hypointense (similar to muscle), T2 hyperintense, "Target sign" (central ↓ signal)

name: Plexiform Neurofibromas
description: Infiltrative, multilobulated mass involving multiple nerve fascicles. "Bag of worms" appearance. 5–10% lifetime risk of malignant transformation to MPNST.

name: Pseudoarthrosis
description: Tibial bowing with cortical thinning (<3 mm)

name: Renal Artery Stenosis
description: Usually involves the ostium (proximal renal artery). Leading cause of hypertension in children with NF1.

name: Rib Ribboning
description: Thinning, twisting, and inferior notching of the ribs (often upper ribs).

name: Sphenoid wing dysplasia
description: Orbital wall defect >5 mm, encephalocele (20% of cases)

name: Sphenoid Wing Dysplasia
description: Hypoplasia/absence of the greater wing of the sphenoid. "Bare Orbit" sign on plain film. Can lead to pulsating exophthalmos.

name: Tibial Pseudoarthrosis
description: Anterolateral bowing of the tibia leading to pathologic fracture and non-union (false joint).

name: Bilateral Vestibular Schwannomas
description: T1 isointense, T2 hyperintense, intense homogeneous enhancement. 'Ice Cream Cone' sign. May show cystic degeneration.

name: Calcification in Meningiomas
description: Calcification within meningiomas.

name: Ependymomas (Spinal)
description: Central cord expansion, 'sausage' shape, hemorrhage cap (T2 hypointense rim), intense enhancement. Location: Cervical cord or conus.

name: Meningiomas (Spinal)
description: Intradural extramedullary masses.

name: Multiple Meningiomas
description: Dural-based, avidly enhancing, 'dural tail' sign. Location: Convexity, falcine, or skull base.

name: Optic Nerve Sheath Meningiomas
description: Optic nerve sheath meningiomas

name: Other Cranial Nerve Schwannomas
description: Commonly involves CN V (Trigeminal) and CN III (Oculomotor).

name: Schwannomas (Spinal)
description: Dumbbell-shaped tumors widening the neural foramen.

name: Widening of porus acusticus and IAC
description: Widening of the porus acusticus and internal auditory canal

name: "Pine-tree" Bladder
description: Heavily trabeculated, elongated bladder.

name: "Bright spotty lesions"
description: Brain lesions with 30% specificity for NMOSD

name: Atrophy
description: Spinal cord atrophy (↓ >30% cross-sectional area) in chronic phase

name: Central cord involvement
description: 80% of acute spinal cord lesions

name: Decreased ADC values
description: Acute lesions (600-800 ×10⁻⁶ mm²/s vs. 1000-1200 normal)

name: Decreased MTR
description: Chronic plaques (<25%)

name: Longitudinally Extensive Transverse Myelitis (LETM)
description: T2 hyperintense lesion spanning ≥3 vertebral segments.

name: Patchy/cloud-like enhancement
description: Spinal cord enhancement pattern (60%)

name: Post-contrast enhancement
description: Optic nerve enhancement in acute phase (90%)

name: Ring-like enhancement
description: Spinal cord enhancement pattern (15%)

name: T2 hyperintensity
description: Periependymal lesions around 3rd/4th ventricles in brain

name: T2 hyperintensity
description: Optic nerve >50% nerve length

name: T2 hyperintensity
description: ≥3 vertebral segments (LETM) in spinal cord

name: T2 hyperintensity
description: Area postrema (hiccups/nausea) in brainstem

name: Acute Subdural Hematoma (SDH)
description: Hyperdense (70-90 HU) collection.

name: Chronic Subdural Hematoma (SDH)
description: Hypodense (20-40 HU) collection.

name: Classic Metaphyseal Lesions (CMLs)
description: Fractures at the distal femur/proximal tibia from limb twisting. >2 metaphyseal fractures = 85% specificity for abuse

name: Cortical Laminar Necrosis
description: Hyperintense on T1-weighted images.

name: Diaphyseal Fractures
description: Spiral pattern in non-ambulatory children

name: Duodenal Hematoma
description: "Coiled spring" appearance.

name: Hepatic Laceration
description: Parenchymal discontinuity >1cm.

name: Hypoxic Injury
description: Gray-white junction effacement.

name: Lacunar Skull
description: Multiple skull fractures.

name: Microhemorrhages
description: Blooming on T2* GRE sequences.

name: Posterior Rib Fractures
description: High PPV (94%) for abuse, especially in infants. 90% specificity.

name: Restricted Diffusion
description: Seen in hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy (HIE) on DWI.

name: Scapular/Spinous Process Fractures
description: Increased specificity for abuse.

name: Eccentric metaphyseal lucency
description: Lucent lesion in the metaphysis of a long bone, located off-center.

name: Fallen fragment sign
description: Fragment of bone displaced within the lesion due to pathologic fracture.

name: Hounsfield Units: 20-70 HU
description: Attenuation values within the lesion.

name: Mild peripheral enhancement
description: Enhancement of the lesion's periphery after contrast administration.

name: No periosteal reaction
description: Absence of new bone formation along the outer surface of the bone.

name: Rind sign
description: Sclerotic margin seen as low signal intensity on T2-weighted images.

name: Scalloped sclerotic border
description: Well-defined border of sclerosis surrounding the lucent lesion.

name: Soap bubble appearance
description: Multiloculated appearance within the lesion.

name: T1 Hypointense
description: Low signal intensity on T1-weighted images.

name: T2 Heterogeneous
description: Variable signal intensity on T2-weighted images, reflecting fibrous and hemorrhagic areas.

name: Cystic spaces
description: Due to necrosis/hemorrhage.

name: Echogenic foci
description: Due to calcifications/fibrosis.

name: Coarse Calcifications
description: Especially in teratomas.

name: T2 hyperintensity (edema): signal intensity ratio liver/spleen >1.2
Ballooning of Frontal and Occipital Horns
description: "Mickey Mouse" appearance

name: Convexity Block
description: Failure of tracer to ascend over the cerebral convexities (Cisternography)

name: DESH (Disproportionately Enlarged Subarachnoid-space Hydrocephalus)
description: Tight high convexity (crowding of gyri at the vertex) and enlarged Sylvian fissures

name: Dilated Temporal Horns
description: > 2 mm width without significant hippocampal atrophy

name: Periventricular Hyperintensity
description: Transependymal edema (T2/FLAIR)

name: Periventricular Hypodensity
description: Represents transependymal flow of CSF (interstitial edema)

name: Prominent Flow Void in Cerebral Aqueduct and Fourth Ventricle
description: Due to hyperdynamic CSF flow

name: Thinning and Upward Bowing of Corpus Callosum
Ventricular Reflux
description: Tracer enters ventricles and persists > 24-48 hours (Cisternography)

name: Ventriculomegaly
description: Disproportionate to cerebral atrophy

name: "Empty notch" sign
description: Hypoechoic gap in the annular ligament.

name: Annular ligament displacement
description: High T2/STIR signal interposed between the radial head and capitellum.

name: No hyperemia
description: Power Doppler shows no hyperemia, differentiating it from a fracture.

name: Normal X-ray
description: No fracture or dislocation is seen in 95% of cases.

name: Radiocapitellar interval >3 mm
description: Normal radiocapitellar interval is ≤3 mm in children <5 years.

name: Delayed esophageal transit
description: Prolonged transit time (>30 sec) and increased retention index (>10% at 5 min) on esophageal transit study.

name: LRV diameter >5 mm

name: Restricted diffusion
