name: Calcification
description: Present in 20-25% of cases (appears as acoustic shadowing).

name: Increased Flow
description: May show increased flow around the plaque during the acute inflammatory phase.

name: Location
description: Most common on the dorsal aspect of the penis.

name: Plaque Appearance
description: Hyperechoic thickening of the tunica albuginea.

name: No signal drop on chemical shift
"Lightbulb Bright" on T2-weighted MRI
description: High T2 signal intensity due to high fluid content/cystic change.

name: <40% washout at 15-min delayed phase
description: Contrast-enhanced CT shows <40% washout at 15-min delayed phase

name: Attenuation >10 HU
description: Unenhanced CT shows attenuation >10 HU (helps differentiate from adenoma which is <10 HU)

name: High diffusivity
description: ADC map shows high diffusivity (>1.2 ×10⁻³ mm²/s)

name: Hyperintense "light bulb" sign
description: T2-weighted MRI shows hyperintense "light bulb" sign (85% sensitivity)

name: Hypervascular
description: Contrast-enhanced CT shows hypervascularity (150-200 HU arterial phase)

name: Increased uptake
description: Increased uptake on 68Ga-DOTATATE PET/CT (sensitivity 98%, specificity 95%)

name: Increased uptake
description: Increased uptake on 123I-MIBG scan (sensitivity 85-90%, specificity 95%)

name: Increased uptake (malignant cases)
description: Increased uptake on 18F-FDG PET (sensitivity 88% for malignant cases)

name: Intense adrenal uptake
description: SUVmax >5.0, uptake >liver at 24h + anatomic correlation (Score 3)

name: No signal loss
description: Chemical shift MRI shows no signal loss (vs. adenoma)

name: Strongly enhancing adrenal mass, high T2 signal
description: Strongly enhancing adrenal mass. High T2 signal ('lightbulb bright'). Often bilateral and multifocal in VHL.

name: T2 hyperintense
description: Compared to liver.

name: Target sign
description: Round, laminations, HU range 200-600.

name: Tram-track calcification
description: Linear calcifications along the vessel wall (95% specificity)

name: Cystic spaces/clefts
description: Present in ~50% of cases. Highly specific finding favoring Phyllodes over fibroadenoma.

name: High-density, oval or lobulated mass
description: Mass with circumscribed, obscured, or indistinct margins. Coarse calcifications may be present but are rare. Radiolucent halo may be seen.

name: Hyperintense mass
description: T2-weighted images show hyperintensity (often heterogeneous due to cystic spaces/necrosis). Rapid initial enhancement with washout (Type 3 curve) or plateau (Type 2 curve) is common post-contrast. Non-enhancing internal septations may be visible.

name: Oval or lobulated mass
description: Circumscribed margins (microlobulated margins are common). Hypoechoic and heterogeneous. Internal vascularity is common on Color Doppler. Posterior acoustic enhancement is common.

name: Physeal bar formation
description: Early growth arrest detection

name: Edema pattern
description: STIR sequence: Edema pattern predicts Salter-Harris type

name: Physeal bar formation
description: T1 hypointense scar tissue

name: Physeal widening
description: >2mm asymmetry suggests injury

name: DWI ADC < 750 mm²/s
description: Verification required.

name: Tip migration
description: >3 cm movement on serial X-rays

name: Tip position
description: Tip in internal jugular vein (Grade 3)

name: Tip position
description: Tip in brachiocephalic vein (Grade 2)

name: Tip position
description: Tip >2 cm above or below the cavoatrial junction (T5-T7)

name: Catheter lumen HU value
description: HU values outside of -100 to +100 HU

name: Stones: T2 hypointense in hyperintense bile
Bone remodeling/scalloping
description: May cause remodeling/scalloping of the occipital bone.

name: Bright on T2, Light on T1 cyst with enhancing nodule
Calcification
description: Occurs in ~20% of cases.

name: Calcifications
description: <5% of cases

name: Cyst with mural nodule
description: Large cystic mass with an intensely enhancing mural nodule.

name: Fluid-density cyst; isodense to hypodense solid nodule
description: Density characteristics of the cyst and nodule.

name: Hydrocephalus
description: Common due to mass effect on the 4th ventricle.

name: Hyperintense
description: T2-weighted images

name: Hyperintense cyst and nodule
description: T2/FLAIR imaging.

name: Hypo- to isointense on T1
description: Appearance on T1-weighted MRI

name: Hypodense cyst
description: Density of 0-20 HU

name: Hypointense cyst, Isointense nodule
description: T1-weighted images

name: Isointense to hypointense solid nodule
description: T1-weighted imaging; relative to gray matter.

name: Isointense to slightly hyperintense cyst fluid
description: T1-weighted imaging; relative to CSF.

name: Minimal or absent edema
description: T2/FLAIR imaging; crucial differentiator from high-grade gliomas or metastases.

name: No diffusion restriction
description: High ADC values; distinguishes it from Medulloblastoma.

name: Nodular enhancement
description: 100% of cases

name: Non-enhancing cyst wall
description: T1 + Contrast (Gadolinium); however, enhancement can occur in ~40% of cases.

name: Vivid, intense enhancement of mural nodule
description: T1 + Contrast (Gadolinium).

name: Calcification in the wall
description: Present in ~25% of cases

name: Hyperintense T2 signal
description: Isointense to CSF

name: No restricted diffusion
description: Normal DWI signal

name: Rim enhancement
description: Represents compressed normal pineal gland. No nodular/solid enhancement.

name: Variable T1 signal
description: 50% isointense to CSF, 50% hyperintense

name: Well-circumscribed, fluid density
description: Density of 0-20 HU

name: Engulfed pineal calcifications
description: Characteristic of germinomas.

name: Triventricular hydrocephalus
description: Due to compression of the cerebral aqueduct.

name: "Exploded" calcification
description: Tumor expands rapidly from the center, pushing calcifications to the periphery

name: Heterogeneous enhancement
description: T1+C

name: Invasion into adjacent structures
description: Corpus callosum, thalamus

name: Restricted diffusion
description: Highly cellular

name: "Exploded" pattern or central calcification
description: Less aggressive than pineoblastoma

name: Solid appearance
description: Often looks like a "solid" pineal cyst but enhances completely

name: Strong, solid enhancement
description: T1+C

name: Piriformis Muscle Asymmetry
description: Asymmetry of the piriformis muscle.

name: Sciatic Nerve Hyperintensity
description: T2 hyperintensity of the sciatic nerve at the sciatic notch.

name: Delayed enhancement
description: Microadenomas enhance slower than normal pituitary tissue on CT.

name: Heterogeneous enhancement
description: Macroadenomas show variable enhancement patterns on CT (30-60 HU post-contrast).

name: Heterogeneous signal intensity
description: Macroadenomas on T1WI.

name: Hyperintense with heterogeneity
description: Macroadenomas on T2WI.

name: Hypodense relative to normal pituitary
description: Microadenomas appear less dense than normal pituitary tissue on CT (20-30 HU vs 40-50 HU).

name: Hypoenhancing on early images
description: Microadenomas show less enhancement than normal pituitary tissue on early post-contrast MRI images.

name: Hypointense or isointense
description: Microadenomas on T1WI.

name: Pituitary stalk deviation
description: Deviation of the pituitary stalk >2mm from midline on CT.

name: Sellar expansion
description: Erosion of the sella floor and thinning of the dorsum sellae on CT.

name: Suprasellar extension
description: Macroadenomas extending superiorly, potentially creating a "snowman" or "figure-8" configuration on CT.

name: Variable signal intensity
description: Microadenomas on T2WI (hyperintense, hypointense, or isointense).

name: Blooming artifact
description: T2* GRE / SWI, indicates hemosiderin/blood products.

name: Fluid-fluid levels
description: T2-weighted, highly suggestive of hemorrhage within a cystic/necrotic mass.

name: Hyperdense mass within sella turcica
description: Represents acute blood. Low sensitivity for small hemorrhages.

name: Hyperintense sella
description: T1-weighted, subacute (>7 days), due to extracellular methemoglobin.

name: Iso- to hypointense or hyperintense sella
description: T1-weighted, acute (<7 days), depending on exact timing (deoxyhemoglobin or methemoglobin).

name: Peripheral rim enhancement
description: Post-contrast T1, central necrotic/hemorrhagic core does not enhance.

name: Restricted diffusion
description: DWI, may be seen in pituitary infarction (coagulative necrosis) without frank hemorrhage.

name: Sellar expansion/erosion
description: Evidence of chronic macroadenoma (bone window).

name: Sphenoid sinus mucosal thickening
description: Post-contrast T1, reactive finding seen in up to 80% of acute apoplexy cases.

name: Variable/Heterogeneous signal
description: T2-weighted.

name: Restricted diffusion
description: DWI, may be seen in pituitary infarction (coagulative necrosis) without frank hemorrhage.

name: Bridging vessels extending from placenta into the bladder
description: Suggests Percreta.

name: Increased placental vascularity
description: Increased vascularity within the placenta and at the placental-myometrial interface.

name: Lacunae
description: Presence of multiple irregular vascular spaces (lacunae) within the placenta.

name: Loss of clear zone between placenta and myometrium
description: Loss of the normal hypoechoic retroplacental myometrial zone.

name: Placental Heterogeneity
description: Signal heterogeneity within the placenta.

name: Thinning or disruption of the myometrium
description: Focal thinning or disruption of the myometrium overlying the placenta.

name: Turbulent, high-velocity flow in lacunae
description: Doppler shows turbulent, high-velocity flow in lacunae.

name: Placenta over or near the internal cervical os
description: TVUS is the gold standard. A full bladder can mimic previa (false positive).

name: Marginal hematoma
description: Subchorionic hematoma.

name: Retroplacental hematoma
description: Appearance varies with age: Acute (hyperechoic/isoechoic), Subacute (hypoechoic), Chronic (anechoic/complex).

name: Enthesopathy
description: Bone marrow edema in calcaneus

name: Heel spur
description: >5 mm protrusion at medial calcaneal tubercle

name: Hyperintense edema
description: T2/STIR

name: Hypoechoic areas
description: Edema

name: Hypointense fascia
description: T1-weighted image

name: Neovascularity
description: Doppler RI <0.7

name: Thickened fascia
description: >4 mm at calcaneal insertion

name: Circumscription
description: Well-circumscribed

name: Enhancement pattern
description: Lobulated, checkerboard enhancement

name: Posterior acoustic enhancement
description: Present

name: T1 signal intensity
description: Isointense (muscle)

name: T2 signal intensity
description: Hyperintense (light bulb sign)

name: Pleural Effusion Depth
description: Pleural effusion >1cm depth

name: Enhancement
description: Post-contrast enhancement

name: Absent or paper-thin bowel wall enhancement
description: Suggests necrosis

name: Cystic/Bubble-like pneumatosis
description: Discrete gas pockets; associated with benign etiologies (Pneumatosis Cystoides Intestinalis)

name: High-amplitude linear echoes
description: Within the bowel wall with posterior "dirty shadowing" or ring-down artifact

name: Intramural gas
description: Gas within the bowel wall

name: Linear pneumatosis
description: Band-like gas parallel to the bowel wall; high specificity for bowel infarction/ischemia

name: Pneumoperitoneum
description: Indicates perforation

name: Portomesenteric Venous Gas (PMVG)
description: Gas in the portal vein (peripheral liver) or mesenteric veins

name: Radiolucent streaks or bubbles
description: Conforming to the bowel wall contour

name: Rigler’s Sign
description: Double wall sign (usually indicates pneumoperitoneum, but extensive pneumatosis can mimic this)

name: Continuous diaphragm sign
description: Visualization of entire diaphragm due to mediastinal air outlining its central portion

name: Consolidation
description: Consolidation >3cm + air bronchograms

name: Consolidation
description: Airspace opacification with air bronchograms

name: Consolidation with air bronchograms
description: Consolidation with air bronchograms

name: Infiltrates
description: Increased density in lung tissue, reducing contrast compared to normal lung tissue (Δ15-20 HU difference)

name: Pneumonia detection
description: AI systems demonstrate high sensitivity (>85%) in detecting pneumonia on chest X-ray.

name: Matched Defects
description: Ventilation and perfusion defects align.

name: Free air
description: >2cm under diaphragm

name: Free air in the peritoneal cavity
description: Small amount of pneumoperitoneum is common post-procedure and usually resolves in 3-5 days.

name: Air in pleural space
description: With mediastinal shift

name: Apical air collection
description: 5-15mm apical air collection with HU -1000.

name: Bubble lucency
description: Air tracking along needle path

name: Deep sulcus sign
description: Deep costophrenic angle supine

name: Missed pneumothorax
description: 15% in ICU patients, 2mm pleural line detection threshold

name: Goblet sign
description: Renal pelvis splayed around cysts resembling goblet

name: Irregular/Bumpy gyral pattern
description: Irregular, bumpy cortical surface

name: Diffuse wall calcification
description: High risk of cancer

name: Diffuse wall calcification
description: Calcification of the gallbladder wall

name: CSF density
description: CSF density

name: T2 hyperintense
description: T2 hyperintense signal

name: Anechoic, fluid-filled space communicating with the ventricle
description: Often seen in the context of evolving Grade IV Germinal Matrix Hemorrhage.

name: Communication with ipsilateral ventricle
description: Demonstrable connection with the ipsilateral ventricle.

name: CSF signal intensity
description: Hypointense on T1, Hyperintense on T2

name: Hyperintense rim surrounding the cyst
description: On FLAIR, complete suppression of fluid (dark) with a hyperintense rim representing gliosis (white matter scarring).

name: No restricted diffusion
description: On DWI, no restricted diffusion (distinguishes from abscess or epidermoid cyst).

name: Smooth-walled cavity
description: Key morphologic feature.

name: Well-defined, focal fluid-filled cavity
description: Density is isodense to CSF (0-10 HU). No enhancement. Usually negative mass effect (associated with focal atrophy, widened sulci, and ex vacuo dilatation of the adjacent ventricle). Rare calcification unless associated with TORCH infections.

name: White matter lining
description: The tissue lining the cyst is white matter (gliosis).

name: "Bull's-eye" portal venules
description: Appearance of portal venules on CT

name: Ascites
description: Associated sign

name: Cavernous transformation
description: Transformation of the portal vein into a network of small vessels

name: Congestion index (Area/Velocity) >0.13
description: Increased congestion index

name: Dilated Left Gastric Vein
description: > 5 mm at the gastroesophageal junction

name: Dilated Portal Vein
description: Diameter > 10 mm

name: Dilated Portal Vein
description: > 13 mm

name: Hepatic fibrosis (PDFF <5% in advanced cirrhosis)
description: Decreased proton density fat fraction in advanced cirrhosis

name: Hepatofugal flow
description: Reversal of flow in the portal vein

name: Hepatofugal Flow
description: Reversed flow in portal vein

name: Hepatofugal Flow
description: Flow away from the liver (below baseline) in the portal vein.

name: Liver stiffness >12.5 kPa (F4 fibrosis)
description: Increased liver stiffness indicating advanced fibrosis

name: Nodular liver contour
description: Associated sign

name: Portal vein >13 mm diameter
description: 88% specific for portal hypertension

name: Portal vein diameter >13mm
description: Enlarged portal vein diameter

name: Portosystemic collaterals
description: Presence of collateral vessels bypassing the liver

name: Portosystemic shunts
description: Splenorenal, associated sign

name: Reversed flow in SMV
description: Reversal of flow in the superior mesenteric vein

name: Spleen length >13cm
description: Splenomegaly

name: Splenic Vein Diameter
description: > 12 mm indicates high risk

name: Splenic vein flow reversal
description: Doppler sensitivity 95%

name: Splenomegaly
description: Associated sign

name: Splenomegaly
description: Spleen length > 13 cm

name: Stagnant/Slow Flow
description: Portal vein velocity < 16 cm/s.

name: T1 hyperintense/T2 hypointense varices
description: Appearance of varices on MRI

name: TE >21 kPa for CSPH
description: Increased transient elastography value indicating clinically significant portal hypertension

name: Varices >3mm diameter
description: Enlarged varices

name: Velocity <12 cm/s
description: Decreased portal vein velocity

name: "Ghost" Lesion (ablation zone larger than original tumor)
description: Indicates adequate ablation margin.

name: Gas bubbles within the ablation zone
description: Common finding immediately post-ablation (vaporization).

name: Ground-glass opacity (perilesional)
description: Represents edema/hemorrhage immediately post-ablation.

name: Hematoma detection
description: Density >40 HU

name: Hemorrhage
description: Signal dropout >5mm on T2*

name: Elevated Resistive Index (RI)
description: RI > 0.7 due to renal edema and vasoconstriction.
pathology_name: Post-Contrast Acute Kidney Injury (PC-AKI) / Contrast-Induced Acute Kidney Injury (CI-AKI) / Contrast-Induced Nephropathy (CIN)

name: Increased Cortical Echogenicity
description: Non-specific sign of intrinsic renal disease/ATN.
pathology_name: Post-Contrast Acute Kidney Injury (PC-AKI) / Contrast-Induced Acute Kidney Injury (CI-AKI) / Contrast-Induced Nephropathy (CIN)

name: Normal Kidneys
description: Kidneys may appear normal on ultrasound.
pathology_name: Post-Contrast Acute Kidney Injury (PC-AKI) / Contrast-Induced Acute Kidney Injury (CI-AKI) / Contrast-Induced Nephropathy (CIN)

name: Persistent Nephrogram
description: Kidneys remain hyperdense (enhanced) on non-contrast CT scans obtained 24–48 hours after contrast administration due to contrast retention within the tubules.
pathology_name: Post-Contrast Acute Kidney Injury (PC-AKI) / Contrast-Induced Acute Kidney Injury (CI-AKI) / Contrast-Induced Nephropathy (CIN)

name: Ventricular dilation
description: Ventricular Index (VI) >97th percentile

name: Extraluminal contrast
description: Water-soluble contrast (Gastrografin) first, followed by thin barium if negative. Most common within 10 days post-op at the gastrojejunal (GJ) anastomosis in RYGB or proximal staple line in Sleeve Gastrectomy.

name: Fluid collection
description: Fluid collection near anastomosis

name: Hepatic artery buffer response
description: HA RI <0.7

name: Increased ADC values in FLR
description: ADC values 1.2-1.5 ×10⁻³ mm²/s in FLR

name: Increased FLR portal flow
description: FLR portal flow increases to 25-40 cm/s

name: Hyperechoic cloud with dirty shadowing
description: Appearance of microbubbles forming from vaporization during RFA.

name: Low attenuation zone
description: Zone encompassing the tumor during RFA, indicating ablation.

name: Valvular incompetence
description: Incompetent venous valves.

name: Venous collaterals
description: Development of alternative venous pathways.

name: Wall-adherent thrombus
description: Thrombus attached to the vein wall.

name: Dark bands/streaks between two dense objects
description: Beam hardening artifact mimicking hemorrhage.

name: Hypodensity in posterior fossa
description: Area of decreased attenuation in the posterior fossa, potentially obscured by beam hardening artifacts.

name: Hyperintense edema
description: Hyperintense edema on T2/FLAIR sequences. 90% parieto-occipital, 70% frontal, 30% cerebellum/brainstem involvement.

name: Hypodensity
description: Hypodensity in posterior regions (20-25 HU vs normal brain 30-40 HU). Symmetric parieto-occipital > frontal > cerebellar involvement.

name: Increased ADC values
description: Increased ADC values on ADC map, indicating vasogenic edema.

name: Iso-/hypointense
description: Iso-/hypointense on DWI (ADC >1000 x10⁻⁶ mm²/s) in 85% cases.

name: No enhancement
description: No enhancement on T1 post-contrast in 95% of cases. Patchy enhancement may be seen if BBB disruption is present.

name: Posterior > anterior distribution
description: Edema predominantly in posterior regions.

name: Sparing of deep gray nuclei
description: Relative sparing of deep gray nuclei.

name: Symmetric involvement
description: Symmetric edema in affected regions.

name: Inverted V sign
description: Dilated posterior urethra tapering to obstruction point

name: Keyhole sign
description: Dilated bladder and posterior urethra forming keyhole shape

name: Popliteus tendon abnormality
description: Abnormal signal or disruption of the popliteus tendon

name: Arcuate Sign
description: Avulsion fracture of the fibular head styloid process.

name: LCL Discontinuity or Waviness
description: Discontinuity or waviness of the Lateral Collateral Ligament on coronal MRI images. Often avulses from the fibular head.

name: PFL Absence or Thickening
description: Absence or thickening of the Popliteofibular Ligament on axial MRI images.

name: Popliteus Tendon High Signal or Fluid
description: High signal or fluid surrounding the popliteus tendon on MRI. Look for avulsion from the femoral attachment.

name: Proximal Tibiofibular Joint Dislocation
description: Widening of the joint space or displacement of the fibular head at the proximal tibiofibular joint.

name: Subperiosteal abscess
description: ADC <1.0x10⁻³ mm²/s

name: ADC <1.0×10⁻³ mm²/s
description: Restricted diffusion on DWI

name: Irregular margins
description: Mass with irregular margins

name: Pleomorphic calcifications
description: ≥5 calcifications/cm²

name: Rapid washout
description: >10% signal drop after contrast administration

name: Spiculated mass
description: Mass with spiculated margins

name: Taller-than-wide
description: Mass is taller than it is wide

name: Background Parenchymal Enhancement
description: Increased background parenchymal enhancement

name: Skin Thickening
description: Skin thickening

name: Susceptibility Artifacts (Blooming)
description: Distortion of the image due to the presence of metal. More pronounced on Gradient Echo (GRE) sequences.

name: Cavernosal Artery Flow
description: High resistance, low or absent diastolic flow. Eventually, flow ceases completely.

name: AV Fistula
description: Color Doppler shows a "blush" of turbulent flow within the cavernosa.

name: Spectral Doppler Flow
description: High velocity, turbulent flow at the fistula site.

name: Attenuation
description: 20-40 HU (higher than myeloma)

name: Cortical Destruction
description: Permeative pattern (>90% cases)

name: Diffusion
description: Restricted diffusion (ADC <1.0×10⁻³ mm²/s)

name: Enhancement
description: Moderate heterogeneous (vs vivid in angiosarcoma)

name: Soft Tissue Component
description: Homogeneous density (no calcifications)

name: SUVmax
description: >10 suggests aggressive histology

name: T1 Signal
description: Hypointense to muscle

name: T2 Signal
description: Hyperintense with low-signal fibrous strands

name: "Ghost tumor"
description: Dramatic response to steroid administration.

name: Homogeneous enhancement
description: Lesions show homogeneous enhancement in 70-80% of cases.

name: Hyperdense lesions pre-contrast
description: Lesions appear hyperdense (40-50 HU) before contrast administration.

name: Hyperintense surrounding edema
description: Edema surrounding the lesion on FLAIR imaging.

name: Hypointense (80%) vs iso-/hyperintense
description: Appearance on T2-weighted imaging.

name: Intense homogeneous enhancement
description: Intense homogeneous enhancement after gadolinium administration (90%).

name: Iso-/hypointense
description: Appearance on T1-weighted imaging.

name: Low rCBV
description: Lower relative cerebral blood volume compared to glioblastoma.

name: Restricted diffusion
description: Restricted diffusion on DWI (ADC 400-600x10⁻⁶ mm²/s).

name: SUVmax 12-25
description: Higher SUVmax than gliomas.

name: Concordant SPECT/CT anatomic correlation
description: Focal tracer uptake on SPECT correlated with a soft tissue nodule (40-60 HU) in the parathyroid region on CT.

name: Focal tracer retention on delayed imaging
description: Persistent uptake on delayed phase (2-3 hours) compared to early phase (15-30 minutes) on Sestamibi scan.

name: Target-to-background ratio >1.5
description: Quantitative measure of tracer uptake in the parathyroid adenoma compared to surrounding tissue.

name: "Fixed" uptake
description: Delayed planar imaging shows persistent focal activity while the surrounding thyroid background fades (washout).

name: Focal area of increased uptake relative to normal thyroid tissue
description: Early planar imaging shows increased uptake in the adenoma compared to the thyroid.

name: Precise anatomic localization of adenoma
description: SPECT/CT allows differentiation between posterior thyroid nodules and parathyroid adenomas and localization of ectopic adenomas.

name: Beaded bile ducts
description: Alternating 1-2mm strictures/4-5mm dilatations

name: Beaded bile ducts
description: Alternating strictures and dilations of the intra- and extrahepatic bile ducts.

name: Diverticulum-like outpouchings
description: Small outpouchings arising from the bile ducts.

name: Duct-penetrating sign
description: Contrast enhancement extending into the bile duct wall.

name: Lead pipe
description: Rigid, non-branching bile ducts.

name: Liver atrophy
description: Right lobe:left lobe ratio <0.8 in 40%

name: Periductal enhancement
description: Enhancement around the bile ducts on T1-weighted MRI.

name: Peripheral atrophy with central hypertrophy
description: Atrophy of the liver periphery with relative hypertrophy of the central liver segments.

name: Pruned tree appearance
description: MRCP, 90% specificity

name: Pruned tree appearance
description: Irregular narrowing and beading of the bile ducts, resembling a pruned tree.

name: Segmental duct dilation
description: 2-3mm with band-like strictures

name: Segmental duct dilation
description: Focal dilation of bile ducts.

name: Skip lesions
description: Alternating strictures and dilations along the bile ducts.

name: Twinkling artifact at strictures
description: Artifactual color Doppler signal at the site of biliary strictures.

name: Circumscribed oval mass
description: Mass less than 2 cm

name: Oval hypoechoic mass with posterior enhancement
description: Oval mass with posterior acoustic enhancement

name: Smooth rim enhancement
description: Enhancement only at the rim of the lesion

name: Decreased NAA, Increased Choline, Increased Lipid/Lactate
description: MR Spectroscopy: ↓NAA, ↑Cho, ↑Lipid/Lactate (Lac/NAA >0.7)

name: Decreased rCBV
description: Perfusion: ↓rCBV (vs. ↑rCBV in lymphoma)

name: Hypodense white matter lesions
description: Hypodense white matter lesions (20-30 HU vs normal 30-40 HU)

name: Hypointense "punched-out" lesions
description: T1 hypointensity, gray-white junction involvement (80%)

name: Multifocal hyperintense white matter lesions
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintensity, lesion size 1-3cm early, confluent >5cm

name: No enhancement
description: Post-contrast, no enhancement (90%), enhancement suggests IRIS (PML-IRIS)

name: No mass effect
description: Key differential from tumors

name: Peripheral restriction
description: DWI peripheral restriction (active edge), ADC values <800 x10⁻⁶ mm²/s

name: Posterior fossa involvement
description: Posterior fossa involvement (15%)

name: Bilateral striatal uptake loss
description: Bilateral loss of Ioflupane I-123 binding on DaTscan.

name: Hypodense areas with rim enhancement
description: Hypodense areas (10–30 HU) with rim enhancement

name: Cancer detection
description: AI systems demonstrate high performance (AUC >0.85) in detecting prostate cancer on MRI.

name: Decreased Citrate
description: Reduced citrate levels

name: Focal uptake in prostate bed
description: Focal uptake in the prostate gland or post-prostatectomy bed indicates local recurrence or residual disease.

name: Increased Choline
description: Elevated choline levels (Cho+Cr/Citrate > 0.8)

name: Lymph node metastases
description: Uptake in lymph nodes, even small ones (2-4 mm), particularly in obturator, external iliac, internal iliac, and presacral chains, suggests metastatic disease.

name: PI-RADS score
description: ≥4 lesions (93% sensitivity)

name: Equivocal DWI (ADC 750-900 mm²/s)
description: Intermediate likelihood of cancer, PI-RADS score 3.

name: Extraprostatic extension or necrosis
description: Indicates advanced disease, PI-RADS score 5.

name: Focal decreased ADC + increased b1400 signal
description: Restricted diffusion on DWI, PI-RADS score 4. ADC cutoff <750 mm²/s is suggestive of cancer.

name: Focal early enhancement matching DWI findings
description: Early enhancement on DCE, supporting the presence of cancer.

name: Lesion size >15mm with DWI restriction
description: Large lesion with restricted diffusion, PI-RADS score 5.

name: T2WI: Homogeneous hyperintense signal in PZ
description: Normal finding in the peripheral zone (PZ), PI-RADS score 1.

name: T2WI: Stromal BPH (lenticular, capsule) in TZ
description: Benign finding in the transition zone (TZ), PI-RADS score 2.

name: Enlarged lymph nodes with PSMA uptake
description: Lymph nodes > 1cm with increased PSMA uptake.

name: Focal uptake in axial skeleton
description: Focal PSMA uptake in vertebrae or pelvis, indicating bone metastases.

name: Hypermetabolic lesion in prostate
description: Increased PSMA uptake in the prostate gland.

name: Hypointense lesion in prostate
description: Lesion in the prostate gland appearing hypointense on T2-weighted MRI.

name: Increased SUVmax in pelvic/retroperitoneal lymph nodes
description: SUVmax > 4.5 in pelvic or retroperitoneal lymph nodes.

name: Lytic or sclerotic bone changes with PSMA uptake
description: Bone lesions with lytic or sclerotic changes on CT, accompanied by increased PSMA uptake.

name: Focal hyperintense fluid collection
description: Fluid collection with high signal intensity on T2-weighted images.

name: Hypoechoic or anechoic thick-walled lesion
description: Lesion with decreased or absent echogenicity and a thick wall.

name: Hypointense
description: Low signal intensity on T1-weighted images (may be hyperintense if proteinaceous/hemorrhagic).

name: Internal echoes
description: Debris within the lesion.

name: Internal septations
description: Septations within the fluid collection.

name: Marked restricted diffusion
description: High signal on DWI and low signal on ADC.

name: Posterior acoustic enhancement
description: Increased echogenicity behind the lesion.

name: Rim enhancement
description: Enhancement of the abscess wall after contrast administration.

name: Thick, irregular rim enhancement
description: Enhancement of the abscess wall after contrast administration on T1-weighted images.

name: Well-defined, hypoattenuating fluid collection
description: Fluid collection with low attenuation values (0-20 HU).

name: Avid, often heterogeneous enhancement
description: Enhancement of the prostate gland after contrast administration on T1-weighted images.

name: Diffuse enlargement of the gland
description: Enlargement of the prostate gland.

name: Diffuse or focal hyperintensity
description: Edema within the prostate gland on T2-weighted images.

name: Diffuse or focal hypoattenuation
description: Edema within the prostate gland.

name: Enlarged, hypoechoic gland
description: Enlargement and decreased echogenicity of the prostate gland.

name: Halo sign
description: Periurethral hypoechoic zone.

name: Increased flow
description: Hyperemia on color Doppler ultrasound.

name: Surrounding fat stranding
description: Inflammation in the periprostatic fat.

name: Interface uptake
description: FDG uptake at the interface between the prosthesis and surrounding tissue (SUV >2.0).

name: Peri-prosthetic fluid
description: Peri-prosthetic fluid collection (>3mm).

name: Increased uptake
description: Focal increased uptake around the prosthesis.

name: Increased uptake
description: Focal increased uptake around the prosthesis.

name: Increased uptake
description: Focal increased uptake around the prosthesis.

name: Cortical erosions
description: >3 mm scalloping

name: Diffuse uptake >6 mos post-op
description: Probable PJI according to modified Palestro criteria. Diffuse uptake of In-111 WBCs more than 6 months after surgery.

name: Fluid collections around stem
description: >5 mm around stem (HU=10-30)

name: Increased uptake
description: SUVmax >5.0

name: No uptake beyond 12 mos
description: Unlikely PJI according to modified Palestro criteria. Absence of In-111 WBC uptake beyond 12 months after surgery.

name: Periosteal reaction
description: Late sign of PJI

name: Rapid component loosening
description: >2 mm/year radiolucency

name: Sinus tract enhancement
description: Post-contrast T1

name: T2 hyperintensity around implant
description: >3 mm thickness

name: Uptake at bone-prosthesis interface + SUVratio >3.5
description: Definite PJI according to modified Palestro criteria. Increased uptake at the bone-prosthesis interface with a standardized uptake value ratio greater than 3.5.

name: "Spike" sign
description: Contrast abruptly stops at the cornual region.

name: Cornual "club-shaped" cutoff
description: Contrast stops abruptly at the cornual region, creating a club-like appearance.

name: No "Spill" sign
description: Contrast does not freely spill from the fimbriae, indicating obstruction.

name: Fracture
description: Tuberosity avulsion of the 5th metatarsal

name: Pseudoaneurysm
description: Focal outpouching of contrast from an artery

name: Pseudoaneurysm
description: Occurs with low femoral artery stick (profunda/SFA).

name: Hypoechoic collection
description: Hypoechoic collection adjacent to the artery.

name: To-and-Fro waveform
description: Systole: Flow into the sac (above baseline). Diastole: Flow out of the sac (below baseline) at the neck.

name: Yin-Yang sign
description: Swirling red and blue flow within the sac.

name: >3 mm diameter
description: Small aneurysmal outpouchings

name: Non-mass Enhancement (NME)
description: Can cause NME due to benign proliferative changes and hormonal responsiveness.

name: Tumor-induced desmoplasia
description: Fibrosis without true regenerative nodules

name: Intrauterine Fluid without Double Decidual Sign
Intrauterine Fluid without Double Decidual Sign
"Starry sky" appearance
description: Echogenic particles in peritoneal fluid.

name: Echogenic peritoneal fluid
description: Fluid that does not move freely with respiration.

name: Omental Cake
description: Thickening and increased density of the omentum.

name: Scalloping of the Liver/Spleen
description: Mucinous ascites exerts mass effect on visceral organs.

name: Septated Ascites
description: Loculated fluid collections.

name: Dactylitis
description: Inflammation of a digit, involving flexor tenosynovitis and soft tissue edema.

name: Early erosions
description: Small areas of bone destruction at joint margins.

name: Entheseal bone marrow edema
description: Increased signal intensity on STIR sequences at entheses, indicating inflammation.

name: Floating phalanx
description: Severe osteolysis resulting in a phalanx appearing unattached.

name: Hypoechoic enthesophytes
description: New bone formation at entheses appearing dark on ultrasound.

name: Paravertebral ossification (non-marginal syndesmophytes)
description: Bony bridges between vertebrae that are not continuous with the vertebral endplates.

name: Pencil-in-cup deformity
description: Osteolysis of the distal phalanx with a pointed appearance fitting into the cupped base of the proximal phalanx, typically at DIP joints.

name: Power Doppler at entheses
description: Increased blood flow at entheses, indicating active inflammation.

name: Proliferative changes at entheses
description: New bone formation at tendon or ligament insertion sites.

name: Acroosteolysis
description: Resorption of the distal phalanges

name: Dactylitis
description: Flexor tenosynovitis + soft tissue edema (sausage digit)

name: Decreased SI joint space
description: SI joint space <2mm (normal 2-5mm)

name: Erosive changes
description: Erosions in the hands and feet

name: Pencil-in-cup deformity
description: Erosion of the distal interphalangeal joints (DIPs)

name: Periostitis
description: "Fluffy" periosteal reaction

name: Delayed Bone Age
description: Skeletal maturation is behind chronological age, often associated with delayed onset of puberty.

name: Advanced Bone Age
description: Skeletal maturation is ahead of chronological age, often associated with early onset of puberty.

name: Perineal Fat Plane Deviation
description: Deviation of perineal fat planes.

name: Scarring or Fibrosis
description: Scarring or fibrosis at the ischial spine.

name: Crazy paving pattern
description: Ground glass opacity with superimposed interlobular septal thickening

name: <1.5mm/yr growth
description: Abnormal pulmonary artery growth rate on CT angiography

name: Fleischner sign
description: Enlarged central pulmonary artery from acute pulmonary embolism

name: Westermark sign
description: Regional oligemia (decreased vascularity) distal to pulmonary embolus

name: Filling defect in pulmonary artery
description: Intraluminal filling defect on CTPA

name: Filling defect in pulmonary artery
description: N/A

name: Right heart strain
description: RV/LV ratio >1, septal bowing

name: Saddle embolus
description: Embolus at main PA bifurcation

name: Band-like defects
description: Chronic PE appearance on perfusion imaging.

name: Bronchial artery dilation
description: Bronchial artery diameter >1.5 mm

name: Filling defect
description: 40-60 HU filling defect within pulmonary artery

name: Hyperintense edema
description: Edema surrounding the PE appears hyperintense on T2-weighted images

name: Isointense thrombus
description: Thrombus appears isointense on T1-weighted images

name: McConnell's sign
description: RV free wall hypokinesis with apical sparing

name: Mosaic pattern
description: Chronic PE appearance on perfusion imaging.

name: Mottled perfusion
description: Partial recanalization of thrombus in subacute PE.

name: PA diameter >29 mm
description: Enlarged pulmonary artery

name: PE evaluation
description: CTA is most appropriate for PE evaluation with 95% sensitivity (ACR Appropriateness Category 9)

name: Pneumothorax
description: Indirect sign, not specific to PE.

name: Railway track sign
description: Filling defect with contrast tracking along the vessel wall

name: RV strain
description: RV/LV diameter ratio >1.0

name: RV/LV ratio
description: RV/LV ratio >1.0

name: Segmental mismatch
description: Ventilation-perfusion mismatch with segmental perfusion defect and normal ventilation. High probability for PE (85-95%)

name: Segmental perfusion defect with ventilation mismatch
description: Two or more segmental perfusion defects with normal ventilation

name: Segmental perfusion defects
description: Perfusion (Q) defect without corresponding ventilation (V) defect on V/Q scan. High probability defined as ≥2 large segmental defects (≥75% occlusion) with normal ventilation.

name: TR jet velocity >2.8 m/s
description: Elevated tricuspid regurgitation jet velocity indicating pulmonary hypertension

name: Wedge-shaped perfusion defects
description: Acute PE appearance on perfusion imaging.

name: Popcorn calcification
description: Calcification pattern resembling popcorn

name: Not directly visualized on V/Q scan
description: A late complication of PE, not directly visualized on V/Q scan but suggested by chronic perfusion defects.

name: Hampton hump
description: Pleural-based wedge-shaped opacity from pulmonary embolism with infarction

name: Increasing HU
description: Increasing HU (e.g., from 30 HU to 60 HU) suggests solid component and potential malignant transformation

name: Solid Nodule
description: >200 HU suggests benign calcified granuloma

name: Subsolid Nodule
description: -100 to 20 HU suggests higher malignancy risk

name: No significant difference in detection rate at 0.5 mSv
description: Iterative Reconstruction (IR) does not significantly change the detection rate of pulmonary nodules at 0.5 mSv (Lung-RADS 1A).

name: Small nodules
description: Detection of <5 mm nodules improved with Iterative Reconstruction (IR) by 22% vs Filtered Back Projection (FBP).

name: Perinephric stranding
description: Inflammation around the kidney.

name: Striated nephrogram
description: Striated nephrogram pattern on T2-weighted MRI

name: Biliary Obstruction and Bacterial Colonization
description: Inflammation of the bile ducts with bacterial colonization

name: Gas Bubbles in Pyogenic Abscess
description: Presence of gas bubbles within the abscess

name: Complex Fluid
description: Fluid density > 15-30 HU.

name: Debris/fluid-fluid levels within the collecting system
description: Presence of debris or fluid-fluid levels within the renal collecting system.

name: Hydronephrosis
description: Anechoic fluid in the central sinus (dilation of calyces and pelvis).

name: Abnormal Radiocapitellar Line
description: Radiocapitellar Line (RCL) does not bisect the capitellum on any view.

name: Elevated/Displaced Anterior Fat Pad (Sail Sign)
description: Anterior fat pad is elevated/displaced anteriorly, resembling a spinnaker sail.

name: Fat pad sign
description: Elevated anterior fat pad (>5 mm) or posterior fat pad.

name: Fracture lines
description: Cortical discontinuity at the radial head.

name: Fragment displacement
description: >50% fragment displacement or >2 mm displacement.

name: Posterior Fat Pad
description: Visualization of the posterior fat pad, indicating joint effusion (hemarthrosis).

name: ADC values 1.4-1.6 ×10⁻³ mm²/s
description: Apparent Diffusion Coefficient (ADC) values between 1.4 and 1.6 ×10⁻³ mm²/s (vs. malignancy 0.9-1.2).

name: Architectural distortion
description: Architectural distortion.

name: Black star
description: Appearance on mammography.

name: Hypointense central scar
description: T2-weighted imaging shows a hypointense central scar.

name: Irregular hypoechoic area
description: Irregular hypoechoic area.

name: No central density
description: Absence of central density within the spiculated mass (vs. malignancy).

name: No posterior shadowing
description: Absence of posterior acoustic shadowing (82% specificity).

name: Persistent enhancement
description: Kinetic curve showing persistent enhancement (65%) or plateau (30%).

name: Radial spoke pattern
description: Appearance on MRI subtraction images.

name: Spiculated mass
description: Spiculated mass, average size 6-10 mm, range 3-20 mm.

name: Vascularity RI 0.6-0.7
description: Vascularity with Resistive Index (RI) between 0.6 and 0.7 (vs. malignancy RI > 0.8).

name: Marrow edema
description: HU -10 to 30

name: Osteoporosis
description: T-score <-2.5

name: Architectural distortion
description: General distortion of breast tissue

name: Decreased ADC
description: DWI, ADC 0.8-1.2 ×10⁻³ mm²/s (recurrence)

name: Hyperintense edema
description: T2WI, acute phase

name: Hypointense fibrosis
description: T2WI, chronic phase

name: Increased ADC
description: DWI, ADC 1.5-2.0 ×10⁻³ mm²/s (edema)

name: Persistent slow rise
description: Kinetic curves (fibrosis)

name: Rapid washout
description: Kinetic curves (malignancy)

name: Skin thickening
description: >3mm

name: Late LVEF decline
description: Decrease in left ventricular ejection fraction occurring 5-15 years after radiation treatment.

name: Elevated SUVmax
description: SUVmax 2.5-4.0 (6-12 weeks post-RT)

name: Ground-glass opacities
description: Appears 6-12 weeks post-RT

name: Cortical continuity
description: Exophytic bony lesion with continuity of the cortex and medullary cavity with the underlying bone.

name: Decreased/absent uptake
description: Reduced or absent tracer accumulation in salivary glands.

name: No response to stimulation
description: No increase in tracer excretion after lemon juice stimulation.

name: Non-visualized glands
description: Salivary glands are not visible on scintigraphy.

name: High Signal Intensity in Bowel Wall
description: Edema

name: Mesenteric Stranding
description: Stranding and engorgement of the vasa recta

name: Spiculation/Thumbprinting
description: Due to edema

name: Target Sign
description: Mucosal hyperenhancement with submucosal edema (water halo)

name: Thickened Folds
description: Thickened folds (valvulae conniventes) > 2-3 mm

name: Wall Thickening
description: Circumferential, symmetric thickening (usually < 1 cm)

name: Adhesions
description: "Fixed" loops that do not change position with compression or patient movement

name: Angulation
description: Kinking of bowel loops due to mesenteric retraction

name: Featureless, Tube-like Bowel
description: Single contrast; atrophy of villi

name: Fistulas
description: Enterovesical, enterovaginal, or enteroenteric

name: Loop Separation
description: Thickening of the mesentery and serosal fibrosis causes bowel loops to appear separated or angulated

name: Low Signal Intensity
description: Fibrosis

name: Strictures
description: Smooth, tapered, concentric narrowing

name: Strictures
description: Long-segment narrowing with proximal dilation

name: Submucosal Fat Deposition (Fat Halo)
description: Classic sign of chronic inflammation/IBD, also seen in chronic radiation enteritis

name: Elevated ADC
description: ADC value >1.5 ×10⁻³ mm²/s.

name: Hyperintense periphery
description: "Swiss cheese" appearance with increased signal intensity on T2-weighted images.

name: Hypointense core
description: Central area of decreased signal intensity on T1-weighted images.

name: Ground-glass opacities
description: Diffuse or patchy areas of increased lung density with preserved bronchial and vascular markings.

name: Diving ranula
description: Extends into submandibular space.

name: Rapid gastric emptying
description: >30% emptied at 1 hour or >60% emptied at 2 hours on gastric emptying study.

name: Atrophy of the ipsilateral caudate head and putamen
description: Characteristic feature during the chronic/residual stage.

name: Decreased NAA
description: Marker of neuronal loss/dysfunction.

name: Elevated Choline
description: Marker of membrane turnover/gliosis.

name: Hemiatrophy and calvarial thickening
description: Dyke-Davidoff-Masson appearance secondary to cerebral atrophy in the late stage.

name: Hypermetabolism/hyperperfusion
description: During the ictal period.

name: Lactate present
description: Due to seizure activity/anaerobic metabolism.

name: Mild swelling (early), normal volume (onset)
description: Brain volume changes during the early/acute stage.

name: Progressive Hemiatrophy
description: Widening of ipsilateral sulci (Sylvian fissure) and ex-vacuo dilatation of the ipsilateral lateral ventricle during the chronic/residual stage.

name: Rare/Patchy leptomeningeal or perivascular enhancement
description: Indicates active blood-brain barrier breakdown during the early/acute stage.

name: Restricted diffusion
description: May be seen in areas of active seizure activity (cytotoxic edema) during the early/acute stage.

name: T2/FLAIR hyperintensity
description: Areas of hyperintensity in the peri-sylvian cortex, insula, and basal ganglia (specifically the caudate head) during the early/acute stage.

name: Widespread hypometabolism
description: Throughout the affected hemisphere during the interictal period.

name: Widespread hypoperfusion
description: Throughout the affected hemisphere during the interictal period.

name: Calcification
description: Rare (<5%). Absence of calcification is more characteristic.

name: Density/Signal Variability
description: Variable density on CT (usually hypodense, can be hyperdense). Variable T1/T2 signal on MRI depending on protein content.

name: Enhancement
description: No central enhancement. Rim enhancement often present (Claw Sign).

name: Intracystic Nodule
description: Small, non-enhancing waxy nodule floating within the cyst. T1 hyperintense/T2 hypointense relative to surrounding fluid. Seen in ~75% of cases.

name: Location
description: Sellar or sellar/suprasellar region. Rarely purely suprasellar.

name: No Internal Enhancement
description: Lack of internal enhancement.

name: No Restricted Diffusion
description: Absence of restricted diffusion (rules out epidermoid).

name: Sella Turcica Remodeling
description: Sella turcica may be remodeled/enlarged but usually no aggressive erosion.

name: Smooth Margins
description: Smooth, well-circumscribed margins.

name: T1 Hyperintensity
description: Present in ~50% of cases, due to high protein content.

name: T2 Hyperintensity
description: Present in ~70% of cases.

name: Diffuse, symmetric cortical thickening
description: Antigenic stimulation causes proliferation of follicles, leading to diffuse, symmetric cortical thickening.

name: Preserved hilum
description: The hilum remains visible and intact.

name: Radiolucent fatty hilum
description: Normal appearance of the hilum.

name: Reniform (kidney-bean) shape
description: Normal shape of lymph node.

name: Smooth margins
description: Normal appearance of the margins.

name: Thin cortex (< 3 mm)
description: Cortical thickness is less than 3mm.

name: Extramural vascular invasion (EMVI)
description: Serpentine tumor signal in vessels

name: Tumor
description: Intermediate signal on T2-weighted images (vs. hypointense muscularis propria)

name: Early arterial enhancement, washout kinetics (≥50% peak at 2 min)
description: Rapid enhancement followed by signal decrease

name: Enhancing mass (ΔHU >30 post-contrast)
description: Increased density after contrast administration

name: Hypervascularity
description: Increased vascularity on Doppler ultrasound (RI <0.5).

name: Hypoechoic mass, irregular margins, vascularity (RI >0.7)
description: Solid mass with abnormal blood flow

name: New calcifications
description: New calcifications on mammography (BI-RADS 4).

name: Spiculated mass
description: Spiculated mass on mammography (BI-RADS 4).

name: Spiculated mass ± calcifications
description: Irregular mass with radiating spicules

name: Recurrent Tumor
description: Increased FDG uptake in the breast, chest wall, or regional lymph nodes

name: Multiple episodes of acute pancreatitis on clinical exam
Intrahepatic stones
description: T1 hypointense, T2 signal void

name: Cluster of grapes sign
description: Appearance during corticomedullary phase.

name: Fluid attenuation
description: Abscess content with attenuation of 0-25 HU.

name: Gas shadows
description: Presence of gas within the abscess, more common in diabetics.

name: Hyperintense
description: High signal intensity on T2-weighted images (95% of cases).

name: Hypodense lesion
description: On non-contrast CT

name: Hypodense mass
description: Mass with attenuation of 10-30 HU.

name: Hypoechoic mass
description: Mass with decreased echogenicity (85% of cases).

name: Hypointense core
description: Low signal intensity on T1-weighted images.

name: Perinephric stranding
description: Stranding of the perinephric fat, seen in 70% of cases.

name: Peripheral flow
description: Peripheral blood flow with RI 0.5-0.7.

name: Posterior acoustic enhancement
description: Increased echogenicity posterior to the mass.

name: Restricted diffusion
description: Restricted diffusion with ADC <1.1×10⁻³ mm²/s.

name: Rim enhancement
description: Enhancement of the abscess wall (>15 HU).

name: Rim enhancement
description: 10-30 HU increase on corticomedullary phase

name: Rim enhancement
description: Rim enhancement with thickness of 3-5mm.

name: Single Umbilical Artery
description: 2-vessel cord (single umbilical artery) is a soft marker for renal anomalies.

name: Cortical delay
description: Cortical delay >10s on contrast-enhanced CT

name: Delayed tracer uptake
description: May manifest as asymmetry in tracer uptake during the vascular phase.

name: Elevated Peak Systolic Velocity (PSV)
description: PSV >180 cm/s in renal artery

name: PSV >200 cm/s
description: Peak Systolic Velocity greater than 200 cm/s on MR angiography.

name: Renal artery PSV increase
description: Renal artery peak systolic velocity >180 cm/s, indicating >60% stenosis

name: Renal artery RI >0.8
description: Resistive Index greater than 0.8 predicts poor renal outcome.

name: "String-of-beads" appearance
description: Multiple areas of stenosis and dilatation along the renal artery, characteristic of fibromuscular dysplasia (FMD). Best visualized with 3D TOF MRA.

name: "Tardus-parvus" waveform
description: Delayed systolic upstroke and decreased amplitude of the waveform distal to the stenosis.

name: Calcified plaques
description: Plaques with density >130 HU, indicating calcification. Suggests atherosclerotic RAS.

name: Elevated Peak Systolic Velocity (PSV)
description: PSV >150 cm/s suggests >60% stenosis. Measured with PC-MRA.

name: Elevated Peak Systolic Velocity (PSV)
description: PSV >180-200 cm/s (sensitivity 85-90%) suggests significant stenosis.

name: Elevated Renal-Aortic Ratio (RAR)
description: RAR >3.5 suggests significant stenosis.

name: Focal aliasing
description: Color Doppler

name: Luminal narrowing
description: Luminal narrowing >5 mm² suggests stenosis >70%.

name: Post-stenotic dilatation
description: Widening of the renal artery distal to the stenosis.

name: Pressure gradient
description: Pressure gradient >20 mmHg indicates hemodynamic significance.

name: Stenosis
description: Stenosis >50% diameter or 75% area reduction.

name: Tardus Parvus
description: Slow acceleration and rounded peak in the renal artery waveform.

name: Turbulent flow at stenosis
description: Increased and disorganized blood flow at the site of stenosis.

name: Loss of signal on opposed-phase (clear cell)
Enhancement
description: Enhancement after contrast administration

name: "Pseudocapsule" sign
description: Hypoechoic rim (specificity 92%)

name: Ablation zone involves perinephric fat ("halo")
description: Appearance of the ablation zone on follow-up imaging.

name: Arterial phase enhancement
description: Clear cell RCC: Hyperenhancement (>100 HU); Papillary RCC: Mild enhancement (20-50 HU)

name: Arterial phase washout
description: Washout in the arterial phase on contrast-enhanced CT

name: Delayed phase enhancement
description: Clear cell RCC: "Pseudo-capsule" enhancement; Papillary RCC: Homogeneous enhancement

name: Enhancement
description: Any measurable enhancement after contrast implies a solid component/malignancy.

name: Enhancing soft tissue nodule
description: Solid mass with contrast enhancement in the kidney.

name: FDG avidity
description: SUVmax >2.5 in 60% of clear cell RCC

name: Hypoechoic mass
description: 85% of cases

name: Ice Ball
description: Well-defined, hypodense oval or sphere centered on the probe. Density of the ice ball is -20 to -100 HU.

name: Perinephric fat stranding post-ablation
description: Common finding that may persist for months after ablation.

name: Pre-contrast density
description: Clear cell RCC: 20-40 HU (iso-/hypodense); Papillary RCC: 30-50 HU

name: Restricted diffusion
description: ADC <1.1 ×10⁻³ mm²/s

name: Solid, enhancing renal masses
description: Solid, enhancing renal masses. Complex cysts (Bosniak III/IV) must be viewed with suspicion.

name: T1 signal intensity
description: Iso- to hypointense

name: T2 signal
description: T2 hyperintense (vs. papillary RCC hypointense) on T2-weighted MRI

name: T2 signal intensity
description: Hyperintense (clear cell) vs hypointense (papillary)

name: Tumor thrombus
description: Extension into renal vein

name: Tumor thrombus enhancement
description: Enhances on post-contrast sequences (vs bland thrombus)

name: Venous phase washout
description: Clear cell RCC: Rapid washout (<100 HU); Papillary RCC: Persistent enhancement

name: Edge shadowing
description: Refraction at curved surfaces (radius <5 mm) at cyst margins. Disappears at >20° beam angle.

name: Simple Cyst
description: <20 HU (used in Bosniak classification)

name: Multiple, bilateral cysts
description: Multiple, bilateral renal cysts. Can be simple or complex.

name: Rim calcification
description: Calcification along the periphery of the cyst

name: Calcifications
description: Curvilinear (benign), Central/coarse (malignant)

name: Enhancement
description: None (benign), Nodular (HU ↑ >15, malignant)

name: HU values
description: 0-20 HU (simple), 20-50 HU (protein/blood)

name: Septations
description: Thin (<1 mm, benign), Thick (>2 mm, malignant)

name: Wall thickness
description: <3 mm (benign), >3 mm (malignant)

name: Absent Kidneys
description: Decreased or absent kidney visualization due to renal dysfunction.

name: Wedge-shaped Non-enhancing Defect
description: Wedge-shaped, non-enhancing defect extending to the capsule

name: Contusion
description: Without laceration (Grade I injury)

name: Laceration
description: >1 cm into cortex (Grade III injury)

name: Renal rim sign
description: Preserved 1-2 mm cortical enhancement after vascular injury

name: Shattered kidney
description: (Grade V injury)

name: Diffuse parenchymal infiltration
description: Diffuse involvement of the kidney parenchyma

name: Floating artery
description: Encased renal artery without occlusion

name: Hydronephrosis
description: Pelvicalyceal compression leading to hydronephrosis (20% of advanced cases)

name: Hypodense
description: Unenhanced CT shows hypodense renal masses (30-50 HU)

name: Hypoechoic masses
description: B-mode ultrasound shows hypoechoic masses (85%)

name: Hypointense
description: T2-weighted images show hypointense masses (compared to hyperintense RCC)

name: Iso-/hypointense to cortex
description: T1-weighted images show masses that are isointense or hypointense compared to the renal cortex

name: Low PSV
description: Doppler ultrasound shows PSV <50 cm/s (vs. RCC >70 cm/s)

name: Low resistance flow
description: Doppler ultrasound shows low resistance flow (RI <0.6)

name: Mild enhancement
description: Nephrographic phase shows mild enhancement (+20-40 HU)

name: Multiple discrete nodules
description: Multiple hypodense (CT), hypoechoic (US) masses within the kidney

name: Poor corticomedullary differentiation
description: Loss of clear distinction between cortex and medulla

name: Progressive mild enhancement
description: Post-gadolinium images show progressive mild enhancement

name: Restricted diffusion
description: Diffusion-weighted imaging shows restricted diffusion (ADC <1.0 x10⁻³ mm²/s)

name: Soft tissue cloak
description: Perirenal soft tissue thickening surrounding the kidney (30% of cases)

name: Solitary mass
description: A single hypodense (CT), hypoechoic (US) mass within the kidney

name: Avid enhancement with washout
description: T1 C+ (Gadolinium) MRI.

name: Central scar
description: Present in 33% (>4cm tumors)

name: Central Stellate Scar
description: Central, non-enhancing, low-attenuation area on CT.

name: CEUS enhancement
description: Homogeneous enhancement without washout

name: Corticomedullary phase enhancement
description: Homogeneous enhancement (100-120 HU)

name: Delayed enhancement of scar
description: T1 C+ (Gadolinium) MRI of the central scar.

name: DWI ADC value
description: ADC >1.2 ×10⁻³ mm²/s (vs RCC <1.1)

name: Echogenicity
description: Hypoechoic (78%)

name: Hot
description: Avid uptake of Tc-99m Sestamibi (high uptake relative to RCC).

name: Hyperintense scar
description: T2-weighted MRI of the central scar.

name: Intense, homogeneous enhancement
description: Hypervascular on arterial phase CT.

name: Intratumoral Fat
description: Extremely rare, but can be present on CT.

description: Ipsilateral calvarial thickening, hyperpneumatization of the frontal sinus/mastoid air cells, and elevation of the petrous ridge (compensatory changes due to brain atrophy).

name: Enlarged Choroid Plexus
description: Ipsilateral enlargement on T1 + Contrast (Gadolinium) is a highly specific and early sign.

name: Gliosis
description: In older children/adults, affected white matter appears hyperintense on T2/FLAIR.

name: Hemiatrophy
description: Ipsilateral volume loss of the brain parenchyma.

name: Hypometabolism and Hypoperfusion
description: In the affected cortex on PET/SPECT.

name: Leptomeningeal Enhancement
description: Serpentine, gyriform enhancement filling the sulci (the "pial angioma") on T1 + Contrast (Gadolinium).

name: Prominent Deep Collaterals
description: Enlarged medullary and subependymal veins attempting to bypass the obstruction on Venous Angiography (MRV).

name: Signal Drop-out
description: Calcified areas appear hypointense on T2/FLAIR.

name: Tram-Track Calcifications
description: Gyriform, curvilinear calcifications following cortical convolutions, most common in occipital and parietal lobes, usually unilateral. Develops after age 2.

name: T1 hyperintense
description: Due to methemoglobin

name: Signal changes
description: Signal changes on T1 IR sequence, depending on the age of the hemorrhage.

name: Non-visualization or extremely faint uptake
description: Significantly decreased or absent radiotracer uptake in the thyroid gland on scintigraphy.

name: Aneurysm
description: CTA can detect aneurysms ≥2mm with 95% sensitivity.

name: Aneurysm
description: DSA can detect aneurysms ≥1mm and allows for dynamic flow evaluation.

name: Aneurysm
description: MRA can detect aneurysms >3mm with 90% sensitivity.

name: Butterfly sign
description: Hyperdensity in the interpeduncular cistern, resembling a butterfly.

name: Hyperdense blood in cisterns
description: Acute SAH appears as hyperdense blood (50-90 HU) in the subarachnoid cisterns. Sensitivity >95% within 6 hours, decreasing to 50% at 1 week.

name: Hyperdensity in subarachnoid space
description: Acute blood appears hyperdense on non-contrast CT within the subarachnoid space.

name: Hyperintense CSF signal
description: Hyperintense signal in the CSF on FLAIR sequences, sensitive within 48 hours.

name: Microbleeds
description: Blooming artifacts on SWI/GRE sequences indicating microbleeds.

name: Sylvian fissure hyperdensity
description: Hyperdensity within the Sylvian fissure, highly predictive (90%) of MCA aneurysm.

name: "Double cortex" sign
description: A band of gray matter located beneath the normal cortex, creating a "double cortex" appearance.

name: Buckling sign
description: Subacute SDH (4 days-3 weeks)

name: Decreased ADC
description: Acute SDH (1-3 days) on DWI due to clot retraction

name: Homogeneous crescent
description: Hyperacute SDH (<12 hrs), density 35-45 HU

name: Hyperdense crescent
description: Acute SDH (1-3 days), density 70-90 HU

name: Hyperintense
description: Acute SDH (1-3 days) on FLAIR imaging

name: Hyperintense
description: Chronic SDH (>3 weeks) on FLAIR imaging

name: Hyperintense
description: Subacute SDH (4-14 days) on T1-weighted, T2-weighted, and FLAIR imaging

name: Hyperintense center
description: Chronic SDH (>3 weeks) on T2-weighted imaging

name: Hypodense collection
description: Chronic SDH (>3 weeks), density 20-40 HU

name: Hypointense
description: Acute SDH (1-3 days) on T2-weighted imaging

name: Hypointense rim
description: Chronic SDH (>3 weeks) on T1-weighted imaging

name: Increased ADC
description: Chronic SDH (>3 weeks) on DWI due to fluid

name: Increased ADC
description: Subacute SDH (4-14 days) on DWI due to lysis

name: Isodense to cortex
description: Subacute SDH (4 days-3 weeks), density 30-50 HU

name: Isointense
description: Acute SDH (1-3 days) on T1-weighted imaging

name: Midline shift >5mm
description: Acute SDH (1-3 days), associated with high mortality if untreated

name: Septations
description: Chronic SDH (>3 weeks), seen in 30% of cases

name: Swirl sign
description: Hyperacute SDH (<12 hrs), seen in 20% of cases

name: Midline Shift
description: Displacement of the septum pellucidum away from the lesion.

name: Ventricle Entrapment

name: Filling defect

name: Bone defect

name: Abnormal Anterior Humeral Line

name: Downhill Varices

name: Extradural pressure defect

name: Facet hypertrophy

name: Hyperdense

description: Isointense cortex with fused mid-hemispheric regions on MRI.
