description: Large with posterior shadowing.

name: Mixed cystic and solid
description: Contains both cystic and solid components.

name: None or Large Comet-tail artifacts
description: Associated with colloid.

name: Peripheral (Rim) calcifications
description: Calcification around the margin.

name: Punctate Echogenic Foci (PEF)
description: Microcalcifications. Small, bright dots with no shadowing. Highest positive predictive value for Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma.

name: Smooth/Ill-defined margins
description: Margins are smooth or difficult to define.

name: Solid
description: Entirely or nearly entirely soft tissue.

name: Spongiform
description: >50% composed of small cystic spaces; looks like a sponge or honeycomb. Highly specific for benignity.

name: Taller-than-wide
description: AP diameter > Transverse diameter. Indicates growth against tissue planes and is a specific sign of malignancy.

name: Very Hypoechoic
description: Darker than the adjacent strap muscles (sternocleidomastoid/sternohyoid). Specific indicator for malignancy.

name: Wider-than-tall
description: AP diameter < Transverse diameter

name: Hypoechoic nodule with microcalcifications
description: 95% of cases

name: Lymph node involvement
description: 40% at diagnosis

name: Punctate calcifications
description: Small, dot-like calcifications

name: Punctuate calcifications
description: 60% of cases

name: Increased or decreased radiotracer uptake
description: Areas of increased or decreased radiotracer uptake indicate hyperfunctioning or hypofunctioning thyroid tissue, respectively. Using 123I or 99mTc-pertechnetate.

name: Decreased attenuation
description: 70-90 HU vs normal 100-130 HU

name: Decreased uptake
description: Significantly reduced I-123 uptake, typically <2% at 24 hours.

name: Decreased vascularity
description: Reduced blood flow within the thyroid gland on Doppler ultrasound.

name: Gland edema
description: Swelling of the thyroid gland with attenuation of 20-40 HU.

name: Heterogeneous thyroid
description: Variable echogenicity throughout the thyroid gland.

name: T2 hyperintense
description: Increased signal intensity on T2-weighted MRI due to edema.

name: Decreased uptake
description: Significantly decreased or absent uptake in the thyroid gland (<5% at 24h with 123I).

name: Starved thyroid
description: Very low or absent uptake.

name: Shunt Tract
description: T1-weighted: isointense to liver

name: Shunt Tract
description: T2-weighted: hyperintense due to fluid

name: Shunt Tract
description: Low-attenuation linear structure (HU: -50 to -100)

name: Stent
description: Hyperattenuating (HU: 100-200)

name: Stent Enhancement
description: Contrast-enhanced: enhances similarly to the portal vein

name: Decreased Intra-shunt Velocity
description: Intra-shunt velocity outside the normal range of 90-190 cm/s suggests stenosis or shunt dysfunction.

name: Hepatofugal flow in MPV
description: Reversal of flow in the main portal vein (away from the liver) can indicate shunt dysfunction.

name: Elevated Tissue Temperature
description: Temperature rise >1°C is considered potentially harmful. FDA limit for head SAR is 4 W/kg, leading to ~0.8°C temperature rise. Whole-body SAR limit is 3 W/kg, leading to ~0.5°C rise.

name: Spiral tibial fracture
description: Spiral tibial fracture with <2mm displacement

name: Streaking artifact
description: Dental amalgam streaking obscuring the tumor.

name: Echogenic Bowel
description: Increased echogenicity of the fetal bowel on ultrasound.

name: Intracranial Calcifications
description: Abnormal calcium deposits within the brain parenchyma.

name: Intrauterine Growth Restriction (IUGR)
description: Fetus is smaller than expected for gestational age.

name: Lenticulostriate Vasculopathy (LSV)
description: Increased echogenicity of the lenticulostriate arteries.

name: Lissencephaly/Polymicrogyria
description: Abnormal cortical development.

name: Microcephaly
description: Small head circumference for gestational age.

name: Periventricular Calcifications
description: Calcifications located around the ventricles.

name: Ventriculomegaly
description: Enlargement of the cerebral ventricles.

name: White Matter T2 Hyperintensity
description: Increased signal intensity on T2-weighted images in the white matter, indicating delayed myelination or gliosis.

name: Snowman sign
description: Figure-8 appearance from dilated vertical vein and SVC above heart

name: Hot nodule
description: Focal area of increased I-123 uptake with suppressed background thyroid tissue.

name: Hot nodule
description: A single nodule with significantly increased uptake compared to the surrounding thyroid tissue (>3:1 nodule:background ratio).

name: Nodule with possible necrosis
description: A nodule within the thyroid gland, potentially showing signs of necrosis.

name: Single 'hot' nodule
description: A single area of increased radiotracer uptake within the thyroid gland on scintigraphy.

name: Solitary nodule
description: A single nodule, typically >2.5 cm, within the thyroid gland.

name: Suppression of the remaining gland
description: Decreased radiotracer uptake in the thyroid tissue surrounding the 'hot' nodule on scintigraphy.

name: T2 hyperintense nodule
description: Increased signal intensity on T2-weighted MRI.

name: Heterogeneous uptake
description: Variable radiotracer uptake throughout the thyroid gland on scintigraphy.

name: Multiple focal 'hot' and 'cold' areas
description: Multiple areas of increased ('hot') and decreased ('cold') radiotracer uptake within the thyroid gland on scintigraphy.

name: Nodular uptake
description: Heterogeneous uptake with multiple nodules demonstrating increased activity.

name: Increased uptake
description: I-123 uptake > 10% at 4-24 hours

name: Diffuse/Basal ganglia calcifications
description: Calcifications in the basal ganglia (often with hydrocephalus/macrocephaly, but microcephaly can occur).

name: Diffuse/Basal Ganglia Calcifications
description: Scattered calcifications throughout the parenchyma, with a predilection for the basal ganglia and corticomedullary junction.

name: Diffuse/Basal Ganglia Calcifications
description: Scattered throughout the parenchyma (cortex, basal ganglia, thalamus). Toxo = Total Brain

name: Eccentric Target Sign
description: Nodular enhancement along the cyst wall (60% specificity).

name: Hemorrhage
description: SWI MRI shows hemorrhage in 15-20% (distinguishes from lymphoma).

name: Hydrocephalus
description: More common in Toxo than CMV due to aqueductal stenosis from ependymitis

name: Hydrocephalus
description: Enlargement of the cerebral ventricles, often due to aqueductal stenosis.

name: Hyperintense lesion with surrounding edema
description: T2/FLAIR MRI shows a hyperintense lesion with surrounding edema (60-80% cases).

name: Hypointense core
description: T1-weighted MRI shows a hypointense core (30% with hyperintense rim if hemorrhage).

name: Increased Lipid/Lactate peak
description: MR Spectroscopy shows increased Lipid/lactate peak (90% specificity vs. lymphoma's increased choline).

name: Iso-/hypodense lesions
description: Non-contrast CT shows lesions that are iso- or hypodense (15-25 HU).

name: rCBV < 1.2
description: Perfusion MRI shows rCBV < 1.2 (vs. lymphoma > 1.8).

name: Ring-enhancement
description: Post-Gadolinium MRI shows ring-enhancement (wall thickness 2-3mm, incomplete in 40%).

name: Ring-enhancing lesions
description: Post-contrast CT shows ring-enhancing lesions, often multiple (70%) and 20-30mm in size.

name: Variable ADC
description: DWI MRI shows variable ADC: Central decreased ADC (necrosis) vs. peripheral increased ADC (vasogenic edema).

name: Faint T2/FLAIR hyperintensity
description: Faint hyperintensity may develop on T2/FLAIR images after 24-48 hours, but is often subtle.

name: Negative DWI
description: DWI can be negative in the hyperacute phase (<24 hours).

name: Normal CT Head
description: Non-contrast CT head is typically normal, used to exclude hemorrhage or large masses.

name: Normal T1/Contrast MRI
description: T1-weighted images and contrast-enhanced images are typically normal.

name: Punctate DWI restriction in lateral hippocampus (CA1 sector)
description: Small (1-3mm) foci of restricted diffusion (hyperintense on DWI, hypointense on ADC) in the lateral aspect of the hippocampus, corresponding to the CA1 sector. Can be unilateral (usually left) or bilateral. Peak sensitivity 24-72 hours after onset.

name: Absent Air Bronchograms
description: Differentiates from Respiratory Distress Syndrome (RDS)

name: Fluid in fissures
description: Fissure width >2 mm

name: Hyperinflated lungs
description: Lung volume ≥9 posterior ribs

name: Lung Pulse Score ≤2
description: Lower score compared to RDS

name: Pleural Line Abnormalities <10%
description: Less common compared to pneumonia

name: Prominent perihilar vascular markings
description: Perihilar "sunburst" streaks

name: Rare Pleural Effusion
description: ≤5% cases, Costophrenic angle blunting

name: Coarse interstitial markings
description: Radiating from the hilum (Sunburst pattern)
pathology_name: Transient Tachypnea of the Newborn (TTN) / Wet Lung

name: Fluid in the fissures
description: Minor fissure is most visible
pathology_name: Transient Tachypnea of the Newborn (TTN) / Wet Lung

name: Mild cardiomegaly
description: May be present (fluid overload)
pathology_name: Transient Tachypnea of the Newborn (TTN) / Wet Lung

name: Normal to increased lung volumes
description: Hyperinflation due to air trapping
pathology_name: Transient Tachypnea of the Newborn (TTN) / Wet Lung

name: Small laminar pleural effusions
description: Small laminar pleural effusions
pathology_name: Transient Tachypnea of the Newborn (TTN) / Wet Lung

name: ADC <1.1×10⁻³ mm²/s
description: Restricted diffusion on DWI, with an ADC value less than 1.1×10⁻³ mm²/s, suggestive of muscle invasion.

name: Early enhancement
description: Early enhancement on dynamic contrast-enhanced MRI (compared to delayed enhancement in inflammation).

name: Enhancement >15 HU from pre-contrast
description: The filling defect enhances more than 15 Hounsfield units compared to the pre-contrast scan.

name: Hypoechoic mass
description: Hypoechoic mass seen on ultrasound.

name: Intermediate signal intensity
description: Intermediate signal intensity on T2-weighted MRI images (compared to hypointense fibrosis).

name: Irregular bladder wall thickening
description: Irregular thickening of the bladder wall on ultrasound.

name: Luminal filling defect
description: Filling defect within the urinary tract lumen.

name: RI <0.7
description: Resistive index less than 0.7 on Doppler ultrasound.

name: Stipple sign
description: Contrast material trapped within the interstices of the tumor.

name: Wall thickening >3mm
description: Thickening of the bladder or ureteral wall greater than 3mm.

name: Displacement
description: >3.5mm displacement between vertebral bodies

name: Crossing Vessels
description: Mesenteric vessels crossing the defect appear engorged and stretched.

name: Mesenteric trunk displacement
description: The main mesenteric trunk is displaced to the right.

name: No hernia sac
description: Loops are directly against the abdominal wall.

name: Aorta anterior/pulmonary posterior
description: Abnormal relationship of great vessels

name: Egg-on-string
description: Narrow mediastinum + increased cardiothoracic ratio (CTR)

name: Increased Atlanto-dental Interval (ADI)
description: ADI >3mm in adults, >5mm in children

name: Cord swelling
description: AP diameter >7 mm at thoracic level.

name: Patchy/punctate contrast enhancement
description: In 50% of cases, acute phase.

name: Restricted diffusion
description: In <10% of cases (vs. 100% in cord infarction).

name: T1 iso-/hypointense lesion
description: T1 hypointensity correlates with poor prognosis.

name: T2 hyperintense lesion
description: Spanning ≥1 vertebral segment. ≥3 segments suggests NMOSD (longitudinally extensive TM [LETM]). Central cord involvement in 70%.

name: Active Extravasation
description: HU > 200 indicates active bleeding.

name: Necrosis
description: Non-enhancing areas (0-30 HU)

name: Pseudoaneurysm
description: RI <0.7, PSV >200 cm/s

name: Pseudoaneurysm
description: RI <0.7, PSV >200 cm/s

name: No contrast washout on CT in 95% cases
No contrast washout on CT in 95% cases
No contrast washout on CT in 95% of cases
Round adrenal mass >2cm on CT in 90% cases
Round adrenal mass >2cm on CT in 90% cases
Round adrenal mass >2cm on CT in 90% of cases
Round adrenal mass >2cm on CT in 90% of cases
Round adrenal mass >2cm on CT in 90% of cases
Diffuse Axonal Injury (DAI)
description: Improved detection with structured reports

name: Acute fracture
description: T2 hypointensity

name: Acute fracture
description: T1 hyperintensity (<2 weeks)

name: Cement-filled areas
description: Signal voids on T2-weighted imaging

name: Cement distribution
description: PMMA appears as hyperdense (100–200 HU)

name: Cement leakage
description: Into paravertebral soft tissues or spinal canal

name: Cortical disruption
description: N/A

name: Fracture lines
description: Linear lucency

name: Loss of vertebral height
description: >50% in OVCFs

name: "Flat tire" sign
description: Collapsed posterior globe

name: Intraocular air
description: 0 HU

name: "To-and-fro" spectral waveform
description: Pulsatile flow within the pseudoaneurysm neck

name: Peripheral enhancement
description: "Target sign" on axial imaging

name: RI <0.5, PSV >200 cm/s
description: Resistive index and peak systolic velocity measurements

name: Contrast leakage into DRUJ
description: Contrast leakage into the distal radioulnar joint (DRUJ) with a gap >1mm.

name: Degenerative tear
description: Diffuse increased signal on T1 and mucoid degeneration (very high signal) on T2/PD FS sequences.

name: Full-thickness tear
description: Discontinuity of the TFCC with fluid signal traversing the tear on T2/PD FS sequences.

name: Hyperechoic structure between ulna/triquetrum
description: TFCC appears as a hyperechoic structure between the ulna and triquetrum.

name: Normal TFC
description: Homogeneous low signal on T1 and T2/PD FS sequences.

name: Partial tear
description: Focal increased signal on T1 and increased signal (but less than fluid) on T2/PD FS sequences.

name: RV hypoplastic
description: Right ventricle is underdeveloped

name: Pulsatile Portal Vein Flow
description: Pulsatile waveform in the portal vein.

name: Pineal Gland/Suprasellar mass
description: Mass in the pineal gland or suprasellar region in the setting of retinoblastoma.

name: Restricted diffusion
description: ADC <1.1×10⁻³ mm²/s, seen in TB/malignancy.

name: Restricted diffusion
description: ADC <1.1×10⁻³ mm²/s

name: Angiomyolipomas
description: Fat density (-10 to -30 HU) + enhancing vessels

name: Cortical tubers
description: Hypodense (15-25 HU)

name: Cortical tubers
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintense, mushroom-shaped gyri

name: Cortical/Subcortical Tubers
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintense. In neonates, may be T1 hyperintense due to lack of myelination.

name: Cortical/Subcortical Tubers
description: Often calcify with age.

name: Lymphangioleiomyomatosis (LAM)
description: Cysts: 2-20 mm, diffuse distribution

name: Multiple bilateral AMLs
description: Multiple AMLs in both kidneys

name: Multiple bilateral AMLs
description: Suggestive of TSC-associated AML

name: Renal Cysts
description: >3 cysts (≥2 cm) suggests *TSC2-PKD1* contiguous gene syndrome

name: Rhabdomyomas
description: Homogeneous masses (70% multiple)

name: Rhabdomyomas
description: Echogenic, homogeneous masses (70% multiple)

name: Subependymal Giant Cell Astrocytoma (SEGA)
description: A SEN that grows and enhances, typically > 1.0 cm or showing serial growth. Intense enhancement. Location: Foramen of Monro. Can cause obstructive hydrocephalus.

name: Subependymal Giant Cell Astrocytoma (SEGA)
description: Enhancing mass >1 cm near foramen of Monro

name: Subependymal nodules
description: 40-200 HU (calcification)

name: Subependymal nodules
description: T1 iso/hyperintense, T2 hypointense (calcified)

name: Subependymal Nodules (SENs)
description: "Candle guttering" appearance along the lateral ventricles. Highly common calcification (>80%).

name: White Matter Radial Migration Lines
description: Linear bands of T2/FLAIR hyperintensity extending from the ventricle to the cortex (heterotopic glia).

name: Multiple bilateral tumors
description: Presence of multiple bilateral renal AMLs

name: Multiple bilateral tumors on CT/MRI
description: Presence of multiple bilateral AMLs

name: Gas within collection
description: 10-15% of cases

name: Restricted diffusion
description: ADC <1.1 ×10⁻³ mm²/s

name: Rim-enhancing collection
description: Wall >3mm

name: Rim enhancement
description: Post-contrast

name: Decreased NAA
description: MR Spectroscopy finding.

name: Elevated Choline
description: MR Spectroscopy finding.

name: Elevated Glutamate/Glutamine
description: MR Spectroscopy finding.

name: Elevated Lactate
description: MR Spectroscopy finding.

name: Hypodense white matter lesion
description: Non-contrast CT finding.

name: Large, hyperintense white matter lesion
description: T2/FLAIR MRI finding.

name: Low or Normal rCBV
description: Perfusion (PWI) finding. Critical discriminator from GBM.

name: Mild mass effect
description: Mass effect present, but often mild relative to the large size of the lesion.

name: Open-Ring Enhancement
description: Incomplete ring of enhancement on T1 post-gadolinium. The "open" part of the ring faces the gray matter (cortex or basal ganglia).

name: Perilesional edema
description: Present but typically less extensive than seen in GBM of similar size (T2/FLAIR).

name: Restricted Diffusion
description: Often seen at the leading edge of the lesion (the enhancing rim) on DWI/ADC.

name: Variable enhancement
description: Contrast-enhanced CT finding.

name: Abnormal signal on DWI
description: May show restricted diffusion on DWI in the liver, with ADC thresholds 1.1-1.3×10⁻³ mm²/s for malignancy.

name: Adrenal mass >3cm on CT in 80% cases
Adrenal mass >3cm on CT in 80% of cases
Heterogeneous enhancement on CT in 90% cases
Heterogeneous enhancement on CT in 90% cases
Heterogeneous enhancement on CT in 90% of cases
Heterogeneous enhancement on CT in 90% of cases
Heterogeneous enhancement on CT in 90% of cases
ADC <1.0×10⁻³ mm²/s
description: Restricted diffusion on DWI

name: Angulated/Spiculated margins
description: Angulated or spiculated margins on ultrasound

name: Hypoechoic solid
description: Hypoechoic solid mass on ultrasound

name: Internal vascularity
description: Internal vascularity on Doppler ultrasound

name: Irregular shape
description: Irregular shape on ultrasound

name: Washout
description: Washout kinetic curve on MRI

name: Cloud-like calcification
description: Cloud-like appearance.

name: Enhancing lesions
description: Hyperintense signal on T1-weighted images after GBCA administration.

name: Variable DWI signal
description: DWI signal depends on cellularity. High cellularity = restricted diffusion (hyperintense DWI, hypointense ADC).

name: Increased FDG uptake
description: Areas of increased metabolic activity show higher FDG uptake. Blood glucose >200 mg/dL can decrease FDG uptake in tumors.

name: Glioblastoma
description: CNS tumor.

name: Medulloblastoma
description: CNS tumor.

name: Cecal Involvement
description: Affects the cecum and ascending colon (Right Lower Quadrant).

name: Circumferential Thickening
description: Circumferential thickening of the cecum.

name: Pericolonic Stranding
description: Inflammatory stranding in the RLQ.

name: Pneumatosis Intestinalis
description: Gas in the bowel wall, indicating necrosis.

name: Skin ulceration on physical examination
description: A complication of infantile hemangiomas

name: Skin ulceration on physical examination
description: More common in infantile hemangiomas

name: Backwash ileitis
description: Terminal ileum dilation >15mm

name: Bowel Wall Thickness
description: >4mm (colon only)

name: Continuous T2 hyperintensity
description: From rectum

name: Early mucosal enhancement
description: Contrast-Enhanced US, <12 sec

name: Fat Stranding
description: Minimal (confined to mucosa)

name: Mural Enhancement
description: Homogeneous enhancement

name: Non-stratified Bowel Wall
description: >4mm, continuous vascularity

name: Toxic megacolon
description: >6cm diameter

name: Calcifications
description: Calcifications on ultrasound suggest chronic injury.

name: Complete disruption with dynamic valgus stress
description: Complete disruption with dynamic valgus stress (≥3mm gap) on ultrasound.

name: Fiber discontinuity
description: T2/PD FS sequences show discontinuity of the UCL fibers, indicating a complete tear.

name: Fluid gap
description: T2/PD FS sequences show a fluid gap >3mm, indicating a complete tear.

name: Hypoechoic cleft
description: Hypoechoic cleft ≥2mm on ultrasound, indicating a partial tear.

name: Intrasubstance hyperintensity
description: T2/PD FS sequences show intrasubstance hyperintensity in the UCL, indicating a partial tear.

name: Medial joint space widening
description: Valgus stress radiography shows medial joint space widening. Normal: <2mm, Partial tear: 2-3mm, Complete tear: >3mm.

name: Periligamentous edema
description: T2/PD FS sequences show edema around the UCL, indicating a partial tear.

name: Lunate chondromalacia
description: TFC wear + lunate chondromalacia (Palmer 2B)

name: TFC wear
description: TFC wear (Palmer 2A)

name: TFCC perforation + lunate/ulnar chondral loss
description: TFCC perforation + lunate/ulnar chondral loss (Palmer 2C)

name: Positive Ulnar Variance
description: Ulna projects distal to radius.

name: Hyperechoic pericolonic fat
description: 'Dirty shadowing'

name: Non-compressible hypoechoic bowel wall
description: >4mm

name: Displacement of the midbrain
description: Displacement of the midbrain toward the contralateral side.

name: Effacement of the ipsilateral suprasellar cistern
description: Earliest sign of uncal herniation.

name: Widening of the ipsilateral prepontine cistern
description: Widening of the ipsilateral prepontine cistern.

name: Hydronephrosis
description: Dilatation of the renal pelvis >10 mm (AP diameter) on CT. May be seen on US.

name: Contrast Extravasation
description: Active bleeding seen as contrast extravasation >90-100 HU on CT Angiography.

name: Early Positivity
description: Early positivity (<2 min) on Tagged RBC Scan (accuracy 78%).

name: Pseudovein sign
description: Tubular contrast pooling along bowel wall

name: Sentinel clot sign
description: Hyperdense clot (60-80 HU) near bleeding source

name: Sentinel Clot Sign
description: Hyperdense clot (60-80 HU) near bleeding source on CT Angiography.

name: Hydronephrosis
description: Dilatation of the renal pelvis >10 mm (AP diameter) on CT. May be seen on US.

name: Ureteral Wall Thickening/Mass
description: Focal or diffuse thickening of the ureteral wall, potentially with a visible mass.

name: Cobra head sign
description: Dilated intravesical ureter with thin wall resembling cobra head

name: Abrupt ureteral narrowing
description: Excretory phase MR Urography showing abrupt ureteral narrowing

name: Delayed nephrogram
description: Delayed nephrogram (>3 min post-contrast)

name: Drooping lily sign
description: Displaced calyces

name: Hydronephrosis
description: SFU Grade III-IV hydronephrosis with normal ureter. AP pelvic diameter thresholds: Prenatal: >7mm (2nd trimester), >9mm (3rd trimester); Neonatal: >10mm at 48h post-birth

name: Hyperintense dilated pelvis
description: T2-weighted MRI showing hyperintense dilated pelvis (fluid signal)

name: Parenchymal thinning
description: Parenchymal thickness <5mm indicates severe damage.

name: T1/2 >20 min
description: Diuretic Renography (Tc-99m MAG3) showing T1/2 >20 min indicates obstruction.

name: Transition zone HU values
description: Acute: 70-90 HU (edema); Chronic: 30-50 HU (fibrosis)

name: Abrupt cutoff
description: Sudden termination of contrast flow.

name: Tapering
description: Gradual narrowing of the urinary tract.

name: Hydronephrosis
description: Dilatation of the renal pelvis >10 mm (AP diameter) on CT. May be seen on US.

name: Hyperdense Focus
description: Calcium stones are usually > 400-600 HU. Uric acid stones are lower (200-400 HU).

name: Stone Density
description: Calcium Oxalate: 400–600+ HU; Uric Acid: 100–200 HU; Cystine: 200–400 HU

name: Field effect
description: Multifocal tumors due to widespread genomic instability

name: Muscle-invasive tumor
description: Invades detrusor muscle (T2), perivesical fat (T3), or adjacent organs (T4)

name: Nuclear pleomorphism, frequent mitoses
description: High-grade UC

name: Papillary architecture
description: Low-grade UC

name: "Translesional" vascularity
description: Vessels course *through* the abnormality (unlike fibroids, where vessels drape *around* the periphery).

name: "Venetian Blind" Shadowing
description: Linear acoustic shadowing (rain-shower appearance) without a distinct calcified mass.

name: Asymmetric myometrial thickening
description: Uneven thickening of the myometrium, often with the posterior wall thicker than the anterior wall.

name: Enlarged uterus with thickened walls
description: Non-specific finding.

name: Foci of high signal
description: Representing subacute hemorrhage within the ectopic glands (less common than in endometriosis) on T1-weighted images.

name: Globular uterine enlargement
description: Enlargement of the uterus in a globular shape.

name: Ill-defined, low signal intensity area (smooth muscle hyperplasia) containing scattered high T2 signal foci (cystic dilated glands)
description: Appearance on T2-weighted images.

name: Indistinct endometrial-myometrial border
description: Loss of clear demarcation between the endometrium and myometrium.

name: Lollipop Sign
description: Contrast filling diverticula that extend from the uterine cavity into the myometrium (low sensitivity).

name: Myometrial Cysts
description: Small (2–5 mm) anechoic or hypoechoic cysts within the myometrium (myometrial lacunae).

name: Subendometrial Echogenic Linear Striations
description: Invasion of endometrial glands.

name: Thickened Junctional Zone (JZ)
description: > 12 mm is diagnostic, 8-12 mm is indeterminate, < 8 mm is normal.

name: Avid enhancement
description: Post-contrast MRI shows avid enhancement, peaking at 60-90s arterial phase.

name: Heterogeneous hyperintensity
description: T2-weighted MRI shows heterogeneous hyperintensity in cellular fibroids.

name: High ADC
description: DWI/ADC shows high ADC (>1.2 x10⁻³ mm²/s) to differentiate from sarcoma.

name: Hyperechoic foci with shadowing
description: Ultrasound shows hyperechoic foci with shadowing, corresponding to calcifications (CT HU 100-300).

name: Hypointensity
description: Hypointense signal on T2-weighted imaging (80% of cases).

name: Isointense
description: T1-weighted MRI shows isointense signal (unless hemorrhagic, then T1 hyperintense).

name: RI < 0.5
description: Doppler ultrasound shows Resistive Index (RI) < 0.5.

name: -50 to -100 HU
description: Lipoleiomyoma with attenuation -50 to -100 HU on CT.

name: >100 HU
description: Calcified fibroids with attenuation >100 HU on CT.

name: 40-60 HU
description: Non-contrast CT attenuation of 40-60 HU, enhancing to 80-120 HU post-contrast.

name: Homogeneous T2 hypointensity
description: Hyaline degeneration with homogeneous T2 hypointensity on MRI.

name: Hypoechoic mass with Venetian blind shadowing
description: Hypoechoic mass with posterior acoustic shadowing on B-mode ultrasound.

name: Peripheral vascularity
description: Peripheral vascularity with RI 0.4-0.7 on Doppler ultrasound.

name: T1 hyperintense rim
description: Red degeneration with T1 hyperintense rim on MRI.

name: T2 hyperintense foci
description: Cystic degeneration with T2 hyperintense foci on MRI.

name: T2 hypointense mass
description: Well-circumscribed T2 hypointense mass on MRI.

name: ADC values 0.8-1.0 ×10⁻³ mm²/s
description: ADC values 0.8-1.0 ×10⁻³ mm²/s on DWI.

name: Central flow
description: Central flow with RI <0.4 on Doppler ultrasound.

name: Infiltrative margins
description: Infiltrative margins.

name: Low ADC
description: DWI/ADC shows low ADC value.

name: Necrosis
description: Necrosis.

name: Rapid growth
description: Rapid growth (>50% in 6 months).

name: Restricted diffusion
description: T2 hyperintensity with restricted diffusion on MRI.

name: Regurgitant fraction
description: Regurgitant fraction >40%

name: Vena contracta width
description: Vena contracta width >7mm

name: Contrast Extravasation
description: Active bleeding seen as contrast extravasation >90-100 HU on CT Angiography.

name: Portal hypertension
description: Pressure >12 mmHg at gastroesophageal junction

name: "Bag of worms" appearance
description: Cluster of dilated veins resembling a bag of worms.

name: "Hot cross bun" sign
description: Crossing of the left renal vein and superior mesenteric artery on coronal CT images, indicative of nutcracker anatomy.

name: Enhancing tubular structures
description: Dilated veins that enhance with contrast.

name: Flow voids on T2
description: Areas of signal loss on T2-weighted images due to rapid blood flow.

name: Post-contrast enhancement
description: Enhancement of the dilated veins after contrast administration.

name: Reflux
description: Reflux >1s (sensitivity 95%)

name: Reflux on Valsalva
description: Reversal of blood flow in the veins during Valsalva maneuver.

name: Serpiginous veins
description: Serpiginous veins >2-3mm (Valsalva)

name: Serpiginous veins posterior to testis
description: Dilated, tortuous veins located behind the testicle.

name: Valsalva flow reversal >1 cm/s
description: Flow reversal on Valsalva maneuver on ultrasound.

name: Vein dilation
description: Vein diameter >3mm

name: Veins >2 mm diameter
description: Size of veins on ultrasound.

name: Railroad track calcifications
description: Parallel linear calcifications in vessel walls

name: Tram-track calcification
description: Calcification of vascular walls.

name: Tram-track vascular walls
description: Calcification of vascular walls, HU range 150-300.

name: Confluent white matter hyperintensities (WMHs)
description: Fazekas score ≥2, Periventricular WMHs >10mm depth

name: Hypodensities in basal ganglia
description: HU: 20-25 vs. normal 30-40

name: Lacunes
description: >3mm

name: Microbleeds
description: Hypointense dots, <5mm, ≥3 lesions = high risk

name: Increased FDG uptake around graft
description: Increased FDG uptake surrounding the vascular graft.

name: False-positive DaTscan
description: DaTscan may show abnormal findings similar to Parkinson's disease.

name: Dark bands between dense objects
description: Dark bands between dense objects (e.g., hip prosthetics) due to beam hardening artifact.

name: Lumen narrowing
description: Visualization of narrowed vessel lumen on CT angiography.

name: Lumen narrowing
description: Visualization of narrowed vessel lumen on catheter angiography.

name: Lumen narrowing
description: Visualization of narrowed vessel lumen on MR angiography.

name: PSV ratio >2.0
description: Peak Systolic Velocity ratio >2.0 indicates at least moderate stenosis.

name: PSV ratio >3.0, damped waveform
description: Peak Systolic Velocity ratio >3.0 and damped waveform indicates severe stenosis.

name: PSV ratio 2.0-3.0
description: Peak Systolic Velocity ratio 2.0-3.0 indicates moderate stenosis.

name: Concentric Wall Thickening and Enhancement
description: Contrast enhancement of the vessel wall.

name: Increased Mean Flow Velocity (MFV)
description: TCD is used to detect and monitor vasospasm following SAH. TCD measures Time-Averaged Mean Maximum Velocity (TAMMV), often shortened to Mean Flow Velocity (MFV).

name: "Keyhole" appearance
description: Dilated MPVM and straight sinus.

name: Anechoic midline mass
description: Observed on neonatal head ultrasound.

name: Calcification in the wall of the varix
description: More common in older children/adults.

name: Diffuse atrophy and T2 hyperintensity
description: "Melting brain" appearance.

name: Dilatation of the straight sinus
description: Observed after contrast administration.

name: Dilated straight sinus and torcular herophili
description: Observed on neonatal head ultrasound.

name: Flat border along the tentorium
description: Characteristic finding on contrast-enhanced CT.

name: Hydrocephalus
description: Ventricular enlargement.

name: Hypoechoic midline cystic mass posterior to the third ventricle
description: Observed on prenatal ultrasound.

name: Intense, uniform enhancement of the varix and draining sinuses
description: Observed after contrast administration.

name: Low attenuation in white matter
description: Indicates ischemia/gliosis.

name: Mixed signal intensity
description: Suggests turbulent flow or partial thrombosis.

name: Prominent flow voids
description: Due to high-velocity blood flow.

name: Signal void within a patent prosencephalic varix
description: Indicates spontaneous thrombosis.

name: Turbulent, high-velocity flow
description: Distinguishes VGAM from arachnoid cyst.

name: Well-circumscribed, slightly hyperdense midline mass
description: Represents the blood pool.

name: Monophasic/Flat Hepatic Vein Waveform
description: Loss of pulsatility in the hepatic veins.

name: Phasic flow
description: <10 cm/s

name: Lobulated appearance
description: Often described as a 'bunch of grapes'.

name: T1 isointense to hypointense
description: Signal intensity on T1-weighted images is similar to or slightly lower than muscle.

name: T2/STIR hyperintensity
description: Diffusely hyperintense signal on T2/STIR sequences.

name: Venous drainage identification
description: Venography is crucial to identify dangerous venous drainage into deep systems.

name: Blooming artifacts
description: Blooming artifacts due to deoxyhemoglobin on SWI/GRE (90% sensitive).

name: Collateral veins
description: Corkscrew appearance of collateral veins on CT Venography.

name: Cortical hyperintensity
description: Venous congestion manifests as cortical hyperintensity on FLAIR.

name: Elevated venous velocities
description: Elevated venous velocities (>35 cm/s vs. normal 10-20 cm/s) on transcranial Doppler.

name: Filling defect (Empty Delta Sign)
description: Filling defect within the sinus on CT Venography, creating an 'empty delta' appearance (85% specificity).

name: Flow gap
description: Absence of normal flow signal within the sinus on MRV.

name: Hyperdense sinus
description: Sinus appears denser than normal (>70 HU vs. normal 30-40 HU) on non-contrast CT.

name: Hyperintense signal
description: Subacute thrombus appears hyperintense on T2WI.

name: Hyperintense signal
description: Subacute thrombus appears hyperintense on T1WI.

name: Hypointense signal
description: Acute thrombus appears hypointense on T2WI.

name: Isointense signal
description: Acute thrombus appears isointense on T1WI.

name: Loss of respiratory variation
description: Loss of respiratory variation in the straight sinus on transcranial Doppler.

name: Venous infarct
description: Gyral swelling, often non-hemorrhagic (60-70%), seen on non-contrast CT.

name: Collateral filling
description: Contrast filling collateral veins due to obstruction

name: Collaterals
description: Chronic stenosis appearance on ultrasound

name: Contracted vein
description: Chronic stenosis appearance on ultrasound

name: Echogenic thrombus/scarring
description: Chronic stenosis appearance on ultrasound

name: Filling defect
description: Lack of contrast filling the vein

name: Lack of flow
description: No contrast flow in the vein

name: Wall thickening
description: Chronic stenosis appearance on ultrasound

name: Filling defects, stenotic segments, or occlusions
description: Visualization of narrowing or blockage in the vein.

name: HU values: Venous thrombus = 20–40 HU (unenhanced), 300–400 HU (enhanced)
description: Density measurements of the thrombus on CT scans.

name: Luminal narrowing, thrombus (hyperdense on unenhanced images)
description: Narrowing of the vein lumen or presence of a blood clot.

name: Pressure gradient >30 mmHg
description: Elevated pressure difference across the stenotic segment.

name: Resistive index (RI) <0.7
description: Low resistive index in stenotic veins.

name: Signal loss on T2-weighted imaging
description: Indicates acute thrombus.

name: T2 hyperintensity in stenotic regions, thrombus (T1 hypointense, T2 hypointense)
description: Signal characteristics of the stenosis and thrombus on MRI sequences.

name: Turbulent flow, increased peak systolic velocity (PSV) >200 cm/s
description: Abnormal blood flow patterns and elevated velocity in the stenotic region.

name: Loss of phasicity
description: Absence of normal respiratory variation in venous flow, indicating obstruction.

name: RVEF <45%
description: Reduced right ventricular ejection fraction on cine SSFP MRI

name: Color Doppler turbulence at septum
description: Peak gradient >60 mmHg = severe

name: Increased pulmonary vascularity
description: Vessels visible in lateral 1/3 of lung; Right Descending PA diameter > Trachea diameter

name: LA/LV enlargement
description: Left Atrial (LA) and Left Ventricular (LV) enlargement

name: RV dilation
description: Due to increased pulmonary flow

name: Atrial width > 10 mm
description: Measured at the atrium (glomus) of the lateral ventricles. Mild: 10-12 mm, Moderate: 12-15 mm, Severe: > 15 mm

name: Acute/Subacute Fracture (MRI)
description: T1 hypointense signal replacing fatty marrow; T2/STIR hyperintense signal indicating bone marrow edema (>20-30% higher than adjacent normal vertebrae on STIR)

name: Bone fragments
description: Presence of fractured bone pieces.

name: Burst Fracture
description: Fracture involving the middle column of the vertebral body

name: Chronic Fracture (MRI)
description: T1 isointense or hyperintense; STIR isointense (no edema)

name: Contrast Enhancement
description: Intense enhancement with Gadolinium contrast, indicating hypervascularity/inflammation in acute/subacute fracture (0-3 months).

name: Cortical disruption
description: Fracture or break in the outer layer of the vertebral bone.

name: Cortical Integrity Assessment
description: CT is used for pre-procedural planning to assess cortical integrity of the vertebral body.

name: Focal Increased Uptake
description: Focal increased uptake on bone scan.

name: Fracture Line
description: Low signal band on T1-weighted images.

name: Kyphotic deformity
description: Abnormal curvature of the spine.

name: Loss of vertebral height (>20%)
description: Vertebral body height is reduced by more than 20% compared to normal.

name: Low signal on T1 post-contrast (bone marrow edema)
description: Decreased signal intensity on T1-weighted images after contrast administration, indicating bone marrow edema.

name: Marrow Edema
description: High signal on STIR or T2 Fat-Sat sequences, indicating acute or subacute fracture. Predicts positive clinical response to vertebral augmentation.

name: Posterior Vertebral Wall Retropulsion/Cortical Disruption
description: Indicates increased risk of epidural cement leakage during vertebral augmentation.

name: T1 hyperintensity (acute)
description: Increased signal intensity on T1-weighted images, indicating acute fracture.

name: T1 Hypointensity
description: Low signal intensity replacing normal fatty marrow on T1-weighted images, indicating acute/subacute fracture (0-3 months).

name: T1/T2 Isointensity
description: Isointense signal to normal marrow on T1 and T2-weighted images, indicating chronic fracture (>3-6 months) with return of fat signal and no edema.

name: T2 hyperintensity (edema)
description: Increased signal intensity on T2-weighted images, indicating edema.

name: T2/STIR Hyperintensity
description: High signal intensity on T2-weighted and STIR images, indicating bone marrow edema in acute/subacute fracture (0-3 months). Most important finding for patient selection for vertebroplasty.

name: Trabecular collapse
description: Collapse of the internal bony structure of the vertebra.

name: Wedge-shaped vertebral body
description: Vertebral body appears compressed anteriorly, creating a wedge shape.

name: Wedge Deformity
description: Anterior wedging of the vertebral body

name: Blastic Lesions
description: Intense uptake on Bone Scan

name: Blastic Lesions (CT)
description: Hounsfield Units (HU) 400-1000, Sclerotic rim, soft tissue component rare (15%)

name: Lytic Lesions
description: Photopenic on Bone Scan

name: Lytic Lesions (CT)
description: Hounsfield Units (HU) 20-80, 'Moth-eaten' cortical destruction, soft tissue component common (80%)

name: Malignancy
description: SUVmax >4.5

name: Marrow Replacement
description: T1 hypointense (replaces fatty marrow, normal marrow = 80-120ms T1)

name: Pedicle 'Owl's Eye' Sign
description: Unilateral pedicle destruction (earliest CT finding)

name: Restricted Diffusion
description: DWI: Restricted diffusion (ADC <1.1×10⁻³ mm²/s)

name: T2 Signal
description: Variable (hyperintense if lytic, hypointense if blastic)

name: Winking Owl Sign
description: Missing pedicle on AP view

name: Increased uptake
description: Focal increased uptake in the vertebral body.

name: Drooping Lily sign
description: Inferior displacement of duplicated lower pole moiety with calyceal axis >25° from vertical, seen on VCUG. Suggests ureterocele or duplicated collecting system with obstruction of the upper pole moiety.

name: Loss of corticomedullary differentiation
description: Indirect sign of VUR on Ultrasound

name: Massive dilation + intrarenal reflux
description: Grade V VUR on VCUG

name: Mild calyceal blunting
description: Grade III VUR on VCUG (fornices remain sharp)

name: Pelviectasis
description: Dilation of the renal pelvis.

name: Reflux
description: Contrast moving retrograde into the ureter/kidney.

name: Reflux into ureter only
description: Grade I VUR on VCUG

name: Reflux to renal pelvis without dilation
description: Grade II VUR on VCUG

name: Renal length >2SD above age-adjusted mean
description: Indirect sign of VUR on Ultrasound

name: Tortuous ureter + renal pelvis dilation (>15mm)
description: Grade IV VUR on VCUG

name: Ureteral diameter >7mm
description: Indirect sign of VUR on Ultrasound

name: Ureteral dilation
description: Distal ureter > 6-7 mm.

name: Urothelial thickening
description: Thickening of the urothelium.

name: Enhancing CPA mass
description: T1 C+ enhancing mass in the cerebellopontine angle

name: Foraminal expansion
description: Enlargement of the internal auditory canal or other skull base foramina.

name: IAC widening
description: IAC widening >2mm vs contralateral side

name: "Dumbbell" shape through IAC
description: 85% cases

name: Cerebellar peduncle compression angle <120°
description: vs. meningioma >120°

name: Cystic changes
description: T1+C, 10-15% of cases

name: Hyperintense "ice cream cone"
description: T2WI, IAC + CPA components

name: Intense enhancement
description: T1+C, 98% of cases

name: Internal auditory canal (IAC) widening
description: >8 mm (normal: 4–7 mm)

name: Iso/hypointense to brain
description: T1WI

name: No diffusion restriction
description: DWI

name: Peritumoral edema
description: FLAIR, in 20% of cases

name: Porus acusticus "trumpet" shape
description: trumpet shape of the porus acusticus

name: Soft tissue density in IAC/CPA
description: Hounsfield Units (HU): 30–50 HU

name: "Soap bubble" or "cauliflower-like" surface pattern
description: Sessile mass

name: Coffee bean sign (sigmoid)
description: 75% sensitive for sigmoid volvulus

name: Whirl sign
description: 88% specific for volvulus

name: Obstructive ischemia with increased intraluminal pressure >50cm H₂O
Lymphatic Channel Visualization
description: A linear trail of activity leading away from the injection site.

name: Sentinel Node Identification
description: The first 'hot' node visualized in a lymphatic basin.

name: Increased focal uptake
description: Increased tracer accumulation in a localized area within the salivary gland.

name: Retained tracer (hot spot)
description: Persistent tracer accumulation in the tumor region.

name: Retention sign
description: Indicates tracer retention within the tumor.

name: Cystic areas
description: Cystic areas (10-40% of volume)

name: T1 signal intensity
description: Hyperintense cysts (protein-rich)

name: "Cigar-shaped" or linear hypodensities
description: Deep watershed infarcts in subacute phase (24-72 hrs), located in the centrum semiovale running parallel to the lateral ventricles

name: "Rosary Bead" Pattern
description: Multiple, small, discrete, circular lesions arranged linearly in the centrum semiovale, specific to internal watershed infarcts

name: Encephalomalacia and volume loss
description: Chronic phase finding in border zones

name: Hyperintensity
description: Develops over 6-12 hours

name: Loss of gray-white differentiation
description: Subtle finding in acute phase (0-6 hrs)

name: Mismatch (PWI defect > DWI defect)
description: Indicates a large penumbra of tissue at risk due to hypoperfusion

name: Restricted diffusion (bright signal)
description: Seen within minutes of infarct

name: Tmax > 6s
description: Indicates hypoperfusion

name: Wedge-shaped hypodensities
description: Cortical watershed infarcts in subacute phase (24-72 hrs), located between arterial territories

name: Cortical Involvement
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintensity in the cortex (precentral gyrus), seen in non-alcoholic WE.

name: Cranial Nerve Nuclei Involvement
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintensity in the vestibular and abducens nuclei, seen in non-alcoholic WE.

name: Floor of 4th Ventricle Hyperintensity
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintensity in the floor of the 4th ventricle.

name: Mammillary Body Enhancement
description: T1 post-contrast enhancement of the mammillary bodies, indicating acute WE.

name: Mammillary Body Hyperintensity
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintensity in the mammillary bodies. Most specific finding.

name: Medial Thalami Hyperintensity
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintensity along the third ventricle walls.

name: Periaqueductal Gray Hyperintensity
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintensity in the periaqueductal gray.

name: Restricted Diffusion
description: Bright DWI, dark ADC, indicating cytotoxic edema. Often the earliest sign.

name: Splenium Involvement
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintensity in the splenium, seen in non-alcoholic WE.

name: Subtle Low Density in Medial Thalami
description: May be seen, but CT is generally insensitive.

name: Symmetric T2/FLAIR hyperintensity
description: Bilateral, symmetric hyperintensity in medial thalami, mammillary bodies, periaqueductal gray, tectal plate, and floor of the 4th ventricle.

name: Tectal Plate Hyperintensity
description: T2/FLAIR hyperintensity in the tectal plate.

name: Claw sign
description: Compressed renal parenchyma around the mass

name: Hyperintense with hypointense pseudocapsule
description: T2-weighted MRI

name: Hypointense to renal parenchyma
description: T1-weighted MRI

name: IVC thrombus
description: Vascular invasion in 4-10% of cases

name: Large, well-circumscribed mass
description: Heterogeneous echotexture, hypoechoic areas (necrosis), calcifications (15% cases)

name: Less enhancement than normal kidney
description: 80-120 HU vs 120-150 HU on post-contrast CT

name: Pseudocapsule
description: Higher attenuation pseudocapsule on pre-contrast CT

name: Restricted diffusion
description: ADC 0.8-1.1 ×10⁻³ mm²/s on DWI

name: Soft tissue attenuation
description: 20-40 HU on pre-contrast CT

name: Face of the giant panda sign
description: Midbrain tegmentum appearance on T2 resembling panda face from copper deposition

name: Auditory Pathway Involvement
description: Involves the lateral lemniscus and medial geniculate bodies.

name: Confluent T2 hyperintensity
description: Starting in the splenium of the corpus callosum and spreading laterally into the occipital white matter.

name: Leading Edge Enhancement
description: A zone of active demyelination/inflammation at the periphery of the lesion shows contrast enhancement.

name: U-fiber sparing
description: U-fibers are typically spared.

name: Faceless kidney
description: Complete replacement of renal parenchyma by inflammatory mass

name: Severe Microcephaly
description: Often with a collapsed skull

name: Punctate calcifications at grey-white matter junction
description: Subcortical calcifications.
